13.title: Weekly Consulting Snapshot #3: AI’s Ubiquity at CES, Wall Street’s AI Boom, and Blockchain Innovations
13.description: Explore the impact of AI at CES 2025, Wall Street's AI-driven surge, and the fusion of blockchain and AI in emerging projects.
13.spr_content: - **CES 2025**: Showcased AI advancements; Nvidia CEO highlighted powerful AI chips for PCs; AI's presence in smart glasses, health-tracking rings, and home gadgets.<hr />- **AI Integration**: AI transforming everyday life; no longer a futuristic concept.<hr />- **Economic Impact**: AI driving Wall Street's bull run; S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq near-record highs.<hr />- **Tech Leaders**: Nvidia surpassed $3 trillion market value, 170% gain; Tesla regained $1 trillion valuation; AI momentum is key market driver despite economic recovery factors.<hr />- **Networking Sector**: Companies like Broadcom, Cisco, Arista, and Marvell benefitting from AI-driven demand; essential for digital infrastructure supporting AI operations.<hr />- **Investment Banks**: Utilizing AI for efficiency; Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, UBS automating tasks traditionally done by junior staff; shift enhances strategic focus.<hr />- **AI Job Trends in Australia**: 35% decline in AI job postings reflects market shifts; reasons include unmet ROI, talent saturation, preference for third-party solutions, tech sector slowdown, evolving skill demands.<hr />- **AI and Blockchain Fusion**: Emerging projects in 2025 combining AI with blockchain; initiatives like ai16z and meme-based *Fartcoin* indicative of creative exploration.<hr />- **Forbes Crypto Predictions**: <hr />  - **AI Agents on Blockchain**: Enhance transparency and trust; application in gaming and content creation.<hr />  - **SocialFi Growth**: Rise of cryptocurrencies with social utility; community-driven value creation.<hr />  - **Web3 Gaming Revival**: Decentralization helps reduce user acquisition costs; revitalizes gaming industry.<hr />  - **Broader Adoption**: Web3 reshaping traditional business models, promoting industry-wide engagement beyond just infrastructure improvements.

14.title: What's New in July 2021
14.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. July 2021 we will move toward blockchain industry and prepare for performance review in August.
14.spr_content: - **July Highlights**: Significant updates as we conclude July.<hr />- **Pandemic Alert**: Covid cases exceeding 100k; necessary to prioritize safety.<hr />- **WFH Shipment**: Completion of working from home equipment to enhance remote work setup since no annual trip.<hr />- **Fleeting Notes Reward**: Dwarves shared $1000 for contributions to the brainery; continued engagement appreciated.<hr />- **Office Hours**: Weekly Q&A with CEO on Fridays; support and guidance offered on various topics.<hr />- **Blockchain Engagement**: Partnership with Legend of Fantasy War; entry into NFT gaming.<hr />- **Notion OS**: Transition to Notion for documentation; categorized structure for improved accessibility.<hr />- **Upcoming Initiatives**: Study group for IoT and embedded applications led by Trung & Hieu; performance reviews commencing.<hr />- **Value Alignment**: Emphasis on personal growth and contribution to team goals; importance of understanding value fit.<hr />- **Hiring Focus**: Actively recruiting senior-level positions for team enhancement; referrals encouraged.<hr />- **Image Update**: Reminder to refresh social media profiles to reflect team identity.

15.title: What's New in January 2022
15.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. January 2022 will go over performance review and our growth on projects, new year highlights.
15.spr_content: - **Project Overview**: Launch of MStation, first BSCS Metaverse blockchain game on Binance Smart Chain. Players engage in character summoning, mining missions, protection quests, and loot collection for play-to-earn.<hr />- **Team Expansion**: Current team of 6, led by Ngọc Thành, with Khai Le as part-time PM. Current upselling requests indicate a need for additional team members. Incentives for referrals offered.<hr />- **Performance Review Timeline**: Self-review notes received. 1-1 meetings scheduled post-Lunar New Year. Final performance results to be communicated before March.<hr />- **Brainery Initiative Resumption**: Resuming Brainery Repo in 2022; formatting and clean-up ongoing. New writing guidelines in development. Reward mechanism for presenters reinstated. Ops Team collecting notes for knowledge retention.<hr />- **Profit-Sharing & Bonuses**: Remittance via Viet Nam bank & TWise for those with 24+ months tenure. Profit-sharing reflects collective effort and is part of team culture. Updates available in Dwarves Handbook.<hr />- **Flight Ticket Policy**: Flight package for full-time members with 6+ months tenure. 4 trips/year; max reimbursement of 2,000,000 VND per trip. Destinations include Da Lat and Da Nang, with potential for Ha Noi soon. Booking receipts required for processing.<hr />- **Team Social Events**: Monthly sponsored team dinners to resume post-Covid, ensuring participation across HCMC, Hanoi, and Danang. Facetime options available for broader engagement. Ops will cover full expenses.<hr />- **Lunar New Year Gifts**: Delivery of gift sets to express gratitude and usher in the Year of the Tiger. Aiming for collective success in 2022.

16.title: Navigating changes
16.description: The last tech cycle is ending, and we're already in the new normal. We are not in the best shape to compete with certain competitors, especially with a new market meta emerging. We are now in a future of new automation paradigms via AI and assets are moving on-chain.
16.spr_content: 1. Innovation is a core motivation; focus shifts from maintenance to value-driven projects.  <hr />2. Global competition in technology demands top-tier talent; some are lagging behind.  <hr />3. Recent AI and blockchain opportunities missed due to lack of project leadership; imbalanced workloads evident.  <hr />4. Easy money during ZIRP fosters complacency; results over past achievements are necessary for adaptation.  <hr />5. The previous tech cycle has ended; the new normal presents emerging market challenges.  <hr />6. Global shift towards AI and on-chain assets; traditional software demand is declining.  <hr />7. Need to regroup and focus on growth strategies moving forward.  <hr />8. **Consulting Team:** Engagement not guaranteed; non-contributing members may face changes, including breaks for skill improvement.  <hr />9. **Lab Team:** Central role preserved with heightened emphasis on innovation; increased rewards for active contributions expected.  <hr />10. New lab hires must excel in exploration, writing, and application of ideas.  <hr />11. **Community:** Strength in relationships; maintain Dwarves brand legacy.  <hr />12. Discord as a learning hub; alumni to receive permanent @d.foundation email aliases.  <hr />13. **Recap:**   <hr />   - Innovation market evolving; target customers shifting to Blockchain, AI, Data.  <hr />   - Changing consulting member requirements; non-contributors may need to adapt within 15/30 days or face breaks.  <hr />   - Team leaders will curate their strongest teams (A-teams).

17.title: What's New in August 2024
17.description: Each month, we release a recap highlighting key updates and progress within our team and community. August updates highlight AI tools, enhanced community discussions, the sum command upgrade, Go enterprise MOC insights, and earning dfg tokens through contributions.
17.spr_content: - **AI's Influence:** Tools like **Cursor** and **Claude 3.5 Sonnet** are revolutionizing programming by transitioning manual coding to AI-assisted environments.<hr />- **Generative Apps:** AI capabilities allow for the creation of mini apps from simple prompts, enhancing the app development landscape.<hr />- **Efficiency Gains:** Amazon's GenAI assistant reduces upgrade times and costs, automating 79% of code reviews.<hr />- **Prompt Caching:** Anthropic’s technology reduces costs by 90%, important for applications requiring repeated contexts, like chatbots.<hr />- **Structured Outputs:** OpenAI mandates adherence to JSON schemas, elevating standards in industries like healthcare and finance.<hr />- **UI Development Acceleration:** Tools like **shadcn** and **v0.dev** enhance frontend development with AI-driven prototyping.<hr />  <hr />- **Community Engagement Growth:** Introduction of monthly learning activities has stimulated real discussions and contributions within memo notes and OGIF office hours.<hr />- **Fortress Bot Feature:** New feature enhances visibility of available ICY for team engagements.<hr />- **Acknowledgments:** Recognition of key contributors in the community promotes ongoing collaboration and engagement.<hr />  <hr />- **Enhanced `sum` Command:** The upgraded **`sum` command** delivers quicker summaries highlighting key insights and knowledge nuggets.<hr />- **Go Enterprise MOC:** Phat Nguyen's compilation provides insight into utilizing Golang for addressing enterprise challenges, with ongoing commentary shared weekly.<hr />  <hr />- **dfg Token Evolution:** The **dfg token** is now a reward mechanism for team contributions, transitioning from a private stock concept to a community incentive, related to ICY coins. ICY will be integrated into future token earnings.

18.title: What's New in November 2024
18.description: In November, we sharpened our focus with advancements in platform engineering, introduced streamlined service packages, elevated ICY rewards for impactful contributions, and embraced key insights from market shifts, all building momentum as we gear up for our Penang retreat.
18.spr_content: - **Building Smarter Systems:** Focus on platform & data engineering; creating a second brain for enhanced decision-making and knowledge sharing.<hr />- **OGIF Weekly Sharing:** Updates aligned with team priorities; fostering deeper learning through focused, collaborative sessions.<hr />- **AI Copilot Tools:** Streamlining work processes with AI tools; enhancing team productivity and collaboration.<hr />- **Market Adaptation:** Addressing client demands; focus on Blockchain, Data, Platform, and AI/LLM skills.<hr />- **Market Insights:** Continuously tracking trends; delivering weekly updates to maintain team alignment and responsiveness.<hr />- **New Service Offerings:** Tailored service packages designed around client needs; focus on practical, impactful solutions.<hr />- **Increased ICY Rewards:** Recognizing quality contributions in knowledge sharing; incentivizing impactful inputs with higher rewards.<hr />- **Networking Opportunities:** Engaging with industry through summits and meetups; cultivating valuable relationships and insights.<hr />- **Company Retreat in Penang:** Scheduled for December 14-17, 2024; combining team bonding with cultural and recreational experiences.<hr />- **Open Positions:** Recruitment ongoing for Full-stack Engineer, Marketing Executive, and Business Development roles; invitation to join the team.

19.title: What's New in September 2024
19.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's strides forward. September's updates spotlight the AI Club launch, rewards for our sharing culture, hybrid work check-ins, reporting tech trends in forward engineering, and our Mid-Autumn celebration.
19.spr_content: - AI-Club launched as a hub for AI/LLM exploration and collaboration. <hr />- Focus on productivity through building AI agents and projects. <hr />- Copilot Bounties offer rewards for impactful AI contributions.<hr />- Monthly rewards culture established with $4000 pool, prioritizing AI/LLM contributions.<hr />- Contributions include tech links, OGIF talks, and open-source projects.<hr />- Triple rewards for AI/LLM-related inputs incentivize knowledge sharing.<hr />- Return to office with automated check-ins to foster team connectivity.<hr />- Check-in rewards with ICY as a morale booster, thanking contributors.<hr />- Q3 tech roundup highlights advancements in LLM prototyping and tools.<hr />- Key insights on structured outputs, Golang updates, and blockchain exploration.<hr />- Mid-Autumn Festival celebrated with mooncakes, emphasizing tradition and connection.

20.title: Culture Test
20.description: Here's the culture test created during the market challenges of late 2024. It is designed to highlight and reinforce the cultural values at Dwarves Foundation. It’s a chance to reflect, share, and show how you fit into our team.
20.spr_content: - Culture test for Dwarves: Focuses on cultural values amidst late 2024 challenges.<hr />- Goal: Understand collaboration and contributions; honesty and alignment with Dwarves Foundation spirit emphasized.<hr />- Scoring: 60+ points considered qualified; emphasis on genuine responses over scores.<hr />- Language options: Responses in Vietnamese or English allowed.<hr />- Submission format: Multiple Markdown files (.md); submit via gist.github.com link.<hr /><hr />1. **Warm-Up (10 pts)**:<hr />   - Choose a reflective prompt; options include prideful moments, influential people, health choices, personal tears, or mastery achievements.<hr /><hr />2. **Culture (20 pts)**:<hr />   - Select one topic:<hr />     a) _Pressure makes diamonds:_<hr />        - Personal experience: Stress leading to success.<hr />        - Reflection: Value of adversity in growth.<hr />     b) _Like attracts like:_<hr />        - Personal experience: Connections built on shared values.<hr />        - Reflection: Influence of environment on personal behavior.<hr />     c) _No mud, no lotus:_<hr />        - Personal experience: Growth from difficult experiences.<hr />        - Reflection: Necessity of struggle for enlightenment.<hr /><hr />3. **Knowledge (30 pts)**:<hr />   - Roles in design, development, sales, project management, and leadership leveraging LLMs to enhance workflows.<hr />   - Provide demonstration or example of application.<hr /><hr />4. **Productivity (40 pts)**:<hr />   - Choose one:<hr />     a) Identify and implement relevant productivity technique for position.<hr />     b) Design workflow or agent using Dify.<hr /><hr />5. **Optional (Bonus 10 pts each)**:<hr />   - a) Use LLMs for rapid learning in new domains, provide an example.<hr />   - b) Leverage LLMs to identify knowledge gaps or uncover unknowns.

21.title: Weekly Digest #11: Come grow with us
21.description: Things are always cooking on our Discord. So grab a virtual seat at our table, pour yourself a cup of something tasty, and read the digest. If you're reading this, why not pop into the woodland and say hello? We'd love to meet you.
21.spr_content: - Discord community engagement thrives; virtual openness invites interaction.<hr />- Weekly updates from memo.d.foundation highlight significant growth in publications.<hr />- Noteworthy contributions: <hr />  - Dynamic Liquidity Market Maker on Solana by @huymaius.<hr />  - Introduction of Solana Token 2022 standard.<hr />  - Effective communication tips for ChatGPT by @minhcloud.<hr />- ICY rewards incentivize publishing and knowledge sharing; contributions welcome.<hr />- Fleeting notes reintroduced for concise tech insights; monthly 3000 ICY pool for contributors.<hr />- Surge in tech sharing evident; additional support through designated channels.<hr />- Annual health check-up reminders for Ho Chi Minh City; deadlines extended to July 15.<hr />- New t-shirt designs available at HadoHQ; limited-edition items encouraged.<hr />- Discussion of potential 30% profit through Uniswap yield farming; insights shared by @phucld.<hr />- Econ-café deep dive on TCB bonus shares and market implications led by COO @nikki.<hr />- Birthday celebrations for @tieubao and @minhlq; community support highlighted.<hr />- Emphasis on positivity and community enjoyment at the close of the dispatch.

22.title: Weekly Digest #13: More than lines of code
22.description: Welcome to this week's edition of our roundup, where we highlight the moments that make us more than just lines of code. This week, we're jet-setting around the world with our team's summer adventures, introducing new memo features, cheering for a beloved teammate's new chapter in the US, and celebrating new born. From beachside workspaces to anime figurine collections, we've got it all.
22.spr_content: - Weekly roundup: highlighting team culture beyond code. <hr />- Summer adventures: global locations, personal touches, team experiences. <hr />- Memo Tools: <hr />  - Streamlined submission for all team members. <hr />  - Commands: `?memo pr`, `?memo list` for updates. <hr />  - Discord webhook notifications for new PRs.<hr />  - Fleet notes submission via Discord; ICY distribution automation. <hr />  - Call for increased contributions; collective team engagement encouraged.<hr />- Summer snapshots: showcase diverse work environments and personal interests from Swiss mountains to anime collections. <hr />- Farewell to teammate Hieu Phan: cherished memories in Vietnam, embarking on a journey in the US, maintaining team connections. <hr />- Celebrating new birth: congratulations to @thanh on family addition; team camaraderie with playful anticipation for future announcements. <hr />- Digest reflects team spirit: sharing memos, moments, and milestones enriches community.

23.title: Weekly Digest #14: Embracing hybrid work - the best of both worlds
23.description: Discover how Dwarves embraces hybrid working, blending flexibility with in-person connections. Learn how our office space fosters productivity, learning, and real collaboration, even if it’s just for a day or two a week.
23.spr_content: - Dwarves values flexibility in work environment; hybrid model fosters collaboration.<hr />- Office serves as a hub for learning, sharing, and renewed energy.<hr />- Distinction of Dwarves office: support for varying work preferences; not every environment suits everyone.<hr />- Workspaces designed for comfort and adaptability; equipped with high-quality tech and furniture.<hr />- Productivity enhanced with perks: high-speed internet, quiet rooms, meal subsidies, and 24/7 access.<hr />- Daily office check-in incentivized with 5 ICY tokens; promotes engagement and presence.<hr />- Real-world interactions facilitate spontaneous knowledge sharing; learning is organic and experiential.<hr />- Team members motivated to return by enriched connections and opportunities for face-to-face engagement.<hr />- Testimonials highlight effectiveness of mentor culture, improved focus, and balanced work-life integration.<hr />- Office culture emphasizes smart work over hard work; collaborative idea sharing leads to growth.<hr />- Early adopters of the office environment find increased productivity and community feel.<hr />- Collective growth emphasized; goal is to create a supportive ecosystem for all team members.

24.title: Weekly Digest #15: New year Gathering: Sharing Tết, starting strong
24.description: Tết break came to an end, and the Dwarves team reunited to share stories, reconnect, and kick off the Year of the Snake in style. We brought it all back to Discord, along with a little SOL & ICY drop to start the year right.
24.spr_content: - Community gathering post-Tết.<hr />- Airdrop of SOL and ICY tokens.<hr />- Reintegration of community in Dwarves culture.<hr />- Discord activity with Tết stories and updates.<hr />- Shift from tech talk to personal anecdotes.<hr />- Discussions about lucky money, family gatherings, and food comas from bánh chưng and bánh tét.<hr />- Sharing of experiences with traditional New Year games.<hr />- Engagement in late-night card games with competitive spirits.<hr />- Photo sharing of diverse holiday experiences: beaches, mountains, reunions, and feasts.<hr />- Travel explorations versus returning to comforting familiarity.<hr />- Emphasis on reconnecting with family and tradition during the break.<hr />- Some participants focused on relaxation and personal time.<hr />- Transition back to work with renewed energy.<hr />- Introduction of the Year of the Snake.

25.title: Weekly Digest #9: A little more speed for summer
25.description: How quickly the first half of the year speeds up before it slows down. It’s really the second half of 2024 already. Time flies when you're having a blast. Get ready to rewind and relive some of the awesome highlights from the last week, get pumped for the epic things we'll do together before this year is over.
25.spr_content: - Time perception shifts as the first half of the year accelerates into the second half of 2024. <hr />- Anticipate reflections on recent highlights and upcoming experiences.<hr />- Gratitude expressed for community meet-up despite adverse weather conditions; strong turnout fueled energy and connection.<hr />- Last week’s activities included café conversations, BBQ enjoyment, and a wedding celebration, enhancing camaraderie.<hr />- Concerns arise about GenAI's impact on software engineering careers; mixed developer reactions to AI software engineer, Devin.<hr />- Constructive perspective: GenAI can streamline basic coding tasks, allowing human developers to hone complex skills and embrace richer career prospects.<hr />- Adoption of rewards system in the 💻・tech channel, incentivizing knowledge sharing and engagement through ICY rewards.<hr />- Celebrations for personal milestones and achievements, fostering community bonds and support; joyful wishes for new beginnings.<hr />- Reminiscing on cherished moments shared among team members, emphasizing the value of laughter and joy.<hr />- Encouragement to explore previous highlights for continuity and nostalgia.

26.title: Forward Engineering 2022
26.description: We want to demonstrate and encourage individual and organizational learning, where both gaining and sharing knowledge is prioritized, valued, and rewarded. Learning is an ongoing process that never ends in our fast-moving industry.
26.spr_content: - **Learning Culture:** Dwarves Foundation prioritizes learning and innovation within the organization.<hr />- **Growth Mindset:** Emphasizing belief in personal growth through experience and study.<hr />- **Encouragement of Questions:** Fostering an environment where asking questions and admitting ignorance is welcomed.<hr />- **Cross-Department Collaboration:** Opportunities beyond typical roles, e.g., conferences and new projects.<hr />- **Knowledge Sharing:** Every employee is valued as a teacher, sharing knowledge formally and informally.<hr />- **Supportive Framework:** Commitment to provide necessary tools, education, and training for success.<hr />- **Learning Events:** <hr />  1. **Monday's Radio Talk:** Platform for sharing thoughts on various topics.<hr />  2. **Friday's Showcase:** Weekly presentations of recent work.<hr />  3. **Brainery:** Focused on fostering a habit of public learning and improvement.<hr />  4. **R&D Topics:** Hub for tackling common challenges and promoting continuous learning.<hr />  5. **Dwarves Rewind:** Curated weekly list of industry news and discussions.<hr />  <hr />- **Brainery Development:** Evolved since August 2021, significant growth of the knowledge graph noted.<hr />- **Trending Tags:** Reflecting interests in frontend, backend, data, and community contributions.<hr />- **New Contributors Recognition:** Acknowledgment of individuals enriching the knowledge base.<hr />- **R&D Initiatives:** Addressing common challenges like multilingual application support, database management, and concurrency.<hr />- **Completed Challenge:** Implementation of **Feature Flags** for managing application features.<hr />- **Emerging Challenges:** Focus on cryptocurrency systems, Layer 2 designs, and blockchain support.<hr />- **Research Topics:** Ongoing exploration within Software Design, including database strategies and modeling practices.<hr />- **Dwarves Rewind:** Weekly aggregate of trending topics, industry changes, and reflective queries.<hr />- **Future Questions:** Continuous pondering on the impact of technological advancements and their socio-economic implications, such as job security in tech layoffs and the legality of training AI on copyrighted material.

27.title: Forward Engineering Quarter 3, 2024
27.description: In Q3/2024 Forward Engineering, we explore new tech stacks, engineering excellence, and key trends from the tech market over the past three months, with a focus on AI. Learn about tools like Dify, LangGraph, RAG, and more as we share our experiments and insights. Whether you’re interested in AI-driven workflows or tech market trends like the surge in AI startups and hiring demand.
27.spr_content: - **Dwarves' Mission:** Technology passion, creation, study, testing, open-source, innovation for all.<hr />  <hr />- **Forward Engineering Issue:** Explores experiments with tech stacks, insights on engineering excellence, reflections on tech market trends. AI remains central in discussions.<hr /><hr />- **Tech Radar Highlights:**<hr />  - **Dify (Adopt):** Open-source platform for LLM applications; simplifies workflow orchestration, intuitive design, rapid prototyping.<hr />  - **LangGraph (Assess):** Library for stateful, multi-actor LLM applications; enhances task division and agent management through graph structuring.<hr />  - **RAG (Adopt):** Retrieval-Augmented Generation enhances AI with external data; integrates proprietary information efficiently into LLM models.<hr />  - **LangSmith (Trial):** Focus on production reliability; features debugging and automated testing capabilities, still in early adoption phase.<hr />  - **Cursor (Assess):** AI-enhanced IDE inspired by VS Code; boosts coding efficiency, context awareness, still requires further exploration.<hr />  - **Devbox (Trial):** Simplified development environments without Docker; enhances developer experience, needs some Nix familiarity.<hr />  - **Shadcn/ui (Trial):** Modular, customizable UI components; speeds up development, maintains consistency through Tailwind.<hr /><hr />- **Tech Trends (Q3 2024):** <hr />  - Surge in tech layoffs, indicating long-term market restructuring.<hr />  - Shift towards "boring" tech, monolithic architectures, Full Stack development emphasizes stability.<hr />  - Job competition high; AI tools increasingly essential in coding processes.<hr /><hr />- **AI's Impact:** AI transforming programming practices, reducing costs, enabling solo ventures, emergence of "AI employees," need for AI skill proficiency in hires.<hr /><hr />- **Y Combinator Insight:** 72% of current startups focus on AI; trend indicates fundamental shift in business operations, with AI as differentiator.<hr /><hr />- **Future Considerations:** <hr />  - Data ownership crucial for competitive advantage; regulating data use in training essential.<hr />  - AI integration leads to new job roles centered around supervision and ethics.<hr /><hr />- **Further Reading:**<hr />  - Various technical insights, design patterns, programming language observations, and ongoing trends in the tech and AI landscape.

28.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 01
28.description: For this edition, the theme is to get the whole team used to the concept of a central knowledge base, every study to expand our view to the tech scene counts. The design team also has a place to contribute and discuss their practices.
28.spr_content: - **Dwarves Tech Radar**: Launched January 2020; first written exploration of tech trends.<hr />- **Objective**: Establish a central knowledge base; involve the entire team, including design.<hr />- **Volume 01**: Ten reports on key technologies and practices.<hr /><hr />### Language & Framework<hr />- **WebAssembly**: Enhances web app performance; critical for multimedia tasks.<hr />- **Progressive Web App (PWA)**: Combines capabilities of native apps and web apps; single codebase for all devices.<hr />- **Three.js**: Library for 3D animations; utilized in audio visualization projects.<hr />- **Istio**: Service mesh with complex features; adoption on hold due to current infrastructure limits.<hr />- **SwiftUI**: Declarative UI framework; early-stage development for iOS 15 projects.<hr />- **XPC Service**: Manages inter-process communication; improves app resilience and security.<hr /><hr />### Practices & Approach<hr />- **Software Reusability**: Focuses on leveraging existing systems; reduces costs and accelerates delivery.<hr />- **CLI Assistant**: A tool to streamline code information retrieval; aids in debugging.<hr />- **Gestalt UI Principles**: Framework for UI design focusing on usability and performance; encourages creative freedom.<hr />- **Go-routine**: Central to Go's concurrency model; enhances system performance.<hr />- **Applied Security in SSH, SSL, Blockchain**: Emphasizes understanding security beyond frameworks; highlights responsibility in implementation.<hr />- **AARRR Funnel**: Metrics-driven approach to product development; minimizes risks associated with business goals.<hr />- **Blockchain for Designers**: Focuses on transparency and efficiency; crucial for UX design to facilitate user adoption.<hr />- **Remote UX Testing**: Adapts usability testing to remote settings; enhances user experience despite challenges.<hr /><hr />### Future Directions<hr />- Continuous improvement through contributions and feedback; emphasizes innovation, craftsmanship, and teamwork.<hr />- Tech Radar as a living document; updates to follow emerging trends and technologies.<hr />- Commitment to employee education on latest developments; aims for business competitiveness.

29.title: Build your knowledge base
29.description: In an age where Large Language Models like ChatGPT offer instant access to a universe of information, it raises the question, does our own personal knowledge base still hold any value, and is building a personal knowledge base still a legitimate thing to do?
29.spr_content: - Large Language Models provide instant information access; they transform knowledge consumption.<hr />- Personal knowledge bases remain vital in this context; they offer unique value.<hr />- A personal knowledge base is like a curated mixtape; it captures individual insights and preferences.<hr />- AI delivers quick answers, but sifting through irrelevant content can be inefficient.<hr />- A knowledge base reflects familiarity with material; it is a tool for precision in retrieval.<hr />- Reading and skimming produce different levels of understanding; mastering information requires deeper engagement.<hr />- Innovation thrives on unique connections; personal knowledge bases enable synthesis of disparate ideas.<hr />- Authenticity differentiates human insights from AI-generated content; the personal touch is essential.<hr />- A personal knowledge base embodies ownership and identity in a world of abundance.<hr />- Cultivating personal knowledge is crucial for personal growth and success in an AI-driven landscape.

30.title: Collaboration Guideline
30.description: guidelines for project collaboraton DF and Client
30.spr_content: - **Project Collaboration Guidelines**: Structure for teamwork between Development Firm (DF) and Clients.<hr />- **Tools**:<hr />  - Project management: Basecamp.<hr />  - Sprint management: Jira/Basecamp.<hr />  - Communication: Google Meet.<hr />  - Source control: Github/Gitlab.<hr />  - Design tools: Figma/Sketch.<hr />  <hr />- **Schedule**:<hr />  - Kick-off meeting: 1 session.<hr />  - Sprint duration: 1 to 2 weeks.<hr />  - Planning and review meetings: 1 per sprint.<hr />  - Daily standups: As needed via Basecamp or communication channel.<hr />  - Feedback meetings: Weekly or bi-weekly with Account Manager.<hr />  - Meeting notes: Disseminated within 30 minutes post-meeting.<hr /><hr />- **Workflow**:<hr />  - **Project Management**:<hr />    - All members engage in Sprint planning.<hr />    - Document milestones/features on Jira/Basecamp.<hr />    - New features/requests placed in Icebox/Backlog for future sprints.<hr />    - Bugs prioritized for current Sprint based on assessment.<hr />    - Aim for “Potentially Shippable” software in every Sprint.<hr />    - Bi-weekly review meeting for progress and conflict resolution.<hr /><hr />  - **Design & Development Collaboration**:<hr />    - Design: Provide color palette, font sizes, base components.<hr />    - Design review by development prior to sprints.<hr /><hr />  - **Backend & Frontend Integration**:<hr />    - Essential: API documentation, development/staging/production environments.<hr />    - CORS enabled on API.<hr />    - Agreement on glossary, naming conventions, and data schema within first Sprint.<hr /><hr />  - **Quality Assurance**:<hr />    - Bugs must include reproduction steps, affected platforms, and severity level.<hr />    - Dedicated testing environments for frontend features before merging.<hr /><hr />- **Release Process**:<hr />  - Releases occur at Sprint's end, with hotfixes as needed.<hr />  - Include semantic versioning, release notes, and known issues.<hr />  - Individual releases per Backend, Frontend, or microservice.<hr /><hr />- **Customer Feedback**:<hr />  - Response through direct message, email, or calls.<hr />  - Direct feedback to specific project team members based on areas (e.g., implementation, progress).<hr /><hr />- **Issue Management**:<hr />  - Timely response based on severity levels (Critical to Minor), with dedicated response channels and timings:<hr />    - Critical: 10 min response, 30 min resolve.<hr />    - Major: 30 min response, 2-5 hr resolve.<hr />    - Moderate: 45 min response, 7 hr resolve.<hr />    - Minor: 1 day response, 1 day resolve.<hr />  - Commitment to respond to all queries within 24 hours.

31.title: Fixed Budget Scope Controlled
31.description: Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) is applied at Atomic Object.
31.spr_content: - Atomic Object employs Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC) strategy for custom software development.<hr />- Complexity of software projects complicates pricing.<hr />- Traditional strategies: "Fixed Price" and "Time And Materials."<hr />  <hr />### Fixed Price<hr />- Total project cost locked upfront.<hr />- Static: Scope, Cost; Flexible: Quality.<hr />- Assumes accurate estimates; risk transferred to consultant.<hr />- Conflict arises over scope changes; new ideas typically excluded.<hr />- Vendor risks losing money if project exceeds initial estimate; incentivizes rigidity.<hr />- Risk of building incorrect product due to fixed parameters.<hr /><hr />### Time And Materials<hr />- Vendor charges for every hour worked; no financial constraints.<hr />- Static: Scope, Quality; Flexible: Cost, Timeline.<hr />- Client assumes financial risk; vendor has no budget incentives.<hr />- Potential for unchecked scope creep, lacking visibility on project progress.<hr />- Clients may hesitate to modify scope due to budget concerns; vendors welcome changes.<hr />  <hr />### Fixed-Budget, Scope-Controlled (FBSC)<hr />- Combines strengths of both models, minimizing weaknesses.<hr />- Establish upfront budget without fixed scope.<hr />- Static: Budget, Quality; Flexible: Scope.<hr />- Assumption: Budget limits creativity; prioritizing best product outcomes.<hr />- Shared risk between client and consultant.<hr />- Regular reassessment of scope allows adaptation to new information.<hr />- Weekly project updates provide budget transparency and progress tracking.<hr />- Flexibility enhances product relevance; scope adjustments don't necessitate budget increases.<hr />- Collaboration fosters a better working relationship and improved final product.

32.title: Pricing model: Bill by hours
32.description: A new hourly billing model is introduced to ensure fair compensation for effort, flexibility in project scope, control over additional work, and transparency with clients.
32.spr_content: - Current environment: uncertain economy, tech market funding winter, cautious tech budgeting, layoffs common.<hr />- Upside: Companies seek end-to-end solutions, not just coding.<hr />- Expanded role of Dwarves: offering research, business analysis, consulting, solution design.<hr />- Transition to hourly billing model driven by: <hr />  - Fair compensation for actual work and expertise.<hr />  - Flexibility to adapt to project needs and client requirements.<hr />  - Control over additional billing for unforeseen challenges.<hr />  - Transparency through detailed time logging increases trust with clients.<hr />  <hr />### Implementation Steps:<hr />- **Clear announcement**: Inform clients of new timesheet approval process and time tracking.<hr />- **Timesheet setup**: Collaborate with clients to establish appropriate formats.<hr />- **Time tracking**: Utilize Notion/Excel for accurate hour logs; timely recording mandatory.<hr />- **Project management**: Maintain detailed plans; keep clients updated on progress and scope changes.<hr />- **Approval**: Submit monthly timesheets for client approval before invoicing.<hr /><hr />- Consistency and articulation are key for success in this model.<hr />- Building a habit of clear communication fosters stronger client relationships.<hr />- Operations team available for inquiries and support.

33.title: Low-fidelity prototype: UI Design
33.description: Design systems enable teams to build better products faster by making design reusable, reusability makes scale possible.
33.spr_content: - **Understanding Prospect**: Analyze stakeholders, business models, goals, and challenges; ensure alignment on design elements like mindset, style, color palette, typography, iconography, illustration, and photography.<hr />  <hr />- **Defining Product Elements**:<hr />  - **Style**: Establish layout style aligned with target users; reference platforms like Dribbble and Behance for trends.<hr />  - **Color**: Define primary and secondary colors; utilize apps like Milanote for moodboarding; apply the 6:3:1 rule and limit to 3 primary colors for visual harmony.<hr />  - **Typography**: Specify typeface and styles (header, subheader, body) including font-size and weight.<hr />  - **Iconography**: Create icons reflective of branding; select icon colors from established color palette.<hr />  - **Illustrations and Images**: Apply visual elements consistent with content and style; use bitmap masks for file exports.<hr />  - **Platform Consideration**: Detail specific screens (desktop, mobile, tablet) and implement grid layouts to optimize designs.<hr />  - **Responsive Design**: Ensure adaptability across devices; consider user requirements for responsiveness.<hr /><hr />- **Demo Design**: Produce preliminary screens for client review; if color palette is undecided, start with grayscale focus to emphasize layout, text, and spacing.<hr /><hr />- **Design System**:<hr />  - **Definition**: A design system is a collection of reusable components guided by standards, fostering scalability and product development speed.<hr />  - **Building Steps**:<hr />    - Align teams on shared goals to establish vision and communication.<hr />    - Create design principles as guiding references.<hr />    - Initiate color palette development with moodboards and systematic naming conventions; implement and test colors to comply with accessibility standards (WCAG).<hr />    - Detail typographic rules: sizes, spaces, fonts, and usage guidelines.<hr />    - Standardize graphic assets, including icons, photography, and branding images to ensure brand consistency.<hr />    - Catalog design components in a pattern library by function (e.g., navigation) and states (e.g., hover).<hr />  <hr />- **High-Fidelity Prototype**:<hr />  - **Description**: Create interactive UIs allowing user interaction (e.g., button presses, sliders).<hr />  - **Timing**: Develop post-UI design completion.<hr />  - **Goals**: Validate design assumptions, present concepts to developers/customers, gather feedback for future iterations.<hr />  - **Tools**: Utilize Principle, Protopie, and Adobe XD for prototyping.

34.title: Onboarding
34.description: What we have to do when a new employee come to our team.
34.spr_content: - Employee onboarding as gradual perspective formation.<hr />- Commitment decision to company during this stage.<hr />  <hr />**Important Onboarding Notes:**<hr />- Initiate onboarding from the first day.<hr />- Avoid unclear expectations and policies.<hr />- Reject one-size-fits-all methods.<hr />- Involve all relevant teams, not just direct departments.<hr />- Onboarding duration should exceed one week.<hr />- Maintain post-onboarding follow-up.<hr /><hr />**Offer Email Essentials:**<hr />- Include net/gross salary details.<hr />- Specify onboarding start date.<hr /><hr />**Onboarding Email Requests:**<hr />- Set up Transferwise account.<hr />- Provide identity card information.<hr />- Submit insurance details.<hr />- Complete fortress form.<hr />- Sign LLC contract.<hr />- Create onboarding schedule.<hr />- Join Dwarves Foundation Discord.<hr /><hr />**Operations Team Onboarding Call:**<hr />- Clarify position and daily workflow.<hr />- Present company benefits, paperwork essentials, and cultural expectations.<hr />  <hr />**Key Discussion Points:**<hr />- Define probation goals.<hr />- Introduce team, leaders, and projects.<hr />- Establish personal 60-day plan.<hr />- Detail workspace tools (Discord, Basecamp).<hr />- Explain reward system (ICY).<hr />- Set up crypto wallet and GitHub access.<hr />- Share daily report and communication protocols.<hr /><hr />**Membership Integration:**<hr />- Self-introduction on Discord including:<hr />  - Preferred name and role.<hr />  - Project involvement and personal goals.<hr />  - Tag teammates for a welcome.<hr />  <hr />**Team Lead Meeting:**<hr />- Outline 60-day probation guidelines.<hr />- Set goals and review schedule.<hr />- Introduce new hire to department head.<hr />- Assign a line manager for support.<hr />- Clarify work scope and expectations.<hr />- Establish bi-weekly check-ins focusing on culture fit and workflow.<hr />- Encourage sharing within the Dwarves community. <hr />- Foster engagement in technical discussions and mentorship opportunities.

35.title: Offer Letter
35.description: The email template is to annouce about new employment.
35.spr_content: - Title: Dwarves Foundation - Offer letter<hr />- Purpose: Employment offer notification<hr />- Recipient: [name]<hr />- Position: [position]<hr />- Interview Process: Candidate performed well<hr />- Fit: Candidate deemed a good match for the team<hr />- Employment Type: Full-time/Part-time<hr />- Office Hours: 9.30am - 6.30pm<hr />- Salary: [salary] VND/month (Gross)<hr />- Probation: [probation duration] months<hr />- Probation Salary: [salary] VND/month<hr />- Start Date: [start date time]<hr />- Contract Type: Signed with LLC<hr />- Action Required: Confirm acceptance by replying to the email<hr />- Additional Inquiry: Confirm suitability of start date<hr />- Anticipation: Excitement for candidate joining the team<hr />- Sender: Dwarves Foundation

36.title: Hiring Approach
36.description: Hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around.
36.spr_content: **Philosophy:**<hr />- Hire those who guide us; reverse roles are unfit.<hr />- Company culture stems from hiring, firing, and promotions.<hr />- Balance short-term evaluations with long-term vision.<hr />- Prioritize values and culture fit in hiring processes.<hr /><hr />**Principles:**<hr />1. Hiring signifies execution failure; seek assistance.<hr />2. Employee effectiveness in startups resembles a power distribution.<hr />3. Accept false positives; avoid false negatives.<hr />4. Culture is shaped by hiring choices.<hr />5. "A" players elevate workplace quality over superficial perks.<hr /><hr />**Heuristics:**<hr />- Favor strengths over weaknesses.<hr />- Consider potential trajectory over existing experience.<hr />- Seek doers, not just tellers.<hr />- Prioritize learners instead of experts.<hr />- Embrace diversity over sameness.<hr />- Bypass ego; attitude trumps skill.<hr />- Identify resilient individuals; obedience can hinder adaptability.<hr />- Assess habits; what you observe now persists.<hr />- A sense of humor indicates adaptability and engagement.<hr />- Fill skill gaps in existing teams; enhance diversity.<hr />- Maintain a "bullpen" of potential hires continuously.<hr />- Look for intellectual curiosity and communicative competence.<hr />- Emphasize the importance of diversity; widen recruitment strategies.<hr /><hr />**Protecting vs. Growing Culture:**<hr />- Hiring often serves to maintain existing cultures; avoid gatekeeping.<hr />- Embrace a dynamic culture that evolves with business growth.<hr />- Seek culture-adders, not just culture-fitters, to enhance dynamics.<hr /><hr />**Culture Add, Not Culture Fit:**<hr />- Culture fit is vital; avoid hiring identical candidates.<hr />- Diversity fosters innovation and varied problem-solving approaches.<hr />- Prioritize listening in interviews—focus on candidates' narratives.<hr />- Avoid impulse in hiring; maintain quality standards over urgency.<hr />- Emphasize continuous recruitment from diverse environments.<hr /><hr />**Offering:**<hr />- Act quickly with suitable candidates; clarity is key in offers.<hr />- Preserve relationships with candidates who decline; future opportunities may arise.

37.title: How People Matter Should Work
37.description: A philosophical exploration of authentic employee engagement in software companies, focusing on individual contributions, unconventional hiring practices, knowledge sharing culture, and intrinsic motivation rather than superficial happiness metrics.
37.spr_content: - Central thesis: People are the core of business, emphasized in various articles.<hr />- Common narrative: Importance of HR in nurturing talent and fostering engagement.<hr />- Critique: Excessive focus on "how-tos" detracts from genuine value.<hr />- Authenticity over happiness: Real engagement springs from belief in one’s contributions, not merely superficial happiness.<hr />  <hr />- Individual Contribution: <hr />  - Automatic check-ins reveal pride in work.<hr />  - Acknowledgment is vital; recognize the creators behind products.<hr /><hr />- Unconventional hiring approach:<hr />  - Non-traditional backgrounds encouraged; skill over diploma.<hr />  - Value diverse experiences; focus on mindset aligned with engineering vision.<hr />  <hr />- Knowledge Sharing Culture:<hr />  - Informal, driven by curiosity and desire to assist.<hr />  - Team members intrinsically motivated to share knowledge, fostering collective growth.<hr /><hr />- People-driven culture:<hr />  - Incentives matter less than intrinsic motivation; people stay if they choose to.<hr />  - Create an inspiring environment that values contributions, fairness, and open dialogue.<hr />- Focus on fostering a space where personal and collective purposes align.

38.title: How to conduct delivery reports
38.description: How we conduct insightful delivery reports that ensure transparency, improve team performance, and enhance client relationships
38.spr_content: - Goal: Efficient resource allocation, task assignment, issue resolution.<hr />- Report questions: <hr />  1. Did we help the client achieve their targets?<hr />  2. How did the team perform?<hr />  3. Are there any problems needing resolution?<hr /><hr />### Process Overview:<hr />- **Data Gathering:**<hr />  - **Artifact Collection:** <hr />    - Collect proof of work: demo materials, updated documents, project logs.<hr />    - Identify technical and managerial issues.<hr /><hr />- **Team Performance Evaluation:**<hr />  - Assess account managers' client advocacy.<hr />  - Review tech leads' consultation and delivery management.<hr />  - Evaluate individual team member workload and performance.<hr /><hr />- **Project Priority Assessment:**<hr />  - Rank projects by deal size, opportunity potential, and strategic importance.<hr /><hr />### Report Compilation:<hr />- **Project Sorting by Importance:** Rank projects by priority.<hr />- **Client Happiness & Performance Ratings:** Rate satisfaction and performance on a scale of 1 to 5.<hr />- **Issues & Resolutions Logs:** Document encountered issues and implemented solutions.

39.title: How we do effective planning and reporting
39.description: How we do effective planning and reporting at Dwarves
39.spr_content: - **Borderless Company**: Encourages remote work, emphasizes clear communication.<hr />- **Structured Workflow**: Ensures efficient weekly work allocation for team synchronization and timely task completion.<hr />  <hr />### Weekly Planning & Retro<hr />- **Purpose**: Set priorities, align members, and track progress towards monthly goals.<hr />- **Agenda**: <hr />  - Customizable by teams, includes updates, task prioritization, blockers, lessons learned, and weekly goals.<hr />- **Planning Session**:<hr />  - Combined retrospective and planning to minimize meetings.<hr />  - **Participants**: All team members required.<hr />  - **Timing**: Friday afternoon or Monday morning.<hr />  - **Format**: Conducted via Discord voice channel.<hr />  - **Preparation**: Written weekly plan submission before meetings.<hr /><hr />### Weekly Reporting<hr />- **Objective**: Show progress, celebrate achievements, and address challenges.<hr />- **Preparation**: Written reports submitted before the planning session.<hr />- **Focus**: Quality of tasks, challenges/issues, lessons learned, and team contributions.<hr /><hr />### Daily Check-in<hr />- **Timing**: End of each working day, no later than 6 PM.<hr />- **Format**: Standups or written checks depending on team dynamics; brief and focused.<hr />- **Contents**:<hr />  - Daily plan vs. accomplishment.<hr />  - Obstacles to progress.<hr />  - Support needed from team members.<hr />  - Takeaways and lessons learned.<hr /><hr />### Summary<hr />- **Minimum Requirements** for a working week at Dwarves:<hr />  - **Weekly Planning**: Bullet point written plan & meeting at week start/week end.<hr />  - **Weekly Report**: Bullet point written report highlighting progress, challenges, and lessons.<hr />  - **Daily Check-in**: Written check-in at day's end.

40.title: OGIF - Oh God It's Friday
40.description: I would like to introduce to you our new initiative called **OGIF** ,  Oh God It's Friday. Moving forward, our Friday Showcase will have a broader range of topics to discuss and share.
40.spr_content: - Initiative: **OGIF (Oh God It's Friday)**; broaden Friday Showcase topics.<hr />- Reflect: Achievements of the past week; embrace optimism for the future.<hr />- Core Value: Work-life balance; prioritize responsibilities first.<hr />- Work Culture: Foster hard work and provide growth opportunities.<hr />- Redefine TGIF: Not an escape; pursue passion and interests.<hr />- 70/50 Culture: 70% work duties, 50% personal growth; 30% pursue side projects.<hr />- Goal: Positive societal impact; sustainable income through dedication.<hr />- Achievements: 20+ software shipped; collaboration with 20+ clients.<hr />- Graduates excel beyond Dwarves; continued success in careers.<hr />- Open Discussions: Growth opportunities in tech, social development, finance, career paths.<hr />- Community: Welcoming space for diverse opinions; appreciate accomplishments.<hr />- Motto: "TGIF sometimes, OGIF all the time." <hr />- Cheers!

41.title: Our Policy For Remote Working
41.description: Some useful practices we adopted to keep the remote working system goes smoothly. This policy is written in the context of our current company setup.
41.spr_content: - Remote work policy for a full-remote team. <hr />- Accountability remains high for remote and in-office employees. <hr />- Accommodate time zone differences in scheduling meetings. <hr />- Guidelines and tools facilitate effective remote work; personal initiative is essential.<hr />  <hr />**Adoption Practices:**<hr />- **Plan & Prepare:** Ensure strong Wi-Fi, distraction-free space, privacy for calls, and readiness for a full workday.<hr />- **Proactive Check-ins:** Use tools like Slack for availability and project updates; maintain communication.<hr />  <hr />**Calendar Management:**<hr />- Update calendar with remote work locations and availability.<hr /><hr />**Extended Remote Work:**<hr />- Notify about extended remote work (over 3 days), privileges demand proven effectiveness.<hr />- Manager approval required for non-home remote work.<hr /><hr />**Schedule Communication:**<hr />- Inform team at least 3 days in advance about remote work plans:<hr />  - Post notifications in #office.<hr />  - Verbally notify close colleagues.<hr />  - Update calendar.<hr /><hr />**Meeting Protocols:**<hr />- Timely meeting starts are mandatory for all participants.<hr />- Scheduled meetings should be within regular hours (10:30am - 1:00pm).<hr />- Video options for remote participants are standard; audio only by exception.<hr /><hr />**Managerial Oversight:**<hr />- Remote work is a privilege; non-compliance can lead to revocation.<hr />- Regular 1:1s focus on remote work challenges and responsibilities; fosters open feedback.

42.title: Setup email template in Gmail
42.description: How to setup template for email in Gmail
42.spr_content: - Enable Gmail Canned Responses:  <hr />    - Login to Gmail.  <hr />    - Navigate to Settings -> Settings -> Advanced tab.  <hr />    - Activate Canned Responses (Templates) to **Enabled**.  <hr /><hr />- Manage Templates:  <hr />    - Save draft as a new template for later use.  <hr />    - Select an existing template for composing an email.  <hr /><hr />- Template Guidelines:  <hr />    - Highlight placeholders in *red* for easy identification by users.

43.title: How to swap ICY to BTC
43.description: A friendly guide to converting your ICY tokens to Bitcoin (BTC) using our platform. We'll walk you through the process step by step, from wallet setup to transaction monitoring.
43.spr_content: - Begin ICY to Bitcoin (BTC) conversion.<hr />- Requirements: Bitcoin wallet, ETH for gas fees.<hr />- Bitcoin wallet options: Electrum, Trust Wallet, UniSat.<hr />- For ETH assistance, contact Dwarves Foundation on Discord.<hr />  <hr />**Step 1: Connect to icy.so**<hr />- Visit icy.so.<hr />- Click "Connect Wallet".<hr />- Choose wallet (MetaMask, Coinbase, etc.).<hr />- Ensure connection on Base network.<hr /><hr />**Step 2: Make the swap**<hr />- Source Token: ICY; Destination Token: BTC.<hr />- Minimum swap: 20 ICY.<hr />- Enter BTC wallet address and confirm swap.<hr />  <hr />**Step 3: Track your transaction**<hr />- Track in "Recent Transactions".<hr />- Hover for details; status updates as "Pending".<hr />- Processing time varies due to network conditions.<hr /><hr />**Key points to remember**<hr />- Minimum swap: 20 ICY.<hr />- Service fee: 3,000 units per transaction.<hr />- Gas fees in ETH on Base network.<hr />- Delays possible during high activity.<hr /><hr />- Access support on Dwarves Foundation Discord for assistance.

44.title: How much is your ICY worth
44.description: Learn how ICY's value has evolved from a fixed USDC-backed model to a dynamic Bitcoin-backed system. We'll explain what this means for your holdings and how to track your ICY's value.
44.spr_content: - ICY transitions from fixed USDC-backed value to dynamic Bitcoin-backed model.  <hr />- Previous model: Each ICY worth `1.5 USDC`; stable and predictable.  <hr />- New model: ICY's value linked to Bitcoin (BTC) via liquidity pools.  <hr />- Two pools managed: one for ICY, one for BTC; interactions determine ICY value.  <hr />- Initial conversion rate set; value fluctuates with BTC price and pool dynamics.  <hr />- Key factors influencing ICY value:  <hr />  - Current Bitcoin market price.  <hr />  - Conditions of liquidity pools.  <hr />  - Overall market demand for ICY.  <hr />- BTC addition raises ICY value; more ICY lowers it.  <hr />- Example: `1 ICY = 0.00003 BTC`; if BTC at `$50,000`, ICY worth `$1.50`.  <hr />- If BTC rises to `$60,000`, ICY value increases to `$1.80`.  <hr />- Adding BTC to pool raises ICY value; adding ICY reduces it.  <hr />- Liquidity management: monthly BTC addition, weekly ICY minting for activities and rewards.  <hr />- Objective: Stability while allowing for market-driven value changes.  <hr />- Change rationale: Adaptation to crypto ecosystem, growth potential tied to Bitcoin, reduced reliance on stablecoins, dynamic, reflective of real-world trading conditions.  <hr />- Ongoing tracking of BTC performance and liquidity dynamics recommended for informed ICY decisions.

45.title: Memo Handbook
45.description: Memo is where we share everything we learn, build, and think about product craftsmanship, engineering, and our culture. It's our commitment to learning in public.
45.spr_content: - All companies possess stories; we have numerous narratives about team building, milestones, culture, and work.<hr />- Dwarves Memo serves as our public learning engine, encapsulating 1% improvements, experiments, and hard-earned lessons.<hr />- Content categories on Memo include:<hr />  - Team research and technical insights.<hr />  - Company updates and operational recaps.<hr />  - Cultural values, facts, and figures.<hr />  - Podcast and webinar transcripts.<hr />  - Playbooks and handbooks for guidance.<hr />- Memo fosters knowledge sharing and attracts individuals who align with our values, reflecting our "calm company" philosophy.<hr />- Our approach rejects aggressive outbound tactics, focusing instead on organic attraction through shared learning.<hr />- Content creation involves a structured pipeline:<hr />  1. New insights and queries arise.<hr />  2. Investigate, document, and respond to questions.<hr />  3. Schedule and publish refined content via our communications team.<hr />- Contributions are encouraged, utilizing Markdown files stored in our GitHub repository:<hr />  1. Create or edit files in the `vault/` directory.<hr />  2. Include essential YAML frontmatter: title, description, tags, author, date.<hr />  3. Follow simple Markdown formatting for clarity and organization.<hr />  4. Submit a pull request for publication.<hr />- Content elevation follows a Zettelkasten-like methodology, progressing from drafts to mature posts.<hr />- User contributions enrich Memo, enhancing our authenticity and shared experiences.

46.title: Compliance
46.description: Our commitment to ethical standards and compliance
46.spr_content: - Uphold high ethical standards and comply with the law.<hr />- Code of conduct: Respect, integrity, core values are fundamental team agreements.<hr />- Zero-tolerance harassment: Offensive comments, intimidation, disruption, inappropriate touching, unwanted attention forbidden.<hr />- Report harassment to team lead or Han; confidentiality assured.<hr />- Corruption and bribery strictly prohibited: No bribes, conflicts of interest, or improper influence on officials.<hr />- Data privacy: Collect necessary data only, secure storage, limited access, adhere to privacy laws.<hr />- NDA and intellectual property: Agreements on confidentiality, non-solicitation, and protection of competitive work.<hr />- Support for outside professional activities; moonlighting policy addresses conflicts.<hr />- Responsibility to report policy violations; multiple reporting channels available.<hr />- Retaliation against reporters is forbidden; thorough investigation conducted.<hr />- Consequences of violations: Warnings, improvement plans, termination, legal action—case-by-case determined.<hr />- Continuous compliance training provided: Onboarding, regular updates, annual refreshers.<hr />- Compliance as a journey: Encouragement for improvement ideas to foster trustworthy culture.<hr />- Compliance integral for safety and respect in the workplace.

47.title: Borrowing & requesting company assets
47.description: How to borrow company assets like books or devices, or request new ones. Simple steps for getting the gear you need.
47.spr_content: - **Gear Access:** Company assets (books, devices) available for employee use.<hr />- **Borrowing Process:**<hr />  - Use **Basecamp** for tracking.<hr />  - Navigate to **Woodland** project.<hr />  - Create a **borrow request** in "Request" To-Do list.<hr />  - Format for request: **Your name | Type - Name/Id of asset | Borrowing date | Returning date**.<hr />  - Upload asset photo upon pick-up.<hr />  - Assign To-Do to **HR**.<hr />- **Example Request:** Huy Nguyen | Book - Start With Why | 19/04/2021 | 26/04/2021.<hr />- **Extending Borrow Time:** Update **Returning date** in To-Do, notify HR.<hr />- **Returning Process:**<hr />  - **Report Issues:** Comment on problems in Basecamp.<hr />  - **Return Item:** Bring back to office.<hr />  - **Complete To-Do:** Mark as done once returned in good condition.<hr />- **Requesting New Assets:**<hr />  - Procedure mirrors borrowing.<hr />  - Go to **Woodland** project, access "Asset Requests" To-Do list.<hr />  - Create request: **Your name | Item type - Item name/description | Reason for request**.<hr />  - Assign To-Do to **HR**.<hr />- **Example Request:** Huy Nguyen | Book - Start With Why | For further understanding in inspiration.<hr />- **Be Specific:** Include exact name, model, or link. Explain the 'why' and relevance to team.<hr />- **HR Actions:** <hr />  - Review request and budget.<hr />  - Approve and order item if reasonable.<hr />  - Notify upon arrival via Basecamp.<hr />  - Mark To-Do as done once received.<hr />- **Conclusion:** Simple access to tools enhances productivity.

48.title: Office check-in process for earning ICY
48.description: A guide on how to check in at the office and claim ICY token rewards.
48.spr_content: - Remote work benefits exist; in-person interaction enhances learning and connection.<hr />- Implement hybrid work: check-in process rewards office visits.<hr />- Office environment fosters focus, creativity, and comfort; find your space.<hr />- Connect to office Wi-Fi for access and system readiness.<hr />- Use Discord; join Dwarves server if not already a member.<hr />- Check in via **`🏢・lobby`** channel; send "gm" to confirm presence.<hr />- Earn 5 ICY tokens ($7.5 value) for checking in, incentivizing in-person attendance.<hr />- Utilize office time for collaboration, idea sharing, and enjoying the environment; face-to-face interaction is valuable.

49.title: Email Communication and Use
49.description: We use email as our formal tool for both internal and external communication. Every email is utilized for a specific field, which comes along with different instructions.
49.spr_content: - **Email as primary communication tool**: Formal channel for internal and external interactions.<hr />  <hr />- **<team@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: External communication only.<hr />  - **Audience**: Clients and external contacts.<hr />  - **Content**: Agreements and announcements.<hr /><hr />- **<ops@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Internal communication.<hr />  - **Audience**: Company employees.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Employment matters: terms, salary, reviews, meetings.<hr />    - Client interactions logged via cc.<hr />  <hr />- **<spawn@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Hiring processes.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Test invitations: Pre-Assessment/Assignment.<hr />    - Notifications from CCAT for application assessments.<hr />    - Confirmation/rejection emails for applicants.<hr />    - Job offers.<hr />    - Automated CV collection from job sites.<hr />  <hr />- **<accounting@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Financial transactions.<hr />  - **Content**:<hr />    - Invoices: incoming and outgoing.<hr />    - Salary adjustment notifications via cc from Operations.<hr />    - Tax-related matters.<hr /><hr />- **<thug@d.foundation>**: <hr />  - **Purpose**: Infrastructure registration. <hr />  - **Content**: Services like Cloudflare, Google Cloud, AWS.

50.title: Submit a leave request
50.description: A consistent on leave process prevents a company from being accidentally disrupted when an employee request to be absent.
50.spr_content: - Clear leave request process ensures smooth operations and minimal disruption.<hr />- Discuss leave plans with client and team to align tasks.<hr />- Leave request submission steps include:<hr />  - Log into Basecamp.<hr />  - Create ticket in Woodland channel > On-Leave Request list.<hr />  - Format: Name | Type of absence (off/remote) | Date | Shift.<hr />  - Assign to: Project Manager, Account Manager, Project Lead.<hr />- Request timing based on urgency:<hr />  - Urgent: Immediate submission.<hr />  - Non-urgent: 2x absence duration prior.<hr />  - Holiday: 1-2 weeks in advance.<hr />- Example: 8 days advance notice required for leave from Jul 9th-12th.<hr />- Verification involves discussion of workload and resources to prevent project interruptions.<hr />- Approval process includes marking ticket as done, notifying all involved, and updating Google Calendar.<hr />- Client must be informed via email of approved leave, as Basecamp notifications are not sent to them.<hr />- Denial reason documented in the ticket by manager or lead.<hr />- Notify team and client about leave once approved.<hr />- Operations announces holiday period to clients 1-2 weeks in advance.<hr />- Project Manager or Leader sends reminder 2-3 days before holiday.<hr />- Non-urgent responses to clients are prohibited on days off or holidays.

51.title: Understanding your NDA & other agreements
51.description: A guide to the Non-Disclosure, Non-Solicitation, and IP agreements you signed when joining Dwarves.
51.spr_content: - Agreements: Trust foundation between employee, Dwarves, and clients.<hr />- Confidentiality: Essential for protecting business edge and reputation.<hr />  <hr />### Core Promises<hr />1. **Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA)**: <hr />   - Keep client, business, and process information confidential.<hr />   - Obligation persists post-employment.<hr />   <hr />2. **Non-Solicitation**:<hr />   - No recruiting Dwarves staff or soliciting clients for 12 months after departure.<hr /><hr />3. **Intellectual Property (IP)**:<hr />   - Anything created at Dwarves belongs to Dwarves.<hr />   - No personal use of company IP after leaving.<hr /><hr />### Day-to-Day Responsibilities<hr />- **During Employment**:<hr />   - Safeguard sensitive information: secure files, avoid inappropriate sharing, use data legitimately.<hr />   - Clarify sharing uncertainties by asking first.<hr /><hr />- **Post-Employment**:<hr />   - Return all company materials and adhere to NDA and non-solicitation commitments.<hr />   - Prohibited from using or sharing confidential info in future roles.<hr /><hr />### Importance of Compliance<hr />- Violations can lead to:<hr />  - Legal action and financial claims.<hr />  - Court orders restricting activities.<hr />  - Damage to professional reputation.<hr /><hr />### Clarification Steps<hr />- Review signed agreements.<hr />- Discuss with a manager for context.<hr />- Contact HR for questions or clarifications.<hr /><hr />- Employee responsibility: Honor agreements to protect Dwarves’ integrity and future. Trust nurtured through care and integrity in work.

52.title: Our second brain
52.description: This page explains our knowledge base, which is basically our team's shared brain where we keep important stuff. Using it helps us work smarter together and makes sure we don't lose good ideas or lessons learned.
52.spr_content: - Knowledge base: team’s shared memory, "second brain."<hr />- Purpose: improve collaboration, enhance decision-making, eliminate redundancy.<hr />- Contains: <hr />  - **Private info:** team details, project notes, client information, sales leads, financials, reports – essential for daily operations.<hr />  - **Public info:** industry insights, new technologies, employment opportunities, articles, competitor analysis – broadens perspective, identifies opportunities.<hr />- Integrates important discussions from Basecamp and Discord to retain valuable ideas.<hr />- Usage:<hr />  - Facilitates easy access to company policies, past projects, reports.<hr />  - Serves as collective know-how, evolving with team learning.<hr />  - Reflects commitment to continuous improvement.<hr />- Maintenance: <hr />  - Core team organizes and updates it; simplicity is key.<hr />  - Collective contribution enhances utility; encourages collaboration in upkeep.<hr />  - Shared responsibility reflects dedication to quality work.

53.title: Navigate changes
53.description: How we deal with technology changes
53.spr_content: - Technology evolves in waves; current wave is AI, preceded by DevOps, mobile, and cloud.<hr />- Each wave reshapes client needs and introduces new tools.<hr />- Consulting firm expertise is essential for client success amidst tech changes.<hr />- Mastering current technologies is inadequate; adaptation is crucial.<hr />- Clients rely on our knowledge and future tech insights.<hr />- Falling behind reduces competitive value and utility.<hr />- Core questions drive our adaptation:<hr />  - Which technologies will emerge next?<hr />  - How can we enhance team skills and knowledge?<hr />  - What lessons are derived from previous tech cycles?<hr />- Big tech shifts initiate our structured process at Dwarves.<hr />- Steps of our data-driven approach:<hr />  1. **Gather Information**: Collect data from industry news, trends, internal discussions, and project experiences.<hr />  2. **Understand Data**: Analyze trends and keywords to identify new technologies.<hr />  3. **Make Decisions**: Evaluate insights to determine team skill development, demo creation, or community involvement.<hr />- Important to document each cycle's learning.<hr />- Internal tools like the knowledge base and Tech Radar facilitate:<hr />  - Consistent data collection and organization.<hr />  - Clarity on emerging trends.<hr />  - Informed decisions for tech adoption.<hr />- Aim: Manage tech transitions predictably, support growth, and improve responsiveness to unexpected shifts.<hr />- Collective contribution enhances adaptation process:<hr />  - Share relevant articles, insights, and project experiences.<hr />  - Organize information and suggest tool/process improvements.<hr />- Individual involvement strengthens our future preparedness and collaborative advancement.

54.title: What we value
54.description: Our core values guide our strategies and individual actions so that we create a company whose character is as radical as our work.
54.spr_content: - **Core Values**: Guide decisions, shape culture, define identity at Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- **Craftsmanship**: Pursue excellence; pride in well-crafted software.<hr />- **Teamwork**: Trust and collaboration are essential; rely on each other.<hr />- **Sustainability**: Long-term vision; value balance and health in work.<hr />- **Culture**: Emerges from hires, celebrations, and encouragement; dynamic and evolves.<hr />- **Hiring Philosophy**: Reject toxicity; prioritize team dynamics over potential talent.<hr />- **Self-Management**: Individuals center efforts on collective contribution.<hr />- **Team First**: Coordination over individual heroics; support and listen to each other.<hr />- **Collective Ideology**: Focus on excellence in software engineering and innovation.<hr />- **Like-Minded Individuals**: Seek shared vision and optimism for future.<hr />- **Valuing Uniqueness**: Hire for unique qualities beyond standard evaluations.<hr />- **Emotional Intelligence**: Success hinges on understanding communication and client needs.<hr />- **Actions Over Words**: Value practical contributions over mere discussions.<hr />- **Remote Work**: Encourage flexibility with self-management and accountability.<hr />- **Quality Focus**: Prioritize output quality over hours worked.<hr />- **Automation Mindset**: Automate repetitive tasks; focus on innovation and efficiency.<hr />- **Partnerships Over Transactions**: Build lasting relationships based on mutual growth.<hr />- **Everyone Contributes**: Involve every team member in actionable tasks.<hr />- **Effectiveness Over Busyness**: Value meaningful work over a packed schedule.<hr />- **Engineering Discipline**: Systematic approaches prevent complexity and expense.<hr />- **Lean Thinking**: Eliminate waste; prioritize value in every action.<hr />- **Long-Term Thinking**: Decisions must benefit collective future rather than individual interests.<hr />- **Software's Role**: Integral to modern life; drives transformation across industries.<hr />- **Creating Resilience**: Mindful actions shape sustainable futures; avoid short-term thinking.

57.title: How to set up crypto wallet to withdraw ICY
57.description: To withdraw ICY to Vietnam Bank or other fiat, you need set up 2 types of wallet in advance. This guide will show you how to setup crypto wallet.
57.spr_content: - **Objective**: Withdraw ICY to Vietnam Bank or convert to fiat. <hr />- **Requirement**: Set up two wallet types: <hr />  - **On-chain wallet**: <hr />    - Non-custodial.<hr />    - Example: Coinbase, Metamask.<hr />    - Purpose: Receive ICY, swap ICY to USDT.<hr />  - **Custodial wallet**: <hr />    - Example: Binance.<hr />    - Purpose: Convert USDT to VND.<hr />- **Instructions**:<hr />  - **Coinbase Wallet Setup**:<hr />    1. Install extension from Coinbase website (Chrome or Firefox only).<hr />    2. Access wallet via extension icon.<hr />    3. Create a new wallet if none exists.<hr />    4.
