483.title: Visitor design pattern, the concept, problem solution and use cases
483.description: Visitor is a behavioral design pattern that lets you separate algorithms from the objects on which they operate.
483.spr_content: - **Visitor Design Pattern**: A behavioral design pattern that decouples algorithms from the objects they operate on.<hr />- **Purpose**: Allows operations to be added to groups of similar objects without modifying their classes.<hr />- **Structure**:<hr />  - **Visitor Interface**: Declares visiting methods for each element type.<hr />  - **Concrete Visitor**: Implements the visitor interface, providing specific behavior for each element class.<hr />  - **Element Classes**: Provide an `accept(visitor)` method to accept a visitor.<hr />- **Key Methods**:<hr />  - **Visit()**: Method implemented by visitor for each element type.<hr />  - **Accept()**: Method in element classes to accept a visitor.<hr />  <hr />- **Problem**: Difficulty in maintaining code with increased operations for multiple document elements (paragraphs, tables, images) in a text editing application.<hr />- **Solution Through Visitor Pattern**: New operations can be added via visitor classes without altering existing element classes.<hr /><hr />- **Usage Example**:<hr />  - **Visitor Implementations**: <hr />    - `RenderVisitor`: Handles rendering of elements.<hr />    - `ExportVisitor`: Manages export operations.<hr />    - `SpellCheckVisitor`: Performs spell-checking.<hr />  - **Element Implementations**: <hr />    - `Paragraph`, `Table`, `Image` classes implementing `accept()` method.<hr />  <hr />- **Applicability**:<hr />  - For operations across complex object structures (e.g., object trees).<hr />  - To simplify business logic by isolating auxiliary behaviors.<hr />  - When a behavior applies only to certain classes in a hierarchy.<hr /><hr />- **Pros**:<hr />  - Adheres to **Open/Closed Principle**: Adds new behavior without class modification.<hr />  - Supports **Single Responsibility Principle**: Consolidates behavior logic in visitors.<hr /><hr />- **Cons**:<hr />  - Requires updating all visitors when modifying the element hierarchy.<hr />  - Limited access to private members of element classes.<hr /><hr />- **Use Cases**:<hr />  - **Compiler Design**: Operations on AST nodes (e.g., type checking, code generation).<hr />  - **Document Processing**: Support rendering, exporting, and spell-checking for document elements.<hr />  - **Graphics Rendering**: Operations for shapes (e.g., drawing, resizing).<hr />  - **File System Operations**: Features like searching and encryption for file system components.<hr />  - **Game Development**: Manage operations for game entities (e.g., rendering, collision detection).<hr />  - **E-commerce System**: Apply variations in operations across product types.<hr />  - **Network Protocols**: Support serialization and logging for packet types.<hr />  - **UI Component Management**: Handling rendering and events for UI elements.

484.title: Designing for Forgiveness: Creating Error-Tolerant Interfaces
484.description: In this article, we will look at some simple principles for designing error-tolerant interfaces and how to apply them to improve user experience.
484.spr_content: - **User Errors Are Inevitable**: Acknowledge that mistakes happen regardless of design quality.  <hr />- **Types of Errors**:<hr />  1. Accidental Errors: Unintentional actions (e.g., incorrect clicks).<hr />  2. Understanding Errors: Misunderstanding of features or new interface.<hr />  3. Design Errors: Confusion from unclear or complex design.<hr />  <hr />- **Design for Forgiveness**: Create systems to reduce errors and assist in recovery.<hr /><hr />- **Early Warnings**: Use prompts before critical actions (e.g., unsaved changes alerts).<hr />  - Examples: Microsoft Word's save prompt; Shopify's unsaved changes warning.<hr /><hr />- **Clear and Consistent Interfaces**: Predictability in design enables easier navigation, reducing mistakes.<hr />  - Example: Consistent layouts in Microsoft Office applications.<hr /><hr />- **Graceful Error Recovery**: Implement features for quick correction of mistakes (e.g., "Undo Remove" in Drive).<hr />  <hr />- **Error Prevention Through Visual Feedback**: Provide immediate feedback to avoid errors (e.g., Twitter’s character limit highlights).<hr />  <hr />- **Guidance and Support**: Offer clear instructions and helpful tools (e.g., tooltips, onboarding tutorials).<hr />  - Example: Interactive guidance in Webflow enhances user understanding.<hr /><hr />- **Conclusion**: Combine early warnings, clarity, consistency, recovery tools, real-time feedback, and supportive guidance to create user-friendly, error-tolerant interfaces, fostering confidence and satisfaction in users.

485.title: Echelon X Singapore 2024: Where Innovations Meet Inspiration
485.description: This year’s Echelon X in Singapore was a bustling hub of innovation, bringing together around 10,000 participants. Along with visiting SPGroup, our team also attended Echelon X to have a better understanding of how the tech and startup ecosystem is heading.
485.spr_content: - Echelon X 2024 in Singapore: 10,000 attendees, 154 speakers, 50 startups, diverse international participation (35+ countries). <hr />- Singapore's role as a Southeast Asian tech and investment hub solidified. <hr />- Mission: Strengthen tech ecosystem through collaboration, knowledge-sharing, collective innovation. <hr />- Community dynamics: Forward-thinkers and industry leaders foster shared ideas and new paths. <hr />- Key trends: Resilience and collaboration central to activities, providing startups support, funding access, and networking. <hr />- Sustainability focus: Aligning business and tech practices with global trends for long-term goals. <hr />- Topics of interest: AI, government support for tech sector, and future-proofing strategies. <hr />- Market insights: Thailand and Indonesia emerging as tech hubs; Philippines startup funding up 50% ($2 billion); Indonesia leads at $5 billion (30% increase). <hr />- Funding landscape challenges: SEA has a preference for free products, pressuring startups to seek international revenue, creating competitive hurdles. <hr />- Investor caution persists despite optimism for funding, with a focus on quality teams and sensible valuations. <hr />- Projected funding for 2024: $14 billion (40% increase), with a 25% rise in deal numbers indicating investor confidence. <hr />- Observations: COVID-19's impact on housing and employment; Vietnamese developers considering relocation; AI startups prevalent, government addressing AI challenges; education and living costs straining families; open innovation community (e.g., Binance, AWS meetups). <hr />- AI landscape: Dominated by big tech, SEA AI market set for rapid growth (35% annually, reaching $6 billion by 2028); major adoption hurdles include data security, privacy, localization, and AI governance. <hr />- General sentiment: Tough SEA tech market, layoffs and job security concerns tied to AI; essence of future tech's role in innovation emphasized. <hr />- Echelon X led to valuable insights and connections, shaping perspectives on SEA tech market's current trends and future developments.

486.title: Memo Publication Workflow
486.description: This guide will help you step-by-step create content and publish on memo.
486.spr_content: - Identify the relevant field for writing: blockchain, communication, design, engineering, marketing, security, writing.<hr />- Utilize the directory in `playground` for topic organization.<hr />- Seek clarification via Discord for uncertain topic placements.<hr />- Set up local environment as per guidelines for memo writing.<hr />- Ensure inclusion of mandatory fields: title, description, author, date, tags.<hr />- Apply kebab case for file naming, e.g., `how-to-write-a-memo.md`.<hr />- Verify article links by local repository execution.<hr />- Store images in the `assets` folder, referencing appropriately.<hr />- Follow image/screenshot guidelines from the specified guide.<hr />- Communicate article status (draft or final) to reviewers post-writing.<hr />- Engage experts for content reviews: @tom (engineering), @nikki (communications).<hr />- Check formatting and design with @anna.<hr />- Collect and address all feedback collaboratively.<hr />- Refer to "Life cycle of a publication" for in-depth procedures.

487.title: State, Explain, Link - An all-purpose writing technique
487.description: State, explain, link is a basic style for organizing and explaining ideas in an understandable way. This technique may have many names, but in essence it is a way to organize paragraphs in roughly 3 sentences or more.
487.spr_content: - Introduction of the State, Explain, Link technique for organizing ideas concisely.<hr />- Structure typically involves 3+ sentences: <hr />  - **State**: Brief introduction of topic (breadth).<hr />  - **Explain**: Detailed exploration of topic (depth).<hr />  - **Link**: Connections and examples to related concepts (relation).<hr />- Widely applicable across various formats: theses, diagrams, etc.<hr /><hr />- Functionality: <hr />  - Start with a general statement, augment with specific points and examples.<hr />  - Visual color coding: State (blue), Explain (orange), Link (purple).<hr /><hr />- Example 1: Six Sigma in quality assurance.<hr />  - State: Businesses adopt Six Sigma to exceed customer expectations.<hr />  - Explain: Six Sigma employs data-driven methodologies to reduce process variation.<hr />  - Link: Companies like Motorola improve cost-efficiency through Six Sigma.<hr /><hr />- Example 2: Impact of substandard products.<hr />  - State: Substandard products pose significant costs to businesses.<hr />  - Explain: Poor product quality erodes stakeholder trust and affects sales.<hr />  - Link: Samsung's Note 7 incidents led to massive financial losses and recalls.<hr /><hr />- Versatility: Effective for outlining and improvisational speaking.<hr />- Natural usage may occur in presentations when outlining main statements.

488.title: Building a Local Search Engine for Our Memo Website
488.description: Explore how we developed a fully local search engine for our memo website using DuckDB-wasm, Transformers.js, and Alpine.js. Learn about hybrid search techniques, real-time embeddings, and performance optimizations that deliver fast and accurate results without compromising on privacy or requiring server-side processing.
488.spr_content: 1. **Transition to Local Search**: Evolution from Algolia to a self-hosted local search engine for upgraded functionality and control.  <hr />2. **Key Motivations**: <hr />   - **Privacy**: Enhanced user privacy through local data processing.  <hr />   - **Cost**: Reduced operational costs by eliminating third-party services.  <hr />   - **Offline Capability**: Enabled search functionality without internet reliance.  <hr />   - **Customization**: Total control over the search experience.  <hr />3. **Core Technology**: DuckDB for in-browser SQL processing; aligns with broader trends in AI and web integration.  <hr />4. **Hybrid Search Model**: Merges full-text and semantic search for comprehensive query handling.  <hr />5. **Advanced Filtering**: Custom syntax for user-defined search parameters (e.g., `author:name`, `tag:topic`, `title:keyword`).  <hr />6. **Real-time Embedding**: Utilization of Transformers.js to generate search embeddings in the browser.  <hr />7. **Efficient Caching**: Mechanism for quick access to database files, enhancing performance.  <hr />8. **Responsive UI**: Developed with Alpine.js for responsive and real-time user feedback during searches.  <hr />9. **Performance Strategies**:  <hr />   - **Indexing**: Full-text and HNSW indexing used for rapid data retrieval.  <hr />   - **Debounced Input**: Reduces unnecessary queries while searching.  <hr />   - **Lazy Loading**: Optimizes loading processes based on necessity.  <hr />10. **Challenges Addressed**: <hr />   - Balancing accuracy and speed through hybrid approaches and caching.  <hr />11. **Future Enhancements**: <hr />    - **Persistent Search**: Aim for seamless user experience across navigations with SPA architecture.  <hr />    - **Speed Optimizations**: Explore advanced loading techniques and performance improvements.  <hr />    - **Server-Side Integration**: Consider server-side rendering for better SEO and faster initial loads.  <hr />12. **Conclusion**: Creation of a robust local search engine emphasizing user privacy and eliminating server dependencies, with ongoing commitment to improvements.

489.title: How to set up environment to edit memo
489.description: This is a guide on how to setup your environment and settings to push content to our notes website, memo.d.foundation.
489.spr_content: - **SSH key**: Secure authentication using a public/private key pair.  <hr />  - Public key shared, private key confidential.  <hr />  - Server (e.g., GitHub) verifies identity using fingerprint comparison.  <hr />  - Connection established with matching fingerprints and correct private key passphrase.  <hr />  - **Generation steps**: <hr />    1. Create key pair (public/private).  <hr />    2. Save private key locally.  <hr />    3. Submit public key to GitHub.  <hr />- **Visual Studio Code**: Install from [official site](https://code.visualstudio.com/).  <hr />- **Devbox installation**:<hr />  - Open VS Code Terminal (`Control + ~`).  <hr />  - Install with: `curl -fsSL https://get.jetpack.io/devbox | bash`.  <hr />- **Clone GitHub repo to local disk**: Two methods available.  <hr />  - **Method 1: Terminal**:<hr />    1. Run `xcode-select`.  <hr />    2. Install git-credential-manager by downloading appropriate package.  <hr />    3. Configure Git user with:  <hr />       ```sh <hr />       git config --global user.email "you@example.com" <hr />       git config --global user.name "Your Name" <hr />       ```  <hr />    4. Clone repo using: <hr />       ```sh <hr />       git clone https://github.com/dwarvesf/memo.d.foundation <hr />       ```  <hr />  - **Method 2: VScode with GitHub**:<hr />    1. Select Clone Repositories option.  <hr />    2. Choose Clone from GitHub.  <hr />    3. Search and select repository to clone.  <hr />- **Environment setup**:  <hr />  1. Navigate to `memo.d.foundation` repository folder.  <hr />  2. Update submodules with:<hr />     ```sh <hr />     git submodule update --init --recursive <hr />     git submodule update --recursive --remote <hr />     git submodule foreach --recursive 'git checkout main || git checkout master' <hr />     ```  <hr />  3. Create "content" folder within `memo.d.foundation`.  <hr />  4. Preview changes by running `devbox shell` then `make watch-run`.  <hr />     - A localhost link will be generated for previews.  <hr />     - Use `Cmd + click` to open the link.  <hr />  5. If errors occur, rerun `devbox shell` and `make watch-run`.  <hr />- **Next topic**: How to push content on memo.d.foundation ([link](https://memo.d.foundation/playground/_memo/how-to-push-content-on-note-d/)).

Knowledge gained is shared with the tech community.<hr />- **Engagement**: Visit [Dwarves Network](http://discord.gg/dfoundation) for inquiries and community participation.<hr />- **January 2024 Focus**: Monitoring tech market trends while reflecting on 2023 achievements.<hr />  <hr />### Reporting Tech Signals<hr />- **Trends Observed**:<hr />  - Limited updates and losses in core React team are concerning.<hr />  - Increased interest in HTMX.<hr />  - Rise of “Rewrite It In Rust” (RIIR) initiative with projects shifting to Rust.<hr />  - Growth of in-house AI-assisted productivity tools.<hr />  - Emerging independence of LLMs from OpenAI.<hr />  - Prominence of trading bots.<hr />  - Cybersecurity becomes a focal point.<hr /><hr />### Monthly Top Performers<hr />- Productivity measured via delivery points; top 5 rewarded with $ICY.<hr />- Recognized top performers: Ngoc Thanh, Chinh Le, Cuong Mai, Tai Pham, Phat Nguyen.<hr /><hr />### Dwarves' 2023 Review<hr />- 2023 was marked by significant organizational shifts; achievement credited to dedicated members and client trust.<hr />- Top achievements include:<hr />  - Record client contract renewals.<hr />  - Community grant bounty program totaled $30k.<hr />  - Monthly product showcases.<hr />  - Established system for rewarding contributors.<hr />  - Dwarves & Techie communities grew to 40k members.<hr />  - Frontend training with 180 participants; Golang training with 82.<hr />  - 102 published stories and 77 tech events/radio talks.<hr /><hr />### Dwarves' YEP 2023<hr />- Early YEP event to allow team members more family time.<hr />- One-day event focused on teamwork and enjoyment.<hr />- Financial allocation: 400 mil VND in awards and gifts; 105 mil VND for tree planting donations.<hr /><hr />### Community Engagement<hr />- Top Discord contributors enhanced knowledge sharing; rewarded with $ICY.<hr />- Future training course updates pending; join Discord for notifications.

497.title: What's New in October 2024
497.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community’s progress. October's updates spotlight our open source initiative, boosted rewards for sharing knowledge, navigating market shifts, weekly tech insights, and a warm celebration of Vietnamese Women’s Day.
497.spr_content: - **Hiring Alert:** Seeking Full-stack Engineers, Business Developers, Marketing specialists. <hr />- **Labs OGIF Office Hour:** Weekly in-depth discussions on AI, Blockchain, Architecture, Finance. Reward insights effectively. <hr />- **Dwarves Open Source Movement:** Contribute to OSS projects. Shape innovation from contributions, earn rewards. <hr />- **Market Adaptation:** Focus on AI, Blockchain, Data as client needs evolve. <hr />  - Consulting dynamics shift: need adaptable, impactful contributors.<hr />  - Lab Team central to innovation; higher expectations and rewards.<hr />  - Discord community thrives as knowledge-sharing hub.<hr />- **Weekly Insights:** Launching Product Design Weekly and AI Digest. <hr />  - Product Design focuses on practical UI/UX tips.<hr />  - AI Digest provides actionable insights without hype.<hr />- **Vietnamese Women’s Day Acknowledgment:** Celebrated women on the team with gifts and dinner, showcasing appreciation.

498.title: Dwarves Of The Year 2022
498.description: It's been a long journey, but we've finally made it to 2022 and what a year it's been for our team of Dwarves. Countless hours of hard work and it's all paid off with our big wins of the year. Honored for all and huge congratulations for our Dwarves of 2022.
498.spr_content: - Reflection on 2022: culmination of hard work, significant achievements.<hr />- Dwarves team celebrated for dedication, recognized with awards totaling ~$18,000.<hr />- Honoring standout individuals; many names repeated for exceptional contributions.<hr />- Emphasis on teamwork: “True testament to collective effort.”<hr />- Focus on product pride and employee well-being.<hr />- Looking forward to 2023: anticipation of challenges and opportunities.<hr />- Commitment to surpassing previous successes and pushing boundaries.

499.title: Summit 2024: Building bonds our way
499.description: Our first international summit took us to Penang, where remote connections turned into real-world chemistry. No rigid schedules or forced activities - just authentic moments of teams choosing their own adventures, from heritage streets to beach sunsets. See how giving people space to connect creates something truly special.
499.spr_content: - Penang's vibrant streets served as the backdrop for team bonding and memory-making.<hr />- Goals: reconnect, recharge, create memories together.<hr />- Instant connection among team members despite remote work.<hr />- First-time travel experiences enhanced excitement; seasoned travelers took on mentoring roles.<hr />- Transition from digital interactions to real-world friendships was seamless.<hr />- Alignment with 2022 vision: Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy.<hr />- **Mastery** manifested in organic storytelling through shared experiences.<hr />- **Meaning** deepened with individual choices enhancing team bonding.<hr />- **Autonomy** encouraged natural interactions and team-generated experiences without constraints.<hr />- **🌉・moments** celebrated team memories via photos and stories:<hr />  - Food adventurers shared meals, strengthening connections.<hr />  - Cultural explorers united over heritage discoveries.<hr />  - Adventure seekers swapped tech for physical challenges.<hr />  - Beach crew enjoyed conversations by the waves.<hr />- Summit underscored that strong connections outlast distances.<hr />- Real-life meetings transformed online rapport into lasting friendships.<hr />- Team moments cultivated an emotional tapestry, reinforcing closeness.<hr />- Celebrating a unique team culture that feels like homecoming.

500.title: What's New in February 2025
500.description: Each month, we roll out a recap of our team and community's strides forward. February’s recap covers the hybrid mode shift, ICY-to-BTC swap testing, updated use cases with AI and trading solutions, skip-level meetings, and the New Year gathering kickoff.
500.spr_content: - **Hybrid model transition:** Shift from remote-first to hybrid; structured office days enhance team alignment; perks introduced to boost engagement.<hr />- **ICY to BTC transition:** Demo successful; swap mechanism functional; final testing underway prior to launch.<hr />- **Tech signal reporting:** Focus on AI agents, blockchain applications, talent market trends; foresight for 2024 opportunities.<hr />- **Engineering solutions updates:** Case studies reflect advancements in AI reporting, security, trading analytics, and data management.<hr />- **Skip-level CEO meetings:** Direct, open dialogue for addressing challenges and enhancing operations; encourages feedback and new ideas.<hr />- **Annual health checkup:** Routine screenings organized for team members; remote travel support available.<hr />- **Health insurance renewal:** Bao Minh health insurance renewal in progress; updates to be provided on Basecamp.<hr />- **New Year gathering:** Team reunion and Tết celebrations; fosters community and shared goals for 2025; highlights available in Weekly Digest #15.

501.title: Summit 2022: Engineering A Good Time
501.description: Having a blast company trip after 2 years of COVID, it didn’t happen in a common way. We planned our trip differently than others and designed apps for everyone to play as a way to bond as company outside physical activities.
501.spr_content: - Engineers-centric bonding approach: Avoided traditional team-building; focused on meaningful experiences. <hr />- First post-COVID company gathering: Celebrated progress, camaraderie, and optimism for 2023.<hr />- Transitioned to Remote First: Adopted remote-first model in 2021; enhanced soft skills for smooth operations across time zones.<hr />- Team growth: 1.5x increase to over 100 members; selective hiring maintains high standards.<hr />- Business development: No ads; relies on client referrals and partnerships; grew to 6 partners bringing in 5 new projects in 2022.<hr />- Community involvement: Active in tech communities; built Dwarves Network with 600+ Discord members; channels for sharing knowledge, learning, and fun.<hr />- Summit 2022 event: Focus on engineering-themed games rather than physical activities; total prizes amounted to 150 million VND (~$6,000).<hr />- Key games included: <hr />  - Treasure Hunt: Location-based app scavenger hunt with quiz elements.<hr />  - Road to Olymwibu: A competitive quiz game with a drinking twist for incorrect answers.<hr />  - Hunger Games: A real-time grid game rewarding points with fruit while penalizing with drinks for bombs.<hr />  - Enigma: Decrypting a hexadecimal message through non-digital means.<hr />- Successful team outing: Engaged in recreational activities in Phu Quoc, enhancing team bonds and enjoyment.<hr />- Future aspirations: Plan for Dwarves Summit 2023 with engineer-designed activities, international trips, larger incentives, and memorable documentation.<hr />- Focus for next year: Incorporate Mastery, Meaning, and Autonomy into team experiences.

502.title: 2020 In Review
502.spr_content: - **Milestone Reflection**: 2019 wraps up the first 5-year milestone and prepares for new challenges.<hr />- **Strategic Focus**: Prioritize territory expansion and team development. Reinvest in foundational stability and impact.<hr />- **Team Evolution**: Transition from a small group to a diverse, impactful team of over 50 members across multiple countries.<hr />- **Remote Collaboration**: Develop a borderless software firm model, overcoming challenges of remote communication and collaboration.<hr />- **Pandemic Impact**: Adapt to the COVID-19 crisis by shifting from growth to survival mode, emphasizing team retention and cultural alignment.<hr />- **Quality Enhancement**: Commit to expanding technical knowledge and optimizing processes for enjoyable workflows.<hr />- **Test Automation**: Establish a QC team and internal testing framework to streamline quality assurance.<hr />- **Real-time Monitoring**: Implement status pages and updates for ongoing project transparency.<hr />- **Innovation Radar**: Introduce a Radar Ring to identify and assess emerging tech trends, leveraging team research for collective learning.<hr />- **Startup Support**: Positioned as a technical partner for startups, offering streamlined project development processes and CI/CD practices.<hr />- **Data-Driven Decisions**: Emphasize data integration in operations to enhance decision-making and establish measurable goals.<hr />- **Partnership Outreach**: Seek global collaborations to foster innovation and shared business goals.<hr />- **Operational Efficiency**: Prioritize automation to minimize disruptions and enhance team alignment and productivity.<hr />- **Transparent Culture**: Maintain open communication channels in a remote work environment to strengthen team cohesion.<hr />- **Holistic Hiring Approach**: Focus on cultural fit and shared values during the hiring process, emphasizing a collaborative environment.<hr />- **Community Impact**: Engage in social contributions, supporting initiatives like cancer patient support and tech education outreach.<hr />- **Open-Source Contributions**: Embrace open-source development to foster innovation and collective problem-solving within the tech community.<hr />- **Indie Studio Initiatives**: Launch Superbits.co to build in-house products that address industry gaps and promote community engagement.<hr />- **Future Aspirations**: Maintain momentum in 2021 with a focus on brand visibility, product-driven mindset, and social impact initiatives.<hr />- **Continuous Improvement**: Approach company development like software: iterative, adaptive, and responsive to challenges.

503.title: Happy 2023
503.description: As we enter a new year, I want to reflect on the role that software has played in my life. For Dwarves 2.x, our goal has always been to be a borderless software firm. As we move into 2022, we are one step closer to achieving this goal. We strive to operate in new and efficient ways, different from the rest. Some of us are working with our peers to help ship their software, while others are building their own projects and striving for excellence. We are all making our way towards achieving excellence in our field.
503.spr_content: - Software is a constant presence, integral to both personal and professional life.<hr />- Over 10,000 hours dedicated to software as an engineer and project manager.<hr />- Crucial role in humanity's technological advancements since the 1940s.<hr />- Babbage's Difference Engine (1822) marks a pivotal moment in computing history.<hr />- Ada Lovelace’s algorithm (1843) recognized as the first computer program.<hr />- Software will continue to evolve, shaping the future of technology and society.<hr />- Old generation: already historical; current generation: crucial and impactful; next generation: full of potential.<hr />- Industry opportunity to shape the evolution of software remains open to all.<hr />- Software viewed merely as a tool or job overlooks deeper significance in innovation and creativity.<hr />- Emphasis on the importance of our roles in creating future impact.<hr />- Dwarves 2.x aims to be a borderless software firm, reflecting a unique operational ethos.<hr />- Team’s collaborative efforts focus on shipping quality software and personal projects.<hr />- Philosophy: “Coding to survive is basic; shipping with pride is admirable; building an empire is fulfilling.”<hr />- Vision for Dwarves: global presence, passion-driven software development.<hr />- Continuation of the theme "Elixir for everything," fostering revolutionary software advancements.<hr />- Wishing health and prosperity in the new year; striving for greatness collectively.

504.title: State of Dwarves: 2024 Semi-annual Review
504.description: The past six months have been packed with many improvements to our Discord server from new standards and automation to engaging activities and rewards. Take a moment to reflect on our journey so far, and let's get excited about what we'll accomplish together before the year ends.
504.spr_content: - Significant progress in testing new standards and increasing automation, activities, and rewards on Discord.<hr />- First Year-End Party (YEP) facilitated offline community connections; successful second meetup in Ho Chi Minh City with 50+ attendees.<hr />- Active community contributions: key resources from members like Long Bui Van and collaborative efforts from @jack and @phucld.<hr />- Development of Dwarves’ wiki, memo.d.foundation, for systematic knowledge sharing and continuous learning.<hr />- Upgraded ICY reward system incentivizing learning: monthly rewards, verification bonuses, and talk participation incentives.<hr />- Introduction of exclusive Peeps NFTs for Dwarves members, allowing access to internal communications and roles.<hr />- Enhancement of internal tools: Tono, Fortress, and Mochi for better task management and user experience.<hr />- Focused research on key tech areas: Tooling, Software Architecture, LLM, Blockchain, and Coding Security.<hr />- Monthly tech trend monitoring revealed advancements in AI/LLM, Rust utilization, serverless architecture, and edge computing benefits.<hr />- OGIF weekly sharing initiative maintained diverse discussions on tech and entrepreneurship, fostering communal learning.<hr />- Reorganization of Discord roles into a structured MMA system to better recognize and reward contributions.<hr />- Monthly recognition of top performers through delivery points and ICY rewards, celebrating individual efforts.<hr />- Participation in Echelon Asia Summit 2024 provided insights into Southeast Asia’s tech ecosystem.<hr />- Launch of Dwarves internship program with new interns joining the team.<hr />- Structural promotions within the team, highlighting career growth opportunities.<hr />- Exciting new merchandise in production, enhancing community pride in the Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Continual dedication to community growth and knowledge sharing as we advance toward 2024.

505.title: Dwarves Of The Year 2021
505.description: A big congratulations to our Dwarves of 2021. Apart from the team's voting result for each title, the team leads also selected the Honorable Mention and Client Endorsed, as we want to honor all of the hard work.
505.spr_content: - Team voting results for titles.<hr />- Honors: **Honorable Mention**, **Client Endorsed**.<hr />- Recognition of hard work and close final results.<hr />- Dwarves of 2021 announcement.<hr />- Prize selection process linked to prize value.<hr />- Any item selection allowed, total value ≤ prize value.<hr />- Cash redemption not permitted.<hr />- Deadline for prize selection: **Jan 14, 2022**.<hr />- If unable to input prize, contact Duy.<hr />- Wishlist item matching prize value support available through Duy.<hr />- Mini merchandise set prepared for the team.<hr />- Input info in Team Address tab.<hr />- Congratulations to Dwarves of 2021.<hr />- Gratitude to all Dwarves teammates for seven years of collaboration.<hr />- Wish for happiness and success in 2022.

506.title: Changelog
506.description: Sign up for our newsletter to stay up-to-date on our latest news, tips, and updates. We'll deliver valuable content straight to your inbox, keeping you informed and engaged with stuff happening at Dwarves.
506.spr_content: - Newsletter page as a hub of information.<hr />- Latest industry news and updates included.<hr />- Valuable content from Dwarves' engineers featured.<hr />- Snapshot of operations with engineers and community.<hr />- Aim to keep readers informed and engaged.

507.title: What's New in May 2022
507.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. In May, we kicked off Apprenticeship training, and our new chalet is ready for community to visit.
507.spr_content: - **Project Update**: Concluded partnership with Relay and Eklipse; new resources allocated for project workload balance. Contact Giang or Nikki for discussions.<hr />  <hr />- **Blockchain Integration**: Insights from Sr. Blockchain Engineer Ngoc Thanh; team encouraged to share learnings through study groups and discussion channels. <hr /><hr />- **Apprenticeship Launch**: Seven new Apprentices enrolled; use Discord Event button for updates and session preferences. Continuous improvements underway.<hr /><hr />- **Summer Interns**: Four new Interns from Bach Khoa welcomed; mentors present to guide through workflows. Tracking progress via daily updates.<hr /><hr />- **Data Team Formation**: Initial members Tom and Dung focus on data's critical role in business. Interested team members can reach out to Tom. Dung’s Apache Spark sharing scheduled for Jun 06 at 5 PM.<hr /><hr />- **Radio Talks Recap**: Highlights of discussions like React 18 and Remix vs. Next.js available on Memo. Full streams accessible on Dwarves Youtube channel.<hr /><hr />- **Dalat Office Improvements**: Office visit encouraged; recent enhancements include rock fences, plant dividers, and standing desks.<hr /><hr />- **Industry Adaptation**: Emphasis on expanding blockchain expertise; Dwarves engaged in partnerships related to blockchain initiatives. Senior Dwarves to pursue further training and projects aligning with business goals. Anticipating new partnerships in June.

508.title: 2022 In Review
508.description: Successfully went through 2022, a year that we might say -  a new record team reached highest growth record, kickstarted community engagement, home, compliance training & individual development are speeding up, and a whole new place to call Dwarves.
508.spr_content: - **2022 Achievements**: Record growth, enhanced community engagement, focus on compliance training, individual development.<hr />- **Team Expansion**: Reached 80 team members, hired 30 new members, culture preservation mechanisms in place.<hr />- **Leadership Shift**: From traditional Board of Directors to leadership based on individual contributions, adapting to a larger team and hybrid work model.<hr />- **R&D Initiatives**: Formation of an R&D department, completed challenges like Feature Flags to enhance DevOps and engineering efficiency.<hr />- **Learning Focus**: Emphasis on "Fastest Learners Win", launched open learning initiatives, significant community engagement through knowledge sharing.<hr />- **Revenue Growth**: 198% growth despite global economic challenges, profitable business model reinforcing quality software delivery.<hr />- **Investments**: Collaborations with Console Labs, Chumbi Valley, and Tatsu in decentralized applications and blockchain technology.<hr />- **Security Enhancements**: Comprehensive measures for client protection including device and network security protocols.<hr />- **Gaming Department**: Established to create interactive experiences for engineers, piloted games like Hunger Game and Treasure Hunt.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Active participation across multiple online platforms, organized Offline contests, including successful Coding Camp.<hr />- **Workplace Innovations**: Launched Dwarves Hubs in Danang and Dalat, offered travel benefits and engaged team-building activities post-COVID.<hr />- **Apprenticeship Program**: Successful program producing skilled apprentices advancing to client projects, fostering leadership development.<hr />- **Employee Experience**: Introduced $ICY token for community contributions, options for crypto-native salary payments, and robust referral programs.<hr />- **Vision for Dwarves 3.0**: Empowerment through mastery, meaningful work, and autonomy, emphasizing engineering culture and quality outcomes.<hr />- **Future Aspirations**: Continued growth, commitment to impactful software development, and community-focused innovations.

509.title: What's New in November 2023
509.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes in our company and our team. November is our month for meetups and outstanding craftsmanship.
509.spr_content: - **Labs Team Launch:** Dwarves R&D team operational; focus on emerging technologies and practical applications.<hr />- **Monthly Top Performers:** Rewards for top 5 members based on delivery points; winners receive $ICY and NFT badges that can be staked for company shares.<hr />- **Salary Advance Program:** Members can access up to 25% of their salary in $ICY during emergencies; redeemable via Discord command.<hr />- **memo.d.foundation Upgrade:** Enhanced homepage, organized content, and added searchable features for improved user experience.<hr />- **Active Discord Community:** ~400 active users; incentives for top contributors; bounties available for participation.<hr />- **Upcoming Talent Needs:** Open positions for React Native Developer (contract) and Admin/Ops (full-time); contact for details.<hr />- **Client Features Released:** Time-sensitive alarms, money transfer, live annotation, streamlined user sign-up/login processes.<hr />- **Techie Stories on TikTok:** Showcasing tech life narratives from the US & Japan. <hr />- **Future Focus Areas:** Research in WASM, Passwordless technology, Rust, AI, MPC, UI practices, Elixir, Golang.

510.title: 2024 In Review
510.description: Closing another milestone with 2024, it has been a year of building and rebuilding ,  strengthening what works, fixing what doesn’t, and uncovering new paths along the way. Every milestone reached this year carries the marks of teamwork and persistence.
510.spr_content: - Dwarves integrates a 50% company, 50% community ethos.<hr />- Knowledge transformation and sharing are central; community growth is emphasized.<hr />- 2024 marked a year of rebuilding and uncovering new pathways.<hr />- Milestones reflect teamwork and persistence in navigating market shifts.<hr />- Key initiatives: AI integration as a daily tool, growth in lab team, 37 OGIF sessions contributing to collective solutions.<hr />- Knowledge sharing incorporated into culture: 335 memo entries as a testament.<hr />- **memo.d.foundation** evolved from a wiki to a knowledge hub, enhancing collaboration through streamlined submissions and notifications.<hr />- OGIF sessions showcased diverse expertise and fostered a culture of learning.<hr />- ICY reward system sparked engagement; $9k distributed with significant focus on AI/LLM.<hr />- Copilot tools created to enhance workflows with practical AI solutions.<hr />- Internal tool improvements (Fortress, Tono, Mochi) automated and simplified operations.<hr />- Weekly commentary series expanded to deliver actionable insights across four domains.<hr />- AI Club established for collaborative exploration of AI tools and workflows.<hr />- 40 promising research topics identified, addressing tooling, architecture, LLM, blockchain, and security.<hr />- Enhanced tool integrations (Notion, Slack) to improve daily workflows.<hr />- New team members joined, highlighting ongoing community growth and evolving skill sets.<hr />- Transition to hourly billing introduced for client flexibility and team clarity.<hr />- Focused on refining service packages in response to market demands around AI, blockchain, and data.<hr />- Commitment to open-source projects fostering innovation and community contributions.<hr />- Active engagement in the tech community through meetups and events for networking and knowledge sharing.<hr />- Workplaces designed for productivity, equipped with modern tools and flexible spaces.<hr />- Introduction of Peeps NFTs to recognize and appreciate team contributions.<hr />- Team retreat in Penang strengthened bonds and collaboration.<hr />- Vision for 2025 emphasizes experimentation, community growth, and continuous learning.<hr />- Future aims include addressing technological questions and nurturing a strong belief in team values.

511.title: What's New in July 2024
511.description: Each month, we release a recap highlighting key updates and progress within our team and community. July covers AI advancements, community contributions, insights from Vietnam's tech scene, new memo commands, OGIF automation, and the introduction of our hourly billing model
511.spr_content: - Significant advancements in AI, increased cybersecurity focus, and shifts in software trends characterize the tech landscape.<hr />- Meta’s Llama 3.1 and OpenAI’s GPT-4o-mini offer competitive enhancements in open-source AI capabilities.<hr />- Claude Sonnet 3.5 boosts software development speed notably, while AI applications in performance analytics emerge.<hr />- Cybersecurity challenges necessitate resilient designs to avoid failures; emphasis on "boring" technology and full-stack integration prevails.<hr />- A new memo command enhances team collaboration, with streamlined processes and notifications for memo operations.<hr />- The distribution of ~857 ICY rewards signifies strong community engagement in contributions.<hr />- Vietnam's tech market shows robust growth, with a projected digital economy of $43 billion by 2025 driven by AI, fintech, and crypto investments.<hr />- Initiatives to automate OGIF session recordings aim to enhance efficiency and knowledge-sharing processes.<hr />- Dwarves’ exploration of Golang for enterprise solutions reflects ongoing commitment to leveraging the language’s advantages.<hr />- Introduction of an hourly billing model promotes fairness and transparency in client engagements.

512.title: What's New in June 2024
512.description: In June, we expanded our knowledge base on software design, LLMs, and blockchain, while actively encouraging knowledge-sharing through increased ICY rewards. Our Vietnam Tech Scene report highlighted key industry players, and weekly OGIF talks fostered discussions on diverse tech topics like design patterns, data modalities, and blockchain architecture
512.spr_content: - Focus on software design, LLM, and blockchain for continuous learning at memo.d.foundation.<hr />- Increased ICY rewards correspond to valuable fleeting notes, enhancing the learning system.<hr />- Dwarves community engagement resulted in ~500 ICY rewards for contributions in OGIF talks, tech sharing, and Memo notes.<hr />- Vietnam's tech landscape shows significant growth, especially in AI, fintech, and blockchain/crypto sectors.<hr />- Weekly OGIF talks foster knowledge-sharing; topics included design patterns and blockchain architecture.<hr />- Mastery, Meaning, and Autonomy (MMA) drive brainery content growth; contributors add impactful entries on relevant subjects.<hr />- ICY rewards system encourages participation: sharing expertise earns up to 25 ICY, quick notes earn 3-5 ICY, and top contributors are recognized weekly.<hr />- Dwarves Token usage highlights community involvement through contributions to discussions and shared resources.<hr />- Highlighted topics in OGIF include behavior design patterns and content mapping.<hr />- Vietnam ranked third in Southeast Asia for tech investment; digital economy projected to reach $43 billion by 2025.<hr />- Key players in AI and fintech sectors significantly impact Vietnam's tech growth; blockchain/crypto innovation led by major investors.<hr />- Favorable legal conditions are supporting the tech ecosystem's expansion and innovation.

513.title: What's New in February 2024
513.description: In this second month of 2024, we're eyeing on what's brewing in the tech market, what's happening in our community and internally, the newest topics we're looking forward to researching and putting on the field, and expanding our partner network.
513.spr_content: - **Reporting Tech Signals**: Monthly analysis of potential tech trends; focus on serverless computing, AI/ML, FinOps, cybersecurity.<hr />  - **Key Insights**:<hr />    - AWS Low Latency Runtime (LLRT) enhances serverless apps with >10x speed and 2x cost reduction; notable languages: Rust, QuickJS.<hr />    - System engineering gains prominence over traditional coding in AI era.<hr />    - New method targets 1.58 bits/parameter in LLMs to cut computational and energy costs.<hr />    - FinOps pivots to waste reduction amidst global economic challenges.<hr />    - White House emphasizes need for memory-safe languages; advocates for C#, Go, Java, Python, Rust, Swift.<hr /><hr />- **Research Topics 2024**: Commitment to technology-driven problem-solving via research.<hr />  - Approximately 40 topics in backlog; selection via member nomination/voting.<hr />  - Participation required from all members; senior-led bounty items established.<hr />  - Community engagement welcomed; skill assessment for contributors.<hr /><hr />- **Dwarves' Reward System**: Initiating rewards for community contributions through ICY tokens.<hr />  - Participation in community activities earns ICY; knowledge sharing and basic interactions valued.<hr />  - Reward system under development to acknowledge active members.<hr /><hr />- **Monthly Top Performers**: Tracking productivity through delivery points; top 5 earn ICY rewards.<hr />  - February achievers: Chinh Le, Hai Huynh, Khac Vy, Tai Pham, Tay Nguyen.<hr /><hr />- **Partner Network**: Seeking partners for co-creation opportunities.<hr />  - Average project size: $30,000; potential commission starting at $2,400 per project.<hr />  - Additional perks and benefits available; contact Nikki for interest.

514.title: 2018 In Review
514.spr_content: - 2018: Year of memorable achievements and growth.<hr />- New team structure implemented for better collaboration.<hr />- Core values defined and actively fostered as part of the culture.<hr />- Transitioned to a new office space, symbolizing fresh beginnings.<hr />- Welcomed new team members, referred to as "dwarves," enhancing diversity and talent.<hr />- Team scaled from 15 to approximately 30, uniting smart individuals.<hr />- Commitment to building the first global software company initiated.<hr />- Focus on learning best practices to ensure quality software delivery.<hr />- Beginning of a new chapter; foundation laid for future success.<hr />- Gratitude expressed for contributions and collaboration.<hr />- Optimistic outlook for 2019, with continued teamwork and innovation.

515.title: What's New in December 2021
515.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. December 2022 will go over our growth in blockchain, team members, upgrade on the benefits packages.
515.spr_content: - Focus on real blockchain projects within **#blockchain** **#web3** channels for learning and collaboration.<hr />- Welcoming new team members Hien, Tu, and Ngoc Mai to Spike Inu and Eklipse; seeking further opportunities.<hr />- Selective project decisions promise larger clients and optimized team deployment.<hr />- Aim to deploy at least 3 Dwarves on remaining projects; improved headcount aligns with delivery capacity.<hr />- Team growth recognized: Cuong Mai, Tom, Ngoc Mai passed probation; new member Phat Ha leads Nghe Nhan Trading.<hr />- Continued client endorsements of Dwarves' credible project outputs (Momos, Relay, BeaverBitcoin, Tokenomy).<hr />- New team members: Ngoc Thanh (Spike Inu), An Tran (Nghe Nhan Trading), Tom (LFW BE and study group), Hoang Nguyen (SP Digital).<hr />- Upgraded benefits package includes base salary adjustments and work-from-home station enhancements.<hr />- Remote hubs will offer one-way tickets starting Q1 2022; potential tech events in Da Nang.<hr />- Celebrating **Dwarves of 2021**; collecting input for team improvements logged for 2022 to-do list.<hr />- Small gifts planned for team members who provide required information; encouraging a strong start to 2022.

516.title: Road To 100
516.description: 2022 matched us with the 80th Dwarves. A notable highlight, and we're ready to have more. It's not easy to find people that has the same value. It takes true & solid seeks.
516.spr_content: - 2022 marked the collaboration with the 80th Dwarves; successful partnerships lead to future opportunities.<hr />- Recognizing the challenge of finding individuals with shared values requires diligent searching.<hr />- Launching a mechanism to identify like-minded individuals for co-creation through technology.<hr />- Introducing the Dwarves Referral Program: encourages team members to recommend potential hires.<hr />- Quality of recommendations enhances the hiring process, leveraging existing networks.<hr />- Talented individuals can be sourced from ex-colleagues, university friends, or high school acquaintances.<hr />- Maximizing funds on referrals instead of headhunters; rewarding referrers with monetary bonuses.<hr />- Referrer earns **2.5%** of project service fee for successful hires until January 1, 2023.<hr />- Bonus payout occurs upon project invoice completion; referrer must remain employed with the company.<hr />- Example: Referral of B by A leads to a monthly earning of $125 for A if B’s project fee is $5000.<hr />- Five successful referrals can generate **$625/month** in passive income.<hr />- Introduction of the **Dwarves' Referral Dashboard of 2022** for tracking statistics and leaderboard.<hr />- Special acknowledgment to contributors for developing the dashboard.<hr />- Referrals from team members may receive priority in selection.

517.title: What's New in April 2024
517.description: In this April, we're focused on memo upgrading, reward system, OGIF, internal tooling, community meetup and market report.
517.spr_content: - **Tech Signals Report**: Major highlights in AI include Meta's Llama 3, growth of Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, edge computing shift, and Bun 1.1's impact on JavaScript.<hr />- **Meta's Llama 3**: Enhanced self-hosting for LLM applications, increasing AI accessibility.<hr />- **RAG Systems**: Integrate real-time data for improved LLM accuracy.<hr />- **Edge Computing**: Emergence for faster, more economical web applications.<hr />- **Bun 1.1**: Speed and compatibility innovations in JavaScript; enhances developer flexibility with UI design.<hr />- **memo.d.foundation Enhancements**: Introduction of a new sidebar, pinned notes, and reading mode for improved usability.<hr />- **User Interface Improvements**: Cleaner organization, enhanced navigation, author context, and reading time estimation.<hr />- **Tonobot and Fortress Updates**: Advanced features for tracking Dwarves Network activity, generating contributor lists, and real-time updates.<hr />- **Monthly ICY Learning Rewards**: New incentive structure for knowledge contributions; fosters learning and sharing.<hr />- **Dwarves Office Hour**: Weekly community sharing sessions for collaborative learning on various tech topics.<hr />- **Upcoming Event**: Community meetup in Ho Chi Minh City on May 31.

518.title: What's New in October 2023
518.description: Each month, we release a recap noting all the significant changes with our company and our team. October is our month for open-source and reflections.
518.spr_content: - Dwarves: 50% company, 50% community model.<hr />- Knowledge sharing: Transform work experiences into community lessons.<hr />- Monthly recaps: Summary of significant changes; October highlights include key initiatives and accomplishments.<hr />- note.d.foundation: Company wiki for knowledge-sharing, documentation, and operations.<hr />- New functional teams: Core team expanded into 5 teams for better delivery (Labs, Consulting, Console, Techie, Ventures).<hr />- MMA-based career development: Focus on Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy; personalized growth paths fostered by performance indicators.<hr />- Frontend Course 2023: Successful completion; 4x participant increase versus previous courses indicates community engagement.<hr />- Droppii partnership: 15 months of collaboration to enhance technology and build a tech team; 4 products developed.<hr />- Community growth: Discord hosts 2050 members; engagement through knowledge sharing and rewards (ICY).<hr />- Upcoming events: Golang Meetup, Techie x Webuild Summit.<hr />- FAQ highlights: No current internships, but apprenticeship programs available; ways to contribute via Discord or Bounties; recurring events include Radio Talk, Tech Event, and Community Call.

519.title: 2019 In Review
519.spr_content: - Reflection on the past year, marking 5 years of survival despite challenges.<hr />- Each individual faced personal challenges; notable progress and achievements witnessed.<hr />- Growth from about 30 members in 2018 to about 50 members by year-end 2023.<hr />- Transformation from youthful inexperience to a collective state of burgeoning experience.<hr />- Organizational focus on integrating people and technology at the core; extraordinary operational approach.<hr />- Despite turnover, the ethos and spirit of individuals endure within Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Known for unconventional occurrences, fostering belief in a bright future.<hr />- 2019’s hardships were met with significant achievements and numerous failures.<hr />- Strong teams are anchored in people and shared beliefs; collective intelligence emphasized.<hr />- Quote from Uncle Ho on teamwork serves as a guiding principle; left for personal reflection.<hr />- Gratitude expressed towards contributions of all members on behalf of the community.<hr />- Theme for 2020: 'The borderless software firm'; anticipation for future collaboration.<hr />- Warm New Year wishes conveyed.

520.title: What's New in December 2023
520.description: In December, we launched our Consulting Team, released our finding on tech trends, and last but not least, got everyone ready to wrap up 2023.
520.spr_content: - **Dwarves Overview:** Dual structure - 50% company, 50% community. Knowledge sharing as a cornerstone.<hr />- **December Highlights:** <hr />  - Launched Consulting Team.<hr />  - Reported tech trends.<hr />  - Prepared for 2023 wrap-up.<hr />- **Tech Signal Reporting:** <hr />  - Monitoring high-potential technologies monthly.<hr />  - Current focus: AI, WebGPU, Actor Model, Security as Code, nNFT standards.<hr />  - Programming languages: Rust, Lua, Dart.<hr />- **Consulting Team Launch:** <hr />  - Collective expertise and knowledge sharing.<hr />  - Encourages innovation and transparent communication.<hr />- **Top Performers:** <hr />  - Monthly assessment via delivery points.<hr />  - December winners: Nam Nguyen, Lap Nguyen, Ngoc Thanh, Jim, Hung Vong.<hr />  - Recent features include Mochi UI and an in-house Rust game.<hr />- **Dwarves of the Year 2023:** <hr />  - Tradition of rewarding impactful team members.<hr />  - $25k in rewards across categories.<hr />  - Celebration event in Saigon on Jan 13th.<hr />- **Performance Review Philosophy:** <hr />  - Evaluates skill and personal growth.<hr />  - Focus on Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy (MMA).<hr />- **Community Engagement:**<hr />  - Discord contributors rewarded with $ICY.<hr />  - Techie's Tiktok reaches 16k followers.<hr />- **Job Openings:** <hr />  - Admin / Ops and Technical Recruiter positions available.<hr />  - Contact: spawn@d.foundation or @nikki on Discord for details.<hr />- **FAQs:**<hr />  - No current internships; updates on apprenticeship programs forthcoming.<hr />  - Contribution via Discord and Bounties rewarded in ICY.<hr />  - Regular events: Radio Talk, Monthly Tech Event, Community Call.

521.title: What's New in March 2024
521.description: In this March, we're eyeing on what's brewing in the tech market, ICY updates in 2024, the first offline meetup and product demo.
521.spr_content: - **Reporting Tech Signals**: Focus on AI, API techniques, tools, programming languages, design-engineering intersection.<hr />- **ICY 2024**: Updates on ICY's progression and community engagement.<hr />- **Demo & Showcase**: Regular monthly product demos at Dwarves.<hr />- **Community Meet-Up**: First offline event in Saigon with community members.<hr /><hr />### Reporting Tech Signals: GenAI Impact<hr />- March 2024 insights: emerging tech, business advantages.<hr />- Rise of individual-led app development, prompt engineering growth.<hr />- GenAI's productivity benefits lead to enterprise adoption.<hr />- Enhanced infrastructure and API techniques boost efficiency.<hr />- Significant LLM design advancements foster next-gen virtual assistants.<hr />- [Full report available](https://memo.d.foundation/playground/_labs/market-report-mar-2024/)<hr /><hr />### ICY Updates 2024<hr />- ICY launched in Sept 2022 to incentivize network engagement.<hr />- March highlights: ICY giveaways for new Discord members; new role system.<hr />- Transition of ICY contract from Polygon to Base chain for NFT/staking capabilities.<hr />- Mochi wallet linked with GitHub for ICY rewards.<hr />- [Discord server setup guide](https://memo.d.foundation/playbook/community/starting-your-journey-at-dwarves-discord/)<hr /><hr />### Community Engagement: Offline Meetups<hr />- Starting April: quarterly offline meetups in Ho Chi Minh City to enhance community connections.<hr /><hr />### Demo & Showcase: Backr Tool<hr />- Monthly discussions include project demos; highlight tool: [Backr](https://getbackr.vercel.app/) for stylish screenshot enhancement.<hr />- Team member Khac Vy involved in weekly Solana event, "Build Station," for developer networking.<hr /><hr />**Upcoming**: Offline meetup in Ho Chi Minh City (date TBA).

522.title: Weekly Digest #8: Then came the last days of May
522.description: Here's to hoping for a brighter and better month on this last day of May. We’re in the heat of a community offline meet-up today, gathering to discuss the month’s progress. Everyone's a bit busy arranging their travel to Saigon, a wild place we all call home. So, let’s dive into what we’ve been up to.
522.spr_content: - Anticipation for brighter June on last day of May.  <hr />- Community offline meet-up in Saigon; discussions on monthly progress.  <hr />- Event originally in April, rescheduled for better preparation.  <hr />- Members traveling from Hanoi, Danang, excited for gathering.  <hr />- Comfort and openness encouraged in interactions; community spirit emphasized.  <hr />- Birthday wishes for @datpv; appreciation for positivity and contributions.  <hr />- Interest in astrology and personality typing; reflection on traits and strengths.  <hr />- Humor in zodiac traits (e.g., Libra's indecisiveness, Pisces's dreaminess, Leo's confidence).  <hr />- Celebration of individual identities and self-awareness.  <hr />- Upcoming wedding for Lap, family traveling to Ninh Thuan for festivities.  <hr />- Team spirit with new t-shirts featuring a simple, stylish logo created by @anna.  <hr />- @huytq returns from Korea with gifts for community members.  <hr />- Introduction of plank exercises by @hieuthu1 for health and activity at work.  <hr />- Importance of shared interests in community building; different "guilds" for diverse preferences.  <hr />- Continuous enhancement of community connections encouraged.  <hr />- Optimistic about expanding the server and building a vibrant community.  <hr />- Farewell to May; hopeful for a lucky June ahead, with invitation to connect online.

523.title: Weekly Digest #10: From lean to learner
523.description: Double digits, I can't believe we've reached our 10th digest! It's been quite a journey putting together each edition and a blast creating these for you. When we talk about memo, we're highlighting an essential part of our learning culture. We’ve just noted a few updates for the cycle ahead. Now, let's dive into this round-up.
523.spr_content: - Celebrating the 10th edition of the digest; a journey of knowledge sharing.<hr />- Emphasis on memo as a core aspect of learning culture; it tracks team and community insights.<hr />- Enhanced contributor rewards: 3000 ICY (~4500 USDC) monthly for knowledge sharing.<hr />- Open invitation for contributions via Discord; community engagement encouraged.<hr />- Increased ICY rewards for shared links in tech channels; all members can participate.<hr />- AI advancements featured at Apple’s WWDC 2024; partnership with OpenAI improves Siri.<hr />- AI concept transitioning from futuristic to daily integration; evokes mixed emotions.<hr />- Annual health checkup for Dwarves scheduled in June; communication channel opened for queries.<hr />- VN-Index market recap: erratic trading behavior leading to significant losses; psychology driving market changes.<hr />- Strategy needed during volatile market conditions to avoid financial risks.<hr />- Upcoming EURO 2024 matches starting June 14th; community excitement and predictions encouraged.<hr />- Gratitude expressed to members for sharing valuable insights and contributions.<hr />- Continuous feedback welcomed for improving online experiences.

524.title: Weekly Digest #2: Walk around learn around
524.description: There are so many amazingly fun and wonderfully weird things happening on Discord, both last week and of course, today. So let’s dive in with a freshly-brewed “cà phê sữa,” of course.
524.spr_content: - Discord activities are vibrant and diverse, encouraging community engagement.<hr />- The COO sparked joy with a discussion on a worn battery, leading to unexpected banter about 4 billion VND.<hr />- Offline interaction promotes team bonding; a bookstore visit evolved into an adventurous WALA session.<hr />- Career advice shared by the COO provides a framework for informed decision-making in a dynamic job market.<hr />- Engagement in **#⛺・random** highlights the humorous side of AI-generated memes, enhancing community fun.<hr />- Discussions about fluctuating gold prices and investments evolve into deeper conversations on financial strategies.<hr />- Celebrating birthdays strengthens community ties, wishing well for members @fuatto and @tay.

525.title: Weekly Digest #4: Finding your authentic tribe
525.description: Welcome back to the #4 weekly digest after a long holiday. Those Discord channels are still buzzing with active messages. Without further ado, let’s see what I’ve got to share.
525.spr_content: - Weekly digest #4 resumes after holiday; Discord channels active.<hr />- Culture through conversation: memes, opinions, inside jokes, snark.<hr />- Engagement strategy: low-effort, high-reward connection with readers.<hr />- New merchandise arriving soon: t-shirts and stickers; excitement builds.<hr />- OGIF tradition: Friday knowledge sharing; 4 editions in one month.<hr />- Short, interesting presentations; team encouraged to share ideas.<hr />- Team welcomes @minhkek (BD) post-probation; @datnguyennnx joins as intern.<hr />- Celebrating @jack’s integration into the group; camaraderie emphasized.<hr />- Remote work leads to team activities: English, Poker, Board Games, Swimming, Running.<hr />- Shared memories strengthen team bond: wedding cheer for @nam, foodie road trip.<hr />- Team appreciation: Birthday wishes to @thangnt and @lapnn; celebration encouraged.

526.title: Weekly Digest #6: Come for the conversation, stay for the culture
526.description: Hi, it’s @innno again. Summer is almost here. But don't worry, this update is all about making your day more comfortable. Now, onto this week’s updates.
526.spr_content: - Community meet-up on May 31 in Ho Chi Minh City; mix of news, tech, food, drinks.<hr />- Local attendance encouraged; out-of-towners utilize support channel for assistance.<hr />- Changes in ICY distribution: new activities, newborns eligible for 100 ICY rewards.<hr />- Last week's OGIF focused on Factory Pattern, State Machines, and trading insights.<hr />- Promotions: @hnh to Chief of Staff, @minh_cloud to Junior Product Manager and Executive Assistant.<hr />- HadoHQ bustling with familiar faces; Friday night gathering celebrated camaraderie.<hr />- @lap's wedding celebrations; @vincent's road trip inquiries and adventure plans discussed.<hr />- Alert on cyber security; recent credit card hack reminds of online vigilance.<hr />- GPT-4o rollout highlights speed, writing quality, and human-like voice responses. <hr />- Encouragement for community engagement as seasons change; continued Discord interactions emphasized.

527.title: Digest
527.description: A collection of both our internal and external events, including the things we do with the Labs team, Consulting team, Operations, team, and the community.
527.spr_content: - Collection of events: Internal and external.<hr />- Collaborations: Labs team, Consulting team, Operations team, community.<hr />- Resource: Latest Digest for updates and highlights.<hr />- Content: Fresh articles, breaking news, trending topics.<hr />- Purpose: Keep users informed and engaged.<hr />- Regular updates: Ensures relevance and timeliness.<hr />- Emphasis on importance: Quick catch-up on field interests.<hr />- Data query: SQL structure for retrieving recent digest entries.

528.title: Weekly Digest #5: Endure the hardship, delay the gratification
528.description: Happy Monday, I’m here again, bringing you a lot of updates. There are big and small things brewing at Dwarves network. As we keep on crafting a better community day by day with you.
528.spr_content: - Community updates from Dwarves Network.<hr />- Upcoming participation at Echelon X Asia Summit 2024 on May 15-16.<hr />- Leaders @tieubao, @nikki, and @huytq to represent Dwarves.<hr />- Focus on collaboration and innovation at Southeast Asia's largest startup summit.<hr />- New merchandise in progress, including community-designed t-shirts with voting opportunity for final design.<hr />- OGIF (Oh God It's Friday) tradition on Fridays at 5 PM for casual showcases on Discord.<hr />- Recorded sessions available for those who miss live showcases.<hr />- Celebration of @hieuvd's 4th work anniversary; recognition of commitment and community spirit.<hr />- Introduction of new channel: **👑・stoicism**; emphasis on delaying gratification for long-term rewards.<hr />- Announcement of new stickers for Discord chats, including default "Hello" sticker, encouraging creative expressions.<hr />- Launch of 📈・**econ-cafe** channel for discussions on economics and stock trading, featuring insights from COO @nikki.<hr />- Call for dandruff remedies from CEO @baddeed; encourages sharing of tips and hacks.<hr />- Commitment to building and enriching community experiences.<hr />- Reminder to cherish positivity and warmth during summer.

529.title: Weekly Digest #7: A journey through time
529.description: The sun peeks over the horizon, Saturday vibes and good news – the perfect combo. We're about to spice up your weekend with a recap of all the awesome things we whipped up this week.
529.spr_content: - **Weekend Vibes**: Sun rises, signaling joy and productivity. <hr />- **Open-Source Perk**: Free GitHub Copilot with contributions; helps learning and coding experience. <hr />- **Scam Awareness**: @trkhoi experiences Discord hacking accusation and fake support threat; community cautioned against scams. <hr />- **Birthday Cheers**: Celebrating @anna’s birthday; atmosphere filled with joy and laughter among team members. <hr />- **Nostalgic Reflection**: New community member feels nostalgia from shared photos; highlights past adventures and cohesive experiences. <hr />- **New Snapshot Feature**: Monthly Community Snapshot introduced; visual summary of updates praised for design. <hr />- **Two-Month Reflection**: Growth in writing and community engagement over two months of weekly digests; gratitude expressed towards members. <hr />- **Future Updates**: Anticipation for next digest showcasing exciting community developments.

530.title: Weekly Digest #3: We all start somewhere
530.description: Huge news is on the horizon. You absolutely will not guess what we’re about to share. Excitement building, we remember last week like it was yesterday, but what truly counts is that you're here with us.
530.spr_content: - Anticipation of significant news; invitation for engagement in conversations.<hr />- Reflect on career beginnings; personal journey post-hiatus at age 27 encourages perspective shift.<hr />- CEO highlights Khanh Vy as Gen Z inspiration; prompts motivations and challenges.<hr />- Community interest in holiday plans; diverse activities ranging from travel to board games.<hr />- Southeast Asia Blockchain event in Thailand; CEO sponsors 50% for participants.<hr />- Community events in **#📈・econ-cafe** for knowledge sharing and connection among tech enthusiasts.<hr />- Discussion surrounding gold prices; interest in investment fluctuations and passive income insights.<hr />- Celebration of community engagement; gratitude for active participation in discussions.<hr />- Launch of Dwarves Internship Program for student training and career development; open invitations for applications.

531.title: Weekly Digest #1: What do you stand for?
531.description: Our Discord crew is buzzing with energy after our last Friday community call, with folks sharing snapshots of their workspaces, Anna shared the movie quote and catch-up with peeps at lobby, random channels.
531.spr_content: - Community engagement peaks post-call; workspace sharing thrives.<hr />- Digital nomad lifestyle embraced; "work hard, play hard" ethos promoted.<hr />- Best work emerges from feeling one's best self.<hr />- Invitation to share personal workspace; community inclusivity emphasized.<hr />- Team inspired by quote; reflection on "What do you stand for?"<hr />- Diverse authentic responses: curiosity, family, inner peace, freedom.<hr />- Open sharing fosters deep connections within the tribe.<hr />- Encouragement to join conversations and contribute personal insights.<hr />- Virtual channels (#random, #lobby) serve as social hangouts; fun and connection prioritized.<hr />- Personal check-ins about members (@bien, @vincent) create camaraderie.<hr />- Continuous encouragement for conversation and community bonding.

532.title: Weekly Digest #12: Summer moments - Our team's remote work adventures
532.description: There’s something special about bringing people together. Even as a remote team, we connect through shared interests and activities. "This summer, Where Are You Working From?" campaign sparked a wave of fun and connection across the team. Come along as we share the stories of our team members.
532.spr_content: - Bringing people together ignites passion and connection.<hr />- Remote teamwork fostered through group activities: English, Poker, Board Games, Swimming, Running.<hr />- Shared experiences create lasting bonds; moments yield memories.<hr />- @vincent in Switzerland: work-leisure balance captured in a simple walk.<hr />- @nhuthm in Danang, @tom with Phan Rang views; local engagement enhances remote culture.<hr />- @lapnn balances perfectionism with organized workspaces; offers food recommendations.<hr />- @phucld thrives with productivity boosts from scenic cafés; environment affects work.<hr />- @bienvh promotes relocating for refreshing workspaces, nature-relations encouraged.<hr />- @anna's playful spirit highlighted through vibrant nails, showcasing team culture and joy.<hr />- Summer office views from HadoHQ—sunsets symbolize unity through shared experiences.<hr />- @minhlq blends family business with work; personal and professional life coexist.<hr />- @nikki humorously embraces summer vibes while managing responsibilities remotely.<hr />- @jim's impressive anime workspace symbols passion; team shares diverse interests and collections.<hr />- @hnh's serene work environment at Tuyen Lam Lake fosters productivity; exploration of tranquil settings.<hr />- Discord servers/guilds facilitate niche community-building; smaller groups enhance personal connections.<hr />- Essence of team embodies shared moments, diverse passions, and collective growth.

533.title: Forward Engineering December 2023
533.description: We have focused on revamping how we learn, familiarize, and work with tech. We are excited to announce that we have updated our Forward Engineering to better reflect the feedback and insights from our Labs team, Operations Team, and Consulting Team.
533.spr_content: - **Focus:** Revamping learning, familiarization, and work processes with technology.<hr />- **Updates:** Enhanced Forward Engineering based on feedback from Labs, Operations, and Consulting Teams.<hr />- **Goal:** Provide comprehensive tech publication, foster collaboration and innovation.<hr />- **Feedback:** Encouragement for thoughts and insights on content.<hr /><hr />### Tech Radar<hr />- **Rust:** Explored for compiler tooling; community project shifted perspective on speed, safety, and performance. Evolving for web development and AI; examining concurrency model.<hr />- **Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG):** Embeds knowledge into LLMs, alternative to fine-tuning. Uses vector databases for indexing, enhancing LLM context.<hr />- **Self-hosting AI Model:** YOLOv8 utilized for object detection in browser, featuring anchor-free detection and mosaic data augmentation.<hr />- **Passkeys:** New authentication method offering security through public key cryptography; convenience with biometric sensors; cross-platform usage.<hr />- **UI Library Practices:** Open-source approach to Mochi UI, emphasizing modular design, user experience, and best practices for developer productivity.<hr /><hr />### Labs Roadmap<hr />- **Research Topics:**<hr />  - **WebAssembly (WASM):** Self-hosted models in browsers; integration with DuckDB for data processing.<hr />  - **Passwordless Systems:** Developing Passkeys with WebAuthn; exploring QR-based authentication.<hr />  - **AI Integration:** Low-code examples of RAG; deployment of AI models and tools for discourse processing.<hr />  - **Building UI Practices:** Continuous improvement of Mochi UI standards towards general availability.<hr /><hr />### Community Insights (Dwarves Rewind)<hr />- **Actor Model:** Investigated for concurrent computation; trends noted in Actix and Elixir.<hr />- **Wasp Framework:** Full-stack tool for templating across app layers.<hr />- **Biome Toolchain:** High-performance tool maintenance for web projects.<hr />- **WebAuthn:** Strong authentication methods discussed; interest in diverse scenarios and methodologies for enhanced security.

534.title: Forward Engineering August 2023
534.description: Our adventure until now has been incredibly thrilling, with a strong focus on 'LLM in Production.' Now, we shift our attention to a topic that is always important and never outdated: **Fullstack Engineering**.
534.spr_content: - August brings opportunities in technology; focus shifts to Fullstack Engineering in a dynamic environment.<hr />- Increasing demand for engineers with comprehensive skills across development processes.<hr />- AI tools merge front-end and back-end development knowledge; diverse tech understanding is key.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation Tech Radar Report highlights technologies guiding engineering team growth.<hr />- Type-safe Server Client Development uses OpenAPI Spec for client-side libraries to ensure type safety, upgrading workflow with automation.<hr />- Ongoing exploration of Large Language Models (LLMs); the Engineering Story Map for LLMs guides engineers in AI development paths.<hr />- Reinforcement Learning from Human Feedback (RLHF) experiment reveals operational and foundational knowledge challenges.<hr />- Migration to pnpm for package management facilitates efficient development; migration challenges addressed.<hr />- Qwik framework's potential scrutinized; Resumability concept can reshape future development practices.<hr />- AI aids development: generates tests, ERDs, UML diagrams; Copilot enhances code autocompletion.<hr />- Brainery fosters knowledge growth; backend engineering highlighted in Golang 2023 course.<hr />- Trending tags: LLMs, backend techniques, testing best practices; focus on concurrency and AI tools.<hr />- Monthly contributor recognition fosters community growth; interaction encouraged via Discord.<hr />- R&D research topics: API code generation, Live Chat UI design, distinction between Product vs. Platform Engineers.<hr />- Future challenges include Fullstack tracing, CQRS, Documentation as Code.<hr />- Software Design Research Group explores AI insights in project design; animations for complex topics under consideration.<hr />- Dwarves Rewind aggregates weekly tech news; keeps the community updated on full stack and DevOps topics.<hr />- Hot topics involve testing strategies, LLM challenges, and multi-region identity management solutions.

535.title: Forward Engineering June 2023
535.description: As we usher in the month of June, we embrace the ever-changing landscape of technological innovation, and focus on a central theme:LLM in Production.
535.spr_content: - **June Overview**: Month of technological innovation and exploration; theme: "LLM in Production."<hr />- **Engineering Focus**: Operationalizing Large Language Models (LLM) with emphasis on real-world applications and reinforcement learning from human feedback (RLHF).<hr />- **LLM Progress**: Experimentation with LLMs continues; exploring use cases, addressing accuracy, latency, and operational costs; refining interaction methods.<hr />- **RLHF Exploration**: Investigating RLHF to enhance AI responsiveness and user-centricity; integrating human feedback for increased output relevance.<hr />- **Prompt Engineering**: Trials on self-refinement prompts for models; managing risks from adversarial prompts; focus on structured prompts for enhanced safety.<hr />- **Vector Database Utilization**: Leveraging vector database for semantic assessments; augmenting LLMs with long-term memory; enhancing performance through query caching.<hr />- **React Server Components**: Evaluating RSC for optimized performance; server-side rendering of non-interactive elements; improving load times and user experience.<hr />- **Zod Evaluation**: Exploring Zod for TypeScript validation; seeking to replace Yup; benefits include concise interface and no dependencies.<hr />- **R&D Growth**: Focus on fintech innovations, compiler optimization, and RLHF; ongoing research in payment systems and LLM accuracy enhancements.<hr />- **Emerging Challenges**: Monitoring developments in deep Q-Learning, time series databases, and self-hosted LLMs.<hr />- **Software Design Insights**: Studies on microservices architecture and calculations to inform design choices; value of approximations emphasized.<hr />- **Dwarves Rewind**: Weekly curated tech trends; highlights from WWDC, low-code backends, and design innovations; reflections on industry evolution.

536.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 03
