536.description: In short, this 3rd volume is all about one thing: Trial
536.spr_content: 1. **Project Evolution**: Transition from assessing tech stacks (Volume 1) to workflow simplification (Volume 2), now focusing on trialing new tools (Volume 3).<hr />  <hr />2. **Trial Emphasis**: Volume 3 centers on experimentation with tools to gauge impact.<hr /><hr />3. **k6**: Open-source load testing tool for measuring system loading capacity; utilizes JavaScript for scripting; integrates easily with developer tools (GitHub, Grafana, etc.).<hr /><hr />4. **Testlink**: Open-source test management tool; oversees testing processes, including test cases and execution; aims for automation synchronization with testing reports and task management tools like Jira.<hr /><hr />5. **Preact**: A lightweight JS library akin to React; offers the same API and virtual DOM functionality; faster rendering due to its small bundle size (3kb); promotes seamless use without build dependencies.<hr /><hr />6. **ArgoCD**: Kubernetes controller for application monitoring and state management; facilitates code versioning during development; supports various configuration formats.<hr /><hr />7. **No-code Platforms**: Exploration of Webflow initiated successful no-code development; transitioned to Bubble.io but encountered limitations in flexibility and complexity, resulting in a focus back on Webflow for future projects.

537.title: Dwarves Tech Radar Volume 02
537.description: Dwarves Tech Radar v2 contains the practices to simplify the workflow, new techniques/ approach methods to upgrade our current standards and expand the domain knowledge.
537.spr_content: - Monthly Radar updates assess tech adoption for team integration.<hr />- Focus areas: simplify workflows, upgrade standards, expand domain knowledge.<hr />  <hr />**Trial Technologies:**<hr />- **Earthly** <hr />  - Merges Dockerfile and Makefile functionalities.<hr />  - Simplifies CI/CD flow by automating integration testing.<hr />  - Enhances debugging by reproducing CI failures locally.<hr />  - Utilized in Voconic project, improves pipeline speed through parallel execution.<hr />  <hr />- **Webflow**<hr />  - No-code platform eliminates design/development miscommunication.<hr />  - Facilitates rapid production of visually appealing designs.<hr />  - Features: collaboration support, easy exports, but limited by complex animations and responsiveness issues.<hr />  <hr />- **Volta**<hr />  - Streamlines JavaScript CLI management across projects.<hr />  - Detects and unifies node versions automatically.<hr />  - Facilitates installation of npm package binaries in a streamlined toolchain.<hr />  <hr />**Adoption Technology:**<hr />- **Upptime**<hr />  - Simplifies real-time status updates with minimal setup via GitHub repository.<hr />  - Aids in bootstrapping without complex infrastructure configurations.<hr />  - Customized deployment available at specified link.

538.title: Forward Engineering November 2023
538.description: We have focused on revamping how we learn, familiarize, and work with tech. We are excited to announce that we have updated our Forward Engineering to better reflect the feedback and insights from our Labs team, Operations Team, and Consulting Team.
538.spr_content: - Focus: Revamping learning and tech collaboration within the organization.<hr />- Updated Forward Engineering: Incorporates feedback from Labs, Operations, and Consulting teams.<hr />- Goal: Provide comprehensive insights on technologies and promote innovation.<hr />- Encouragement: Feedback on the publication is welcomed for continuous improvement.<hr /><hr />### Tech Radar Overview<hr />1. **Rust**: <hr />   - Tags: `#memory-management`, `#systems-language`, `#backend`, `#embedded-systems`.<hr />   - Evolution: Gaining traction in web development and AI.<hr />   - Community project: Rust-based game server enhanced appreciation for speed and safety.<hr />   - Initial focus: Understanding concurrency model for projects.<hr /><hr />2. **Building UI Library Practices**: <hr />   - Tags: `#ui`, `#ux`, `#best-practices`, `#frontend`, `#react`.<hr />   - Challenge: Rapid development of web applications necessitating tailored UI solutions.<hr />   - Outcome: Transition to open-source UI library for internal use, emphasizing best practices.<hr /><hr />3. **DuckDB**:<hr />   - Tags: `#data`, `#data-analysis`, `#data-engineering`, `#database`, `#embedded-database`.<hr />   - Function: In-process database for analytical queries, optimizing performance and ease of use.<hr />   - Advantages: Fast, stable, comparable to OLAP databases; easy deployment.<hr /><hr />4. **Parallel Processing**:<hr />   - Tags: `#data`, `#data-science`, `#parallel-execution`.<hr />   - Technique: Multiple calculations concurrently utilizing multiple CPUs.<hr />   - Demonstration: Processing multiple data files quickly with DuckDB’s capabilities showcased.<hr /><hr />### Labs Roadmap<hr />- **WebAssembly (WASM)**: <hr />   - PIC: An Tran.<hr />   - Purpose: Run multi-language web code efficiently.<hr />   - Challenges: Performance optimization and browser compatibility for various applications.<hr /><hr />- **Passwordless Authentication**: <hr />   - PIC: An Tran.<hr />   - Focus: Alternative access methods without traditional passwords, incorporating biometrics and magic links.<hr /><hr />- **Artificial Intelligence (AI)**: <hr />   - PIC: Tom Nguyen.<hr />   - Goals: Real-time updates and privacy considerations with computational resource management.<hr /><hr />- **Multi-Party Computation (MPC)**: <hr />   - PIC: Huy Nguyen.<hr />   - Application: Secure authentication processes in Web3 contexts.<hr /><hr />- **Building UI Library Practices**:<hr />   - PIC: Thanh Pham.<hr />   - Focus: Mochi UI to ensure design consistency and usability across diverse interfaces.<hr /><hr />### Community Insights (Dwarves Rewind)<hr />1. **Ziglang**: Systems programming language merging C simplicity with modern language safety.<hr />2. **Panda CSS**: Build-time CSS-in-JS library for responsive interfaces.<hr />3. **Plop.js**: Code generator for consistency in project workflows.<hr />4. **WebAssembly**: Enables multi-language code execution in browsers for performance gains.<hr />5. **LangChain**: Framework to facilitate applications utilizing large language models.<hr />6. **GPT4 Vision**: Multimodal model capable of analyzing images for contextual responses.<hr />7. **Rust**: Emphasizes safety and concurrency, widely regarded in high-performance application development.

539.title: Dwarves Tech Radar: The Introduction
539.description: We launch The Dwarves Tech Radar as a living asset to evaluate the adoption decision and keep the technology direction stays on track. Tech Radar is how we do R&D, how we work on self-growth and motivate continuous curiosity.
539.spr_content: - Technology rapidly evolves; yesterday's tools may become obsolete today.  <hr />- New technologies generate innovative solutions for existing problems.  <hr />- Emphasis on engineering culture with a tech-savvy workforce fosters continuous improvement.  <hr />- Mission: Empower innovation and co-create the future.  <hr />- Embrace latest technologies to enhance quality and speed of development.  <hr />- Launch of The Dwarves Tech Radar serves as a living asset for technology evaluation.  <hr />- Tech Radar facilitates R&D, self-growth, and nurtures curiosity.  <hr /><hr />**Adoption Process:**  <hr />- Observe new technology and align with market movements for evaluation.  <hr />- Aim for long-term improvement and alignment with development direction.  <hr />- Encourage focus groups for in-depth topic discussion and study.  <hr /><hr />**Quadrants:**  <hr />1. Languages and Frameworks: e.g., Erlang, Svelte, R.  <hr />2. Techniques: e.g., design methods, software structure, microservices architecture.  <hr />3. Tools: e.g., editors, databases, development tools.  <hr />4. Platforms: e.g., Vault, Istio, JupyterLab as software foundations.  <hr /><hr />**Rings (Adoption Lifecycle):**  <hr />- Adopt: Proven and mature technologies.  <hr />- Trial: Ready but not fully proven technologies.  <hr />- Assess: Topics for exploration and close examination.  <hr />- Hold: Incompatible technologies or those with poor experience.  <hr /><hr />- Organize updates in a GitHub repository (dwarvesf/radar) to track progress and feedback.  <hr /><hr />**Tech Knowledge Areas:**  <hr />- Essential software engineering knowledge areas include Requirement, Design, Development, Testing, Deployment, Maintenance/Monitoring.  <hr />- Topics evolve with new practices, tools, and services; foundational knowledge is crucial for engineers.  <hr />- Current tech stack reflects practical application of theoretical knowledge in software engineering.

540.title: Forward Engineering 2024 - 2025
540.description: AI agents, talent shifts, & market dynamics: Explore tech trends in AI, blockchain, & software engineering. Discover key insights & analysis.
540.spr_content: - **Community Engagement (Dec 2024 - Feb 2025):** #tech channel vibrant; diverse insights shared.<hr />- **AI-Assisted Coding Tools:** Tools like Aider, Cursor; users overcoming code truncation via specific prompts.<hr />- **Prompt Engineering:** Evolution with advanced coding agents; prompts becoming more intricate.<hr />- **Emerging AI Models:** Anticipation around releases from Google Deepmind, OpenAI; integration of AI in blockchain applications noted.<hr />- **Blockchain Investigations:** Intersection of AI and blockchain explored; focus on on-chain actions and analytics.<hr />- **Performance Optimization:** Technical insights shared, particularly regarding DuckDB; knowledge sharing via articles and videos.<hr />- **Weekly Consulting Snapshots:** Regular tracking of AI, blockchain advancements; understanding market adaptations emphasized.<hr />- **Cryptocurrency Trends:** Growing interest in advanced crypto strategies; performance monitoring essential; data visualization's role acknowledged.<hr />- **Data Engineering & Architecture:** Emphasis on robust archival strategies; data snapshot pattern for historical management explored.<hr />- **Frontend Development Innovations:** Excitement around React 19, Next.js features, AI-powered tools; importance of keeping pace highlighted.<hr />- **Dwarves Foundation Updates:** Community-building through team moments; communication as a priority.<hr />- **Golang Evolution:** Continuous observation of Go's development; testing enhancements discussed.<hr />- **Market Trends Overview:** AI agents emerging; no-code shifting to customizable, technical solutions; demand for AI talent soaring; job market bifurcation.<hr />- **VC Focus & Regional Growth:** US remains VC leader in AI; cost-efficient strategies gaining traction in emerging markets; convergence of blockchain and AI noted in DeFi.

541.title: Forward Engineering May 2023
541.description: As we look back on the past month, we're excited to share our latest engineering report, which highlights our recent achievements, projects, and insights in May 2023.
541.spr_content: - **Technological Landscape**: Rich in exploration and growth; reflection on progress and future direction. <hr />- **May Report Themes**: Outcomes of endeavors; vision for the future.<hr /><hr />- **Tech Radar**: <hr />  - **Focus on LLM**: Central to product development and business intelligence; aim to enhance AI-driven user interactions, product suggestions, and business insights.<hr />  - **Automation Framework**: Implementation of Codecept and Playwright to streamline workflows, ensure high quality.<hr />  - **Radix UI**: Assessment for developing intuitive, accessible user interfaces; shift from HeadlessUI due to accessibility challenges.<hr /><hr />- **Commitment**: Continuous learning; delivering value; agile and innovative solutions.<hr /><hr />- **Large Language Models**: <hr />  - **Exploration**: Recognizing the potential of models like GPT-3, GPT-4; aim for accuracy.<hr />  - **Fine-tuning Challenges**: High costs hinder comprehensive results; focus on foundation models.<hr />  <hr />- **LangChain**: <hr />  - **Integration**: Enhances LLM interactions with features like prompt management and action sequencing.<hr />  - **Utilization**: Broad application potential; ongoing trial with non-critical projects to gauge capabilities.<hr /><hr />- **Prompt Engineering**: <hr />  - **Goal**: Improve AI outputs through custom prompts; testing limits and fostering AI improvement.<hr />  - **Adoption**: Education and gradual integration into systems.<hr /><hr />- **Codecept**: <hr />  - **Assessment**: Effective for end-to-end testing; supports various frameworks; robust debugging.<hr />  - **Implementation**: Centralized automation testing solution across projects.<hr /><hr />- **Radix UI**: <hr />  - **Adoption**: Modular library enabling customizable UI development; compatible with TailwindCSS for cohesive designs; goal of enhanced accessibility.<hr /><hr />- **Growth and Direction**: <hr />  - Emphasis on **Meaning, Mastery, Autonomy**; cultivating purposeful culture and skill development.<hr /><hr />- **Trending Tags**: Increased focus on LLM and AI; ongoing interest in foundational backend and frontend topics.<hr /><hr />- **Research & Development**: <hr />  - Focus on common problems: Payment systems and recommender systems; contributions to fintech and AI.<hr />  - Ongoing challenges with concurrency control in databases tackled successfully, expect future challenges in access control management and security design.<hr /><hr />- **Software Design Research Group**: Investigating security, access control, and frontend AI topics with practical approaches like RBAC and SQL locking.<hr /><hr />- **Dwarves Rewind**: Curated weekly tech news; highlights AI advancements and significant events in the industry.<hr /><hr />- **Thoughts and Insights**: Discussions on selecting stable technologies; memorandum on ease of building AI applications with LLMs; reflections on Node.js stability and maturity. <hr /><hr />- **Burning Questions**: Concerns over prompt engineering and adaptability of LLMs.

542.title: Forward Engineering March 2023
542.description: As we look back on the past month, we're excited to share our latest engineering report, which highlights our recent achievements, projects, and insight in March 2023.
542.spr_content: - Dwarves Foundation: intersection of technology and innovation.  <hr />- Engineering team fosters change and drives software development forward.  <hr />- Commitment to adopting latest technologies and practices for exceptional results.  <hr />- Focus on continuous learning and collaboration through initiatives like Tech Radar and Brainery.  <hr />- Engineering report released, showcasing achievements and insights.  <hr />- March focus: "Scaling up Delivery Performance" to enhance software delivery pipeline.  <hr />- Techniques: blue-green deployment, monorepo, emphasizing scalability culture.  <hr />- Blue-green deployment implemented for Mochi Bot: zero-downtime, faster releases, improved UX.  <hr />- Ongoing research on optimizing blue-green for microservices, integrating API testing.  <hr />- Monorepo adopted for efficient code management and consistency, addressing dependency challenges.  <hr />- ChatGPT integration in workflow: benefits in code generation, efficiency, but accuracy varies.  <hr />- Micro-Frontend architecture assessed: trade-offs considered, successful client implementation noted.  <hr />- Delivery metrics essential for performance evaluation: tracking story points and DORA metrics for insights.  <hr />- Brainery initiative focuses on Meaning, Mastery, and Autonomy (MMA) for fulfilling work culture.  <hr />- Trending tags indicate active contributor interests: frontend, backend, DevOps, core tech topics.  <hr />- R&D efforts target common problems: multi-tenancy, distributed concurrency, zkEVM layer 2 blockchain.  <hr />- Completed challenges: optimizing large dataset queries, designing multilingual app architecture.  <hr />- Future keywords: rollups, staking, Ethereum adoption, security in DevSecOps, AI augmentation.  <hr />- Software Design Research Group addresses security, access control, and database models for SMEs.  <hr />- Dwarves Rewind: aggregation of trending tech topics, fostering community knowledge sharing.  <hr />- Trending discussions on AI advancements, GPT-4, Microsoft integration, and Next.js 13.2 updates.  <hr />- Observations prompt critical reflections on gaming, employment, data privacy, and blockchain innovation.

543.title: Forward Engineering October 2023
543.description: As we step into the exciting opportunities of October, we are at a crucial point in the ever-changing world of technology. Our adventure until now has been for the most part very exciting, with a strong focus on 'Full-stack engineering’ Now, we shift our attention to a topic that is prolific and always true: Open-source.
543.spr_content: - October marks a pivotal moment in technology, highlighting advancements and opportunities.<hr />- Emphasis on 'Full-stack engineering' shifts towards the prolific realm of **Open-source**.<hr />- Open-source empowers hobby projects, startups, and enterprises with rights to use, study, change, and distribute software.<hr />- Key to fixing bugs, it accelerates state-of-the-art tech and AI development.<hr />- **Dwarves Foundation Tech Radar Report** focuses on technologies shaping team growth and success.<hr />- Focus on hands-on experiences to connect tech and research with real-world applications.<hr /><hr />### Trials<hr />- **Type-safe Server Client Development**:<hr />  - Automated OpenAPI Spec generation for JavaScript applications enhances type safety.<hr />  - Integration with Swagger improves efficiency and error reduction.<hr />  - Type safety being incorporated into developer training and transitioning internal tool Fortress.<hr /><hr />- **AI-aided Development**:<hr />  - Rapidly evolving AI tools support code writing; promising projects emerging from training courses.<hr />  - Notable tools include a code reviewer and an automation tool for CV matching.<hr /><hr />- **DuckDB**:<hr />  - Embedded database for analytical query processing; optimal for workloads under 10GB.<hr />  - Simplifies analytics without the overhead of a data warehouse.<hr /><hr />- **Devcontainers**:<hr />  - Provides full-featured development environments via Visual Studio Code.<hr />  - Supports rapid onboarding for full-stack engineers with containerized development.<hr /><hr />### Research & Development Topics<hr />- **Elixir**: Expanding expertise for general availability among engineers.<hr />- **Rust**: High performance and memory management; further exploration into systems programming.<hr />- **WASM**: Resilient technology for serverless, high-performance applications.<hr />- **Aspect-Oriented Programming**: Modular approach for cross-cutting concerns with potential beyond feature flagging.<hr />- **Passwordless Authentication**: Increases security and efficiency in software interactions.<hr /><hr />### New Tools<hr />- **Google Analytics 4**: Enhanced modeling and event data aggregation capabilities.<hr />- **IFramely**: Unified handling of URL embeds from various sources, streamlining content integration.<hr /><hr />### Dwarves Rewind October 2023<hr />- A curated reading list of trending tech news and topics.<hr />- Provides insight into the fast-paced tech industry landscape.<hr /><hr />### Trending Topics<hr />- **Next.js Version 14**: Major updates with minimal breaking changes; resembles server-rendered apps.<hr />- **X's New LLM, Grok**: Promises competitive features against ChatGPT, generating industry excitement.

544.title: Software design group: Nurturing architects at Dwarves
544.description: At the end of 2021, starting with engineering practices, the core idea behind creating a software design group is to enable engineers to develop the skills required to become software architects.
544.spr_content: - **Software Architecture**: A landscape of trade-offs; prioritizing 'why' over 'how' supports informed decisions.<hr />- **Dwarf's Ethos**: Growth is universal; individual and team improvement is paramount. <hr />- **Software Design Group**: A platform for engineers to acquire architectural skills; no strict path exists.<hr />- **Learning by Doing**: Practical application of skills is vital for growth; theory alone is insufficient.<hr />- **Diversity and Inclusivity**: Welcoming varied backgrounds enriches creativity and promotes belonging; new ideas flourish in a diverse environment.<hr />- **Skill Development**: Continuous feedback loops enhance professional growth; sessions focus on:<hr />  - **Technical Perspective**: Comprehend technology interrelations at an enterprise level; stay attuned to trends.<hr />  - **System Design Experience**: Core of an architect’s role; practice fosters knowledge on scalability and performance.<hr />  - **User Experience Mindset**: Design with users in mind; improving usability and satisfaction are critical.<hr />  - **Team Collaboration**: Effective teamwork harnesses collective responsibility and synergy across roles.<hr />- **Tech Quality Enhancement**: Aim for high-quality software solutions; architects must engage in hands-on practices to innovate.<hr />- **Innovative Proofs**: Demonstrative works validate learning, including SQL practices, Vault overviews, and performance control.<hr />- **Continuous Learning Platforms**: Resources like Dwarves Brainery and diverse multimedia content drive knowledge sharing.<hr />- **Architectural Mastery Outcomes**: Robust architecture, scalable solutions, efficient algorithms lead to satisfying customer needs, bolstering market competitiveness.<hr />- **Collaborative Success**: Team interactions yield innovative solutions that exceed isolated efforts; promote lifelong learning and coding.

545.title: Meet Dat Nguyen: AI Dev Intern on hybrid working at Dwarves
545.description: Dat Nguyen’s journey as an AI/LLM intern at Dwarves, where hybrid working and hands-on learning create real growth. Discover how mentorship and real-time collaboration shape his experience.
545.spr_content: - **Dat’s Journey**: AI/LLM intern experiences growth through Dwarves’ hybrid work model.  <hr />- **Remote Start**: Initial remote work enhanced focus; office presence transformed learning experience.  <hr />- **Informal Learning**: Knowledge acquisition occurs through spontaneous interactions, not formal meetings.  <hr />- **Real-time Feedback**: Office environment fosters instant feedback and quick conversations about LLM trends.  <hr />- **Mentorship Culture**: Quick chats with mentors, like @tom, create impactful learning moments.  <hr />- **Problem Solving**: Hands-on sessions (e.g., whiteboard discussions) resolve complex issues efficiently.  <hr />- **Observational Learning**: Watching seniors tackle challenges provides deeper insights than tutorials.  <hr />- **Collaborative Projects**: Teamwork offers diverse perspectives, enhancing collaboration skills.  <hr />- **Natural Learning Environment**: Knowledge sharing occurs organically through joint work efforts.  <hr />- **Skill Development**: In-person interactions sharpen practical skills, such as quick thinking.  <hr />- **Hybrid Benefits**: Combination of remote focus and in-office learning maximizes growth potential.  <hr />- **Collective Growth**: Team support enhances individual and collaborative improvement.

546.title: Meet Nam Nguyen: From Frontend to DevOps - A journey of continuous growth
546.description: Life at Dwarves 05 is the career story of Nam, the Dwarves's DevOps Engineer. During 6 years turning from big corp to Dwarves Team, he lives upon the motto of constantly pushing himself above the limit.
546.spr_content: - Transformation requires struggle; growth fosters better self.<hr />- "Defy limits" is an ethos of [@nam], DevOps Engineer at Dwarves.<hr />- Joined Dwarves in 2017; fate intertwined with career choices.<hr />- Went from uncertain student to full-time Frontend Engineer in 4 months.<hr />- Mentorship shaped early career; transitioned across engineering roles.<hr />- Embraced discomfort; ventured out of comfort zone since 2019.<hr />- Organized GopherCon events; improved communication and social skills.<hr />- Observed team dynamics; learned from older peers' soft skills.<hr />- Detail-oriented mindset; sometimes slows productivity.<hr />- Strives for 200% effort; proud of contributions to projects like Open Fabric.<hr />- Newbies seek guidance; emphasizes exploration and self-discovery.<hr />- Building relationships at work enriches experience; collaboration is key.<hr />- "Life at Dwarves" shares diverse stories of personal and professional journeys.

547.title: Meet Anh Tran: Crafting Dwarves' visual identity as Head of UI
547.description: Anh, in short, is the UI wizard behind most of our branding identity. You'll be seeing her work of art on every Dwarves's digital asset.
547.spr_content: - Anna: UI expert at Dwarves; key role in branding identity.<hr />- Focus: UI design, app appearance, app research for insights.<hr />- Dual roles possible: UX and UI design manageable in small projects.<hr />- Product designers: expected to understand both disciplines.<hr />- Five years at Dwarves; background in Graphic Design.<hr />- Initial discomfort in career path; numerous designers in the field.<hr />- Shift to UX/UI driven by market awareness.<hr />- Graphic design: creative freedom; product design: constrained by technology and rules.<hr />- Environment influences growth: sought learning opportunities beyond big firms.<hr />- Dwarves: startup environment fostering new project learning.<hr />- Valued for being ahead in industry trends.<hr />- Key takeaway: active communication essential for collaboration.<hr />- Pre-pandemic office culture: active, productivity challenges in remote work.<hr />- Past communication issues; importance of seminars for perspective sharing.<hr />- Conflict resolution: understanding and collaboration improved post-seminars.<hr />- Overall experience: a blend of high notes and minor frustrations, rich learning journey.

548.title: Meet Hieu Vu: Golang passion and Dwarves community
548.description: Life at Dwarves 06 is all about how Hieu Vu picked up Golang as his favorite programming, and how human factor happens to be the key element that ties him with Dwarves.
548.spr_content: - **Focus**: Hieu Vu's journey with Golang as a preferred language, highlighting the importance of human connections and culture at Dwarves.<hr />- **Current Role**: Backend Engineer at Dwarves; previous intern at KMS Technology Corporation.<hr />- **Golang Introduction**: Sparked by an entrance test for a Japanese tech firm in 2017; initial failure led to fascination.<hr />- **Aharooms Project**: Key opportunity for practical Golang experience; pivotal in skill development.<hr />- **Language Preference**: Chooses Golang for its simplicity and efficiency over Python and Java; views future as promising for cloud-native applications.<hr />- **Learning Insight**: Emphasizes the importance of enjoyment in programming; encourages finding passion in coding languages.<hr />- **Mentorship Role**: Self-identifies as a supporter for interns; aims to improve mentoring skills.<hr />- **Inexperience Normalization**: Stresses that lack of experience is common among graduates; encourages leveraging school knowledge for confidence.<hr />- **Personal Growth**: Transition from solo to team-oriented work; values collaboration and inspiration from colleagues.<hr />- **Team Dynamics**: Each teammate contributes uniquely: humor, career guidance, big-picture thinking, project management.<hr />- **Mid-life Crisis Reflection**: Explores personal and professional interests beyond coding; seeks to avoid monotony in work life.<hr />- **Decision to Stay**: Chooses Dwarves over a bigger opportunity; values remote culture and continuous learning.<hr />- **Career Development**: Emphasizes the role of team interactions and culture in personal growth; transformed from shy to confident communicator.<hr />- **Community Engagement**: Invites connection through Discord for further interaction with Dwarves team.

549.title: Meet An Tran: Senior engineer's growth journey
549.description: Life at Dwarves 01 is a rather secretive member with a healthy life and gentle personality. An Tran, Senior Software Engineer with 7 years of experience working from start-ups to Project Lead at Dwarves Foundation.
549.spr_content: - Antran embodies the belief: challenge stimulates growth in engineering careers.<hr />- Antran: 7 years as a Senior Software Engineer at Dwarves Foundation; previous experience includes Tech Lead and Remote Frontend Lead.<hr />- He encourages diversifying skills: experience across Android, Web, Backend, and Frontend roles.<hr />- Senior role involves mentorship; builds trust through shared insights and personal experiences.<hr />- Adapting to project-specific challenges is crucial; balancing client demands with resource constraints.<hr />- Nghe Nhan system project exemplifies complexities and the need for quality amidst rapid development.<hr />- A true Senior fosters comfort, communication, and problem-solving; pivotal in guiding teams.<hr />- Leadership influences junior colleagues; promotes growth and skill similarity.<hr />- No secret formula for success; trust is foundational in mentor-mentee relationships.<hr />- Life at Dwarves highlights diverse perspectives and experiences within the organization.

550.title: Meet Thanh Pham: Ensuring a healthy environment for everyone to thrive
550.description: Been with us for nearly 5 years, Thanh has been taking care of the juniors and ensuring their progress goes alongside the company’s direction. He is also the co-host of Dwarves Radio Talk - our weekly tech training every Monday.
550.spr_content: - Thanh has been with the company for nearly 5 years, focusing on junior development.<hr />- Acts as a mentor, ensuring growth aligns with company objectives.<hr />- Co-hosts Dwarves Radio Talk, a weekly tech training event.<hr />- Creates a healthy environment for all team members to thrive.<hr />- Guides newbies while setting goals for seniors.<hr />- Dwarves Team utilizes a flexible 60-90 day growth evaluation program.<hr />- Emphasizes goal visualization and personal responsibility among team members.<hr />- Offers tailored career paths: Individual Contributor (IC) for self-development, Management Track (MT) for social interaction and progression.<hr />- Transitioned from technical focus to becoming an Engineer Manager, emphasizing connection and team dynamics.<hr />- Product quality relies on collaboration among four roles: Product Manager, Engineering Lead, Developer, and Engineer Manager.<hr />- Faces challenges in balancing employee expectations with company demands.<hr />- Aspiring to become a CTO within 5-6 years, emphasizing continuous self-improvement.<hr />- Team's culture is defined by motivation and proactive behavior.<hr />- Life at Dwarves highlights diverse perspectives and experiences within the organization.

551.title: Meet Tom Nguyen: Remote working fits him perfectly
551.description: A catch-up with Tom - our Data Lead, and hear how remote working has fit him perfectly. Tom is one of our core contributors of Dwarves Brainery, and he'll be playing as a key mentor for our upcoming Apprenticeship.
551.spr_content: - Remote work suits Tom; it minimizes distractions and maximizes productivity.<hr />- Office atmosphere creates social pressure; can hinder focused work.<hr />- Having time for oneself is crucial for effective performance.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation supports remote work with necessary equipment.<hr />- Workers can communicate casually through short syncs.<hr />- Team embraces flexible working styles; encourages pair working and co-working spaces for extroverts.<hr />- Remote work enhances adaptability; requires wise usage for benefits.<hr />- Tom emphasizes the positive aspects of remote culture; sees it as an optimal work style.<hr />- Life at Dwarves showcases diverse perspectives on work and collaboration.

552.title: OGIF Office Hours #15 - Architecting AI supervisors, Local-first software, AI code completion overview and crawl list bot command
552.description: In our fifteenth community discussion, we focus on Architecting AI Supervisors, Local-First Software and Crawl list command. Topics include an overview of ongoing projects, a detailed look at various code completion tools, and a demonstration of the Supervisor architecture. Additionally, we'll review the local-first software paradigm and conclude with a summary of new features and team contributions.
552.spr_content: - Team discussions on activities and project progress.  <hr />- AI code completion tools compared: GitHub Copilot, Continue, Codeium, Cursor, Supermaven (lowest latency at 250ms).  <hr />- User considerations for accuracy and speed in code implementation; context comprehension challenges.  <hr />- GPT-4 vs. Claude: GPT-4 excels in composition; new feature for OpenAI API integration.  <hr />- Supermaven vs. Transformer: Supermaven optimized for C coding with enhanced token context.  <hr />- Local vs. cloud AI deployment: feasibility influenced by RAM capacity and task requirements.  <hr />- Challenges in AI supervisor architecture, addressing concepts like Ent and Mul.  <hr />- Database interactions via Up and Upgraft L framework; key components: SQL, Semantic, Supervisor.  <hr />- Benefits of AI supervisor architecture: maintenance ease and improved user experience through semantic responses.  <hr />- Mechanisms for generating compliant sentences and accurate outputs discussed.  <hr />- Local-first software focus: offline usability, data autonomy, shifting frontend/backend roles.  <hr />- Overview of Local-First architecture for real collaboration; conflict-free data storage techniques (CRDTs).  <hr />- Local-first SDKs leveraging IndexDB and local storage; data synchronization strategies outlined.  <hr />- Local-first implementation challenges: data conflict resolution, storage limitations on client devices.  <hr />- Advantages of Local-First: real-time collaboration, enhanced responsiveness, security through decentralized structure.  <hr />- Discussions on future Local-First development potential and balanced architecture strategies.  <hr />- Workflow management and authority for backend data distribution discussed.  <hr />- Platforms for information sharing: Reddit, Lobster, tech news resources evaluated.  <hr />- New Discord bots introduced for aggregating tech news; functionality and customization features explained.  <hr />- Encouragement for team engagement with new tools; forthcoming features and improvements highlighted.

553.title: OGIF Office Hours #16 - Golang weekly #4, TIL in Dune's query, AI voice clone demo and Re-ranking in RAG system.
553.description: Our sixteenth office hours community discussion will cover a range of topics including Golang commentary updates, insights on TIL in Dune's query, a demo of AI voice cloning, and advancements in re-ranking within the RAG system. Join us for an engaging session designed to promote collaborative learning and growth among our members.
553.spr_content: - 94 minutes duration for the discussion.<hr />- Topics include updates on ICY distribution, salary plans, and recent events.<hr />- Go programming and ethical hacking trends discussed.<hr />- HTTP optimization techniques for faster request execution explored.<hr />- Auto scroller deployment and code handling mentioned.<hr />- Go's potential in app development and function usage analyzed.<hr />- AI's role in media content creation highlighted.<hr />- Emphasis on the balance between technology, nature, and personal growth.<hr />- AI voice translation and commentary tools examined.<hr />- Discussion on risks and costs associated with AI voice impersonation.<hr />- Data transformation via APIs and smart contracts reviewed.<hr />- Algorithms for data indexing and mapping are introduced.<hr />- User experience impacts considered through mapping technique comparisons.<hr />- Comprehensive system design for software services discussed.<hr />- AI applications for data ranking and synthesizing information explored.<hr />- Lom used for re-ranking to enhance search results.<hr />- Mathematical ranking process and formula calculation explained.<hr />- Importance of reevaluating AI algorithms for accuracy emphasized.<hr />- Human assessment crucial for ensuring algorithmic accuracy.

554.title: OGIF Office Hours #11 - Design patterns: template method & visitor, Radix sort, and weekly tech commentary
554.description: Join us for our evleventh community discussion on design patterns (Template Method and Visitor), Radix Sort, and the latest tech news. The discussion will be guided by weekly topics selected through community input, fostering a collaborative learning environment for all participants.
554.spr_content: - **Office Hours Session**: Focus on Template Method, Visitor Pattern, Radix Sort.<hr />- **Team Dynamics**: 50 members; discussing performance metrics and team activities early on.<hr />- **Participation Incentives**: Use of ICY tokens to promote engagement; active community interaction is valued.<hr />- **Announcements**: Future salary increases; plans for gaming development and events.<hr />- **Team Branding**: New team shirts; summer-themed team game scheduled.<hr />- **Startup Engagement**: Insights from recent events, especially women's evolving roles in Vietnam's startup ecosystem.<hr />- **Investment Focus**: Emphasis on long-term sectors such as healthtech and education; exploring fintech opportunities.<hr />- **Market Analysis**: Importance of adapting team projects based on market trends.<hr />- **Template Method Insights**:<hr />  - Addresses code optimization, breaking operations into shared steps via a base class.<hr />  - Custom implementations allowed; main flow remains unaffected.<hr />  - Common framework for defining operations enhances structure and reuse.<hr />- **Visitor Pattern Functionality**: <hr />  - Centralizes business logic across data from multiple classes; eases data manipulation.<hr />  - Simplifies feature addition; promotes maintenance by enforcing single responsibility.<hr />- **Use Cases**: Demonstrations on combining customer needs to create common objects; separating sell/buy actions for implementation efficiency.<hr />- **Radix Sort Discussion**: Relevant to overall data sorting strategies; discussed in the context of the Visitor Pattern's utility.

555.title: OGIF Office Hours #17 - Community Call July, C4 Model, and Interview Life in the US
555.description: Join us for our seventeenth OGIF community call on Aug 2nd, where we'll discuss the current state of technology investment in Vietnam, introduce a new referral and commission model for the team, present the C4 model for subscription systems, and interview Hieu about his experience living in the US. We'll wrap up with plans for next week's meeting. This session will be guided by topics selected through community input, promoting a collaborative and insightful environment for all participants."
555.spr_content: - **Technology Investment in Vietnam**: Vietnam's tech investment down by 17%, less severe than global 35% decline; still ranks 3rd in Southeast Asia (after Singapore, Indonesia).<hr />- **Investment Landscape**: Key sectors like healthcare/education growing; payments/retail declining; VCs active in fintech/generative startups.<hr />- **Consulting Insights**: Consultants assess and share market strength; traditional vs crypto markets differ.<hr />- **Referral Model**: New commission system in place; incentivizes active participation and indirect referrals.<hr />- **Software Automation**: Emphasizes using software for sustainable team building; equitable cash flow distribution stressed.<hr />- **Challenges in Software Creation**: Lack of skilled advisers noted; importance of distinguishing coding from software development.<hr />- **Ring Model**: Focus on time tracking in consulting; consultants manage end-to-end solutions, impacting sales/targets.<hr />- **Work Hours Management**: Flexible work hours discussed; adapting to project demands highlighted.<hr />- **System Design Understanding**: Consulting parallels with historical industries (e.g., accounting, law); research effort recognized.<hr />- **New Design Tool**: Tool presented with system design potential; efficient, improvements anticipated.<hr />- **Java Standardization**: Discussion on Java as enterprise standard; relevance questioned compared to its past prominence.<hr />- **C4 Model Overview**: Presentation on subscription systems; components and workflow in payment services discussed.<hr />- **Payment System Design**: Monthly vs annual subscription differences; developer API references considered.<hr />- **Interview with Hieu**: Living in the US discussed; job market insights and administrative processes reviewed.<hr />- **Vietnam Job Market Navigation**: Insights on comparative costs with the US and administrative documentation requirements noted.<hr />- **Team Meeting Wrap-up**: Project report processes and future meeting plans outlined; focus on new technology learning emphasized. <hr />- **Final Remarks**: Encouragement for community involvement; knowledge in software design deemed crucial; reminder for resource utilization for future benefit.

556.title: OGIF Office Hours #1: Markdown Presentations, Research Content Pipeline, and Professional Screenshots
556.description: Our first ever Office Hours in our series of OGIFs. Our first day to exchange knowledge and insights on topics and projects we're working on and tools we're using for our internal work and clients.
556.spr_content: 1. **Server Identity**: Introduction of server owner **econ-101**; personal connection established.  <hr />2. **Skill-Building**: Technical tutorial by **Anna** on slide creation from markdown; practical learning demonstrated.  <hr />3. **Research Pipeline**: Presentation by **Nikki** on community-driven research content; emphasis on knowledge sharing.  <hr />4. **Engagement Techniques**: **Innno** provided tips on effective screenshot tools; enhanced interactive experience.  <hr />5. **Excitement Element**: **Lucky draw** for **Icy**; added anticipation and community fun.  <hr />6. **Future Engagement**: Regular events planned; 10-minute sharing format to promote continual learning and community bonding.  <hr />7. **Multimedia Components**: Recorded sessions covering slide creation, discussions, screenshot tips, research lifecycle, and event closure available for future reference.

557.title: OGIF Office Hours #18 - Golang weekly, Devbox MOC, Search retrieval in RAG, Generative UI, FE monthly #1
557.description: OGIF 18 covers key discussions on Golang weekly #6, insights into search retrieval in RAG, advancements in generative UI, and the first edition of FE monthly. This edition provides valuable updates for developers and tech enthusiasts, offering a deep dive into the latest trends and techniques in software development.

Comprehensive content mapping required.<hr />- Future presentations on system design topics emphasized collaboration and diversity.<hr />- Resource request processes explained; additional methods for claiming resources discussed.<hr />- Team progress tracked through contributions; Decentralized activity visibility using ICY.<hr />- Ecosystem building with core functionality; WebAssembly employed for performance.<hr />- Discussion on complete ecosystem examples including neural network viewers and IDEs.<hr />- Vector similarity and ranking via models S and F explained for sorting data.<hr />- Alpha configuration adjustments for computational outcomes; keyword ranking methods detailed.<hr />- Reciprocal Fusion with data sources focusing on behavior metrics explored.<hr />- Average accuracy definitions in system design; F1 score calculations discussed.<hr />- Efficiency in computations analyzed with diverse datasets; simpler questions yield better results.<hr />- Substance effectiveness formula derived from fear categories; analysis methodically structured.<hr />- Automation in system design versus manual processing considered; community acceptance factors discussed.<hr />- Accuracy assessment processes in system design explained; Metrics usage highlighted.<hr />- Vector addition and subtraction calculations described; testing and automation discussions mentioned.<hr />- Introduction to generative UI; implementation and community feedback explained.<hr />- Vercel solutions for UI management discussed; server-side component handling explained.<hr />- Fully documented chatbot system design with Go emphasized; event handling details provided.<hr />- Comparison of client-side vs. server-side rendering techniques outlined.<hr />- API usage for movie search functionality; event-triggered UI updates discussed.<hr />- Discussion on system design and UI testing integration; 558.title: OGIF - Oh God It's Friday
558.description: OGIF (Oh God It's Friday) is our weekly casual office hours meeting, where team members unwind, share updates, and connect in a relaxed environment at the end of each work week.
558.spr_content: - OGIF: "Oh God It's Friday" - weekly technical deep-dive for engineers.<hr />- Focus: Present complex problems, discuss solutions, explore relevant technologies.<hr />- Activities include dissecting bugs, analyzing performance issues, evaluating new tools and frameworks.<hr />- Purpose: Leverage team expertise, foster collaborative problem-solving, and promote knowledge sharing.<hr />- Informal format, yet substantive content.<hr />- Topics range from optimizing database queries to implementing machine learning models in production.<hr />- Essential for continuous learning, staying updated on industry trends and best practices.<hr />- Latest OGIFs accessible via a database query for recent entries.

559.title: OGIF Office Hours #6 - Looking at the Factory pattern, Erlang state machines, and the Trading Process
559.description: In our sixth community discussion, we'll delve into the Factory pattern, Erlang state machines, and the Trading Process. By sharing weekly topics chosen through tags, we foster a collaborative learning environment for our community to grow.
559.spr_content: - Topic: Factory Pattern, Erlang State Machines, Trading Process<hr />- Duration: 147 minutes; recorded on May 10, 2024.<hr />- Focus: Simplifying product creation and enhancing trading process through design patterns.<hr /><hr />**Factory Pattern:**<hr />- Definition: Design pattern for object creation, allowing for simplified product initialization.<hr />- Advantages: Improves code readability and separates logic; facilitates runtime object type identification.<hr />- Disadvantages: Increases complexity and code size.<hr />- Variations: Includes Factory method, abstract Factory, and differences with Builder pattern.<hr /><hr />**Builder Pattern:**<hr />- Definition: Involves defining steps for object creation, allowing for flexibility and customization against Factory pattern.<hr /><hr />**Erlang State Machines:**<hr />- Definition: Comprise three states (closed, open, half-open), resembling circuit breakers.<hr />- Function: Manage requests, prevent downtime, and handle state transitions, applicable in trading processes.<hr />- Benefits: Error management, scalability, and simplified logic.<hr /><hr />**Trading Process Optimization:**<hr />- Strategies: Automating tasks, enhancing analysis through conditional triggers, utilizing bots for stock management.<hr />- Tools: Utilizing platforms like Fly for streamlined deployment and efficient processes.<hr /><hr />**Integration:**<hr />- Discussed combining Factory pattern with Erlang state machines for improved system design.<hr />- Emphasized importance of data, functions, and the system's operational flow (OTP).<hr /><hr />**Progression:**<hr />- Team dynamics noted, with Minh progressing within roles demonstrating enhanced responsibilities and insights.<hr />- Effective management of server errors and data through state transitions discussed.<hr /><hr />**Conclusion:**<hr />- Exploration of trading logic, system design implications, and implementation challenges.<hr />- Summary of the reflective discussion on patterns and their impact on process management.

560.title: OGIF Office Hours #4 - DCA, Devbox
560.description: Our fourth office hours community discussion, from DCA to Devbox topic. The goal is to foster learning by sharing weekly topics suggested through tags, encouraging collaborative growth among our members.
560.spr_content: - **Duration:** 86 minutes<hr />- **Focus:** Team activities, virtualization, personal finance, trading, and design methods.<hr />  <hr />- **Time Marks and Key Points:**<hr />  - **00:03:** Introduction of upcoming topics.<hr />  - **14:53:** Discussion on themes: virtualization historical context, personal finance (DCA), trading updates.<hr />  - **20:23:** T-shirt ordering process (sizes S to XXL) and free stickers for team members.<hr />  - **23:10:** Community engagement through sticker giveaways and new activities.<hr />  <hr />- **Virtualization Insights:**<hr />  - **29:09:** Introduction to Virtual Machines (VMs) from the 1960s addressing hardware utilization.<hr />  - **31:48:** VMs help with resource-sharing but can be cumbersome.<hr />  - **36:56:** Containers as a lighter alternative to VMs, providing faster setups and namespace isolation.<hr />  - **39:44:** Discussion on container namespaces and limitations.<hr />  <hr />- **Docker Discussion:**<hr />  - **45:18:** Docker's user-friendly environment setup but may have performance issues on some systems.<hr />  <hr />- **Development Considerations:**<hr />  - **47:51:** Importance of reference types in development; Linux container architecture knowledge is essential.<hr />  <hr />- **Investing Strategies:**<hr />  - **53:45:** Dollar Cost Averaging (DCA) defined; benefits include risk mitigation and ease of management.<hr />  - **56:25:** Without strategy, investments risk volatility; DCA helps stabilize costs.<hr />  - **1:01:32:** Understanding buy/sell orders; DCA implementation.<hr />  <hr />- **Investment Analysis:**<hr />  - **1:04:08:** Different methods discussed, highlighting advantages and drawbacks.<hr />  - **1:09:40:** Acknowledgment of investment risks, including the importance of research on projects.<hr />  <hr />- **Team Collaboration:**<hr />  - **1:12:35:** Encouragement of teamwork for knowledge sharing and topic selection in financial discussions.<hr />  <hr />- **Design Methodology:**<hr />  - **1:17:11:** Discussion of Vinson implementation and design methodology.<hr />  - **1:19:49:** Upcoming focus on design process and C4 reviews.<hr />  <hr />- **Conclusion:**<hr />  - **1:26:04:** Wrap-up and goodbye with anticipation for future discussions.

561.title: OGIF Office Hours #10 -  Behavioral Patterns and Map Content Organization
561.description: Join us for our tenth office hours session to discuss behavioral design patterns and effective map content organization! We'll also catch you up on important June updates. Bring your questions and ideas, we want to hear from you.
561.spr_content: - Discussion on game-making elements within the team; focus on buttons and game mechanics.<hr />- Introduction to strategic behavior patterns; problem statement linked to a restaurant's secret recipe.<hr />- Strategy pattern aids in managing context and segregating implementation; choices independent of context.<hr />- State pattern alters object behavior depending on its state; illustrates state machine interactions.<hr />- Differentiation between State and Strategy patterns; State defines logic while Strategy seeks varied actions.<hr />- State pattern simplifies state handling; emphasizes the need for components to manage state awareness.<hr />- Objects exhibit behavior alterations based on their state; relations between behavioral patterns and content mapping.<hr />- State and logic management crucial for future adaptability; dependent on logical evaluations, not fixed positioning.<hr />- Importance of structuring work; team emphasizes weekly Memo articles for knowledge sharing.<hr />- Creation of detailed, interconnected content maps; organization of topics into a structured map.<hr />- Development of flexible content maps for ongoing updates; continuous interaction with related topics.<hr />- Cultivating intelligent sharing habits among team members to avoid spamming; three steps for culture of sharing.<hr />- Building a streamlined posting culture; exploration of increases in knowledge sharing and collaboration.<hr />- Upgrading processes and game planning for smooth transitions; focus on strategic execution in forthcoming months.<hr />- Weekly commentary generation with news links critical for team interactions and fostering collaboration.

562.title: OGIF Office Hours #13 - Go Weekly updates, Radix Sort, Human Feedback Mechanism, and effective ChatGPT usage
562.description: This week's OGIF covers key topics including Go Weekly updates, Radix Sort, Human Feedback Mechanism, and effective ChatGPT usage. We discuss Go iterators and the latest features in Go 1.23, followed by a demonstration of Radix Sort's efficiency. The session also explains the Human Feedback Mechanism for improving Chatbot models and wraps up with best practices for using ChatGPT effectively.
562.spr_content: - Overview of a new programming language, Odin, compared to Go; addresses Go's limitations.<hr />- Introduction of Go's iterators using the next method for lazy evaluations.<hr />- Exploration of functions and logic in programming; iterating through types and structures.<hr />- Discussion on the significance of package choices in code development.<hr />- Explanation of Radix Sort efficiency; O(nk) time complexity for sorting based on digit count.<hr />- The importance of 'O(nk)' in handling large numbers and stable sorting.<hr />- Impact of feedback on ChatGPT; enhances accuracy and reduces hallucinations.<hr />- Analysis of user behaviors; feedback mechanisms for improving LLM outputs.<hr />- Strategies for effective ChatGPT utilization; quality input leads to better output.<hr />- Emphasis on context and specificity in communication; clear terminology improves results.<hr />- Importance of detailed prompts and examples for refining responses; encouraging user feedback.<hr />- Contextual and personalized communication is vital; offers templates for improvement.<hr />- Concluding remarks; summarization and Q&A highlighted techniques for real-world applications.

563.title: OGIF Office Hours #9 -  What's next for June and Behavior Design Patterns
563.description: Join us for our ninth community discussion, where we will be addressing June's key updates and providing an overview of effective behavior design patterns. The discussion will be guided by weekly topics selected through community input, fostering a collaborative learning environment for all participants.
563.spr_content: - Team updates and gratitude for meeting organization. <hr />- Discussion on new team shirts and pricing for photos. <hr />- Overview of recent activities and implementation plans for blockchain and language models.<hr />- Proposal to prioritize knowledge sharing and memo writing over retainer tasks.<hr />- Emphasis on sustainable work commitments and project management for client satisfaction.<hr />- Addressing decision-making and potential role differentiation for team members.<hr />- Examination of the Observer Design Pattern: definition, examples, advantages, and disadvantages.<hr />- Explanation of one-to-many relationships and event-driven nature in Observer patterns.<hr />- Understanding the benefits: automatic updates, easy maintenance, and reduced manual interventions.<hr />- Strategies for processing new information and ensuring data connection in communications.<hr />- Breakdown of file packing processes and necessity for clear interface designs.<hr />- Introduction to Command Pattern and its role in managing software transactions effectively.<hr />- Discussion of Command Pattern in handling user requests and responses to optimize workflows.<hr />- Grouping data by user action consequences for efficient organization and issue resolution.<hr />- Insights on object-oriented programming: modeling states and actions through objects.<hr />- Game design principles related to behavioral templates and engagement with queries.<hr />- Need for structured processes to align actions with team scalability and operational reality. <hr />- Emphasis on accessibility and iterative design principles in behavioral patterns for inclusivity.<hr />- Updates and improvements in behavioral design patterns slated for June.

564.title: OGIF Office Hours #14 - Generic Collections, Pricing Models, and OGIF Summarizer
564.description: In our fourteenth covers work distribution, enhanced article writing, product development, and strategic pricing models. It also discusses generics in Go, Dolt for database version control, and an automated tool for OGIF summaries, offering insights for developers and project managers.
564.spr_content: - Discussion on work distribution: Optimize task delegation for efficiency.<hr />- Increased ICY for article writing: Enhance knowledge synthesis and maintain high standards.<hr />- User participation in product development: Collaboration on links and testing.<hr />- Choosing programming language: Elixir favors speed for MVPs; concerns about long-term viability.<hr />- Corporate technology adoption: Focus on integration with payment systems; historical context.<hr />- Team development: Importance of skill sharing and discussion of pathways for members.<hr />- Future of concurrency language: Continued belief in relevance amidst market changes.<hr />- Go language generics: Challenges and implementation of generic collection types.<hr />- Compiler errors: Strategies for combining types to satisfy constraints.<hr />- Introduction to Dolt: Version-controlled database applications for companies and developers.<hr />- Automating summaries: Using chatbots for transcription and content organization.<hr />- Admin chat organization: Workflow improvements for efficiency.<hr />- Pricing strategy discussions: Critical for product success; market adaptation essential.<hr />- Varied pricing models: Exploring options like volume and custom pricing.<hr />- Project-specific pricing: Adaptation as per business requirements and team dynamics.<hr />- System selection: Importance for scalability and readiness for disruptions.<hr />- Product team roles: Clarity on project manager responsibilities and teamwork emphasis.<hr />- Collaborative design challenges: Interaction with team members on design-related tasks.<hr />- System design for specific projects: Evaluating components for feasibility and performance.<hr />- Task planning: Assigning and strategizing future projects with an architectural focus.

We provide a summary of recent activities and topics, including blockchain, optimization, and news updates. Weekly Go updates cover optimization techniques, followed by an introduction to Solana blockchain concepts. The session concludes with a demonstration on handling multimodal data using LangChain.
565.spr_content: - **Community Call Summary:** Monthly progress and achievements.<hr />- **Internal Updates:** Dwarves activities, Go updates, blockchain research, tuning discussions.<hr />- **Future Events:** Focus on machine learning, blockchain, Go; updates on upcoming events.<hr />- **Engagement Rewards:** Introduction of ICY points system for participation, rewarding activities.<hr />- **Research Participation:** Community invited to join and earn ICY points.<hr />- **Optimization Techniques in Go:** Insights from optimization methods, profiling, and performance assessment tools.<hr />- **User Spaces Discussion:** Pros and cons of using user spaces like BBG Grof.<hr />- **Event-Driven Logic:** Verification and compilation of program logic, machine instruction generation.<hr />- **Services in Grab:** Utilization of database image, complex system orchestration, and integration challenges.<hr />- **Solana Concepts:** Overview of efficiencies, transaction handling, and core blockchain concepts.<hr />- **Smart Contracts Comparison:** Solana vs. other blockchains regarding data handling.<hr />- **Injection in Programming:** Execution logic on data involves addresses and access codes.<hr />- **Server Crash Analysis:** Causes of crashes and impact on stability.<hr />- **Transaction Handling in ABM:** Discussion on mem transactions and frameworks’ influence.<hr />- **Multimodal Data Management:** Techniques for processing diverse data types, chatbot integration.<hr />- **Knowledge Sharing System:** New vector-based system for effective knowledge transfer.<hr />- **Old Records Management:** Strategies for feedback integration and referencing.<hr />- **Test Case Evaluation:** Creation and assessment of app performance metrics.<hr />- **Career Development:** Opportunities in consulting, project management; encouragement for team participation.<hr />- **Continued Learning:** Emphasis on knowledge sharing for team growth and project success.

567.title: Dwarves Updates
567.description: Hi, this is Han, the CEO of Dwarves Foundation. This month the Dwarves score 40th client that we have the honor to serve. And for that, we decide to launch the Dwarves Updates.
567.spr_content: - Han, CEO of Dwarves Foundation, announces 40th client milestone.<hr />- Launch of "Dwarves Updates" to communicate company learnings and updates.<hr />- Company compared to software; must be usable, useful, and continuously improved.<hr />- Focus questions: usability, simplicity, bugs, and solutions for organizational issues.<hr />- Updates will cover tech adoption and investment in team success, enhancing client and partner outcomes.<hr />- Introduction of Apprenticeship Program as an evolution from prior Internship Program.<hr />- Internship Program challenges: long onboarding, limited immediate impact, high turnover rates.<hr />- Apprenticeship: Six-month, earn-and-learn model for individuals with 1-2 years of experience.<hr />- Competitive pay, modern work environment, career guidance, mentoring offered.<hr />- Initial response to Apprenticeship Program includes fewer applications but attracts focused candidates.<hr />- Ongoing trials of both programs; updates to follow.

568.title: It's a wrap: 2021 in Review
568.description: Hey, it’s Han and Nikki in your inbox again. On behalf of the entire Dwarves team, happy 2022!
568.spr_content: - Happy New Year 2022 from Dwarves team.<hr />- Reflecting on a transforming 2021; resilient, innovative, collaborative.<hr />- Agile mindset: fail fast, learn often, start over.<hr />- Successful collaborations with notable clients: Setel, Momos, Mudah, Attrace, SP Group, Vietcetera, WeBuild.<hr />- Operational efficiency through automation: Notion, Basecamp, Fortress.<hr />- Focus on blockchain and Web3 technology; specialized team formed.<hr />- Gratitude extended to partners and clients for trust and collaboration.<hr />  <hr />**2021 Highlights:**<hr />- Milestones: reached 60 engineers, hired skilled mid & senior engineers across Vietnam.<hr />- Increased leadership roles, enhanced compensation, introduced Dwarves Token for rewards.<hr />- Restructured career ladder and mentorship for engineering staff; team training facilitated.<hr />  <hr />**Technological Advancements:**<hr />- Focus on Web3, Open Internet, next-gen AI, Big Data automation.<hr />- Onboarded 6+ blockchain projects; developed 20-person blockchain team.<hr />- Self-organized study groups within the Dwarves community.<hr />  <hr />**Business Evolution:**<hr />- Transitioned from outsourcing to software consulting; established tailored partnerships.<hr />- Engineers involved in project decisions and team-based deliveries.<hr />- Offices now in four Vietnamese cities: HCMC, Danang, Hanoi, Dalat.<hr />  <hr />**Vision for 2022:**<hr />- Propel Dwarves 2.0: blending quality with quantity.<hr />- Commitment to blockchain & Web3 technologies; fostering partnerships for superior products.<hr />- Emphasizing skill-building and sharing software development expertise.<hr />- Expanding the team, seeking alignment in values; open positions at Dwarves Careers.<hr />  <hr />- Anticipating numerous innovative products, meaningful partnerships, and new opportunities.<hr />- Forward-looking, embracing challenges as a pathway to growth.

569.title: Da Lat Office
569.description: It's Han and the Dwarves team again. Since June 2020, we've been planning on a new office/studio in Da Lat.
569.spr_content: - Dwarves team: borderless software firm, crafting impactful products across industries.<hr />- Dwarves Updates: document lessons learned, team investment, experiences shaping client success.<hr />- New office opening in Da Lat: peaceful highland in Vietnam, ideal work environment.<hr />- Freedom of choice in work location: home, HCMC headquarters, or Da Lat studio.<hr />- Remote-first success: improved client communication, organized processes, strengthened team connections during pandemic.<hr />- Employee well-being: vital in demanding software industry, especially with full-time remote work.<hr />- Initiative: upgrading WFH experience with small grants for workspace enhancement.<hr />- Positive team bonding: increased fun conversations, sharing new gear photos.<hr />- Philosophy: "every line of code resembles happiness, every software is a happy product."<hr />- Commitment to better working conditions: happier employees lead to better delivery and satisfied clients.<hr />- Small actions yield significant impacts on employee well-being.

570.title: The future is blockchain and data
570.description: Hey, it’s Han and Nikki in your inbox again.
570.spr_content: - **Introduction of Dwarves Updates**: Han and Nikki enhance discourse with new engineering insights.<hr />- **Discord Engagement**: #blockchain channel most active; driven by crypto trends and internal learning.<hr />- **Data Study Group Development**: Increased learning note submissions in Brainery validate investment in blockchain expertise.<hr />- **Leadership Highlight**: Thanh Pham discusses future-proofing Dwarves' designers and engineers.<hr />- **Dwarves’ Focus on Data**: <hr />  - Blockchain from 2018; data as the next focus in 2022, due to:<hr />    - Growing demand for data professionals.<hr />    - Competitive salaries for data engineers/analysts.<hr />    - Enterprises leveraging big data for business insights.<hr />  - Data market's potential amid scarcity of skilled professionals.<hr />  - Future goals: Data science, AI, machine learning integration for pattern recognition.<hr />- **Promotion of Learning Culture**: Weekly Radio Talk to discuss data-driven topics; community podcast for informal sharing and feedback.<hr />- **Blockchain Career Path**: Discussion on expanding career opportunities via blockchain technology.<hr />- **Learning as Central Metric**: <hr />  - Recent boosts in knowledge-sharing; community contributions recognized.<hr />  - Notable increase in Brainery engagement.<hr />- **Apprenticeship Experience**: <hr />  - Rigorous training for selected software engineers, with workshops led by industry professionals.<hr />  - Reception of constructive feedback for program improvement.<hr />- **Establishment of Dwarves Hubs**: Co-working spaces in Danang and Dalat promote communal work experience; open to all remote workers.<hr />- **Recruitment Reminder**: Company remains remote and continually hiring.

571.title: The Next Leading Chairs
571.description: We like the idea of labeling teams by what they deliver. Hence, the next chapter of Dwarves will be based on five angles.
571.spr_content: - Vision for growth includes celebrating 5 years of Dwarves Foundation in January 2020.<hr />- Core competency: Remote culture enabling productivity without physical constraints.<hr />- Values emphasized: Knowledge and People.<hr />- Key initiatives include:<hr />  - The Handbook: Represents company culture and future aspirations.<hr />  - ESOP: Incentivizes collective goal achievement by sharing rewards.<hr />  - Automation: Streamlining processes to enhance focus on core strengths (70 engineers to 10 operations).<hr />- Current status: Dwarves 2.5, team of 80, thriving in tech co-creation.<hr />- Expansion includes:<hr />  - 3 remote offices: Saigon, Da Nang, Dalat.<hr />  - Initiatives: Techie Story, Blockchain Squad, Console Labs, Pod Town.<hr />  - Achieved 46% growth in team size.<hr />- Next phase of Dwarves organized into five leading chairs focusing on:<hr />  - Partnership: Impact through strategic collaborations (Nikki Ngoc Truong).<hr />  - Delivery: Quality of output (Duc Thanh Pham, Ngoc Thanh Pham, Huy Tieu).<hr />  - Learning: Continuous growth and adaptation (Tom Nguyen, Hieu Vu).<hr />  - Communication: Transparency in information sharing (Nikki Ngoc Truong).<hr />  - Engagement: Unified vision across functions (Huy Nguyen, Giang Than).<hr />- Commitment to evolving organizational structure and embracing diversification.

572.title: Engineering Organizational Structure
572.description: It's Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. We're almost at the end of this year. While we know everyone is busy wrapping up 2021, we hope you're taking care of yourself and staying safe.
572.spr_content: - Year-end reflections by Team Dwarves: emphasis on self-care and safety. <hr />- Focus on refining the engineering ladder for growth and scalability. <hr />- High-level structure facilitates team expansion and resource allocation. <hr />- Promotion of senior engineers to leadership roles: enhancing technical impact and team responsibility. <hr />- Collaboration among managers, tech leads, and PMs to ensure unified engineering goals. <hr />- Introduction of a 60-day onboarding plan for new hires to streamline integration into projects. <hr />- Agility in organizational structure necessary for future adaptation. <hr />- Recruitment initiatives expanding across Vietnam with new offices in HCMC, Hanoi, Danang, and Dalat. <hr />- Remote work remains primary, but offices serve as collaborative hubs. <hr />- Growing presence in Web 3.0 with eight partnership requests and increased outreach for expertise. <hr />- Separate website for Web 3.0 initiatives established to avoid service confusion. <hr />- Community involvement through public Discord, tech event sponsorship, and weekly training sessions. <hr />- Upcoming initiative: engage to earn for Dwarves network. <hr />- Appreciation for community support and feedback on newsletters.

573.title: Engineer Performance Review
573.description: Here's another update from Dwarves for you. Throughout September, we have completed our bi-annual performance review.
573.spr_content: - Team Dwarves update: September highlights.<hr />- Completed bi-annual performance reviews.<hr />- Performance review focus: engineers, not management.<hr />- Self-review emphasizes growth, team view, professional aspirations.<hr />- Reviews conducted by familiar individuals: team lead, project lead, mentor.<hr />- Two-way conversation prioritizes comfort and collaboration.<hr />- Celebrate achievements; motivation enhances performance.<hr />- Focus beyond technical skills: leadership, collaboration, organizational contributions.<hr />- Goal: engineers excel beyond code for upward mobility.<hr />- Framework promotes career growth; target 3-5 years tenure.<hr />- Performance review every 6 months; aligns with goal achievement.<hr />- Outcomes: new ranks, professional goals, actionable plans.<hr />- "Senior" title criteria: full code cycle mastery, team organization, accountability.<hr />- Standards uphold quality; guides team development.<hr />- Future leaders emerge from current engineers; succession planning in place.

574.title: The Stage of AI and LLM at Dwarves
574.description: Here's another update from Dwarves for you. We are excited to share the real journey of growth and transformation since AI and LLM have been on our radar for quite a long time.
574.spr_content: - Team-focused knowledge system established; learning prioritized for all, not just management.<hr />- Increased team member engagement reflected in Dwarves Memo; growth in contributions and publications.<hr />- Ongoing investment in AI/LLM capabilities; journey towards enhanced efficiency and innovation.<hr />- AI tools integrated across all roles (engineers, designers, operators); improved speed and accuracy in workflows.<hr />- AI-driven project management tools optimizing timelines and resource use; reducing design-to-development time by 30%.<hr />- Automation in coding via AI tools; decreasing human error and freeing cognitive resources for complex tasks.<hr />- Commitment to R&D as a catalyst for ideas and innovation since 2015.<hr />- Focus on AI/LLM: learning and training escalated; adoption of various AI technologies.<hr />  - **LLMs** for diverse text-based tasks (e.g., content generation, complex query understanding).<hr />  - **NLP techniques** for text sentiment analysis and summarization.<hr />  - **RAG** for effective information retrieval.<hr />  - **Embedding technologies** for tailored content recommendations.<hr />  - **AI-powered analytics** for trend prediction and anomaly detection.<hr />- Engagement in computer vision and multimodal AI projects extending capabilities beyond text.<hr />- Knowledge-sharing via Dwarves Memo, covering practical applications of AI.<hr />- Development of AI-powered solutions tailored to client needs, maximizing efficiency and minimizing costs.<hr />  - **FornaxAI**: Enhances startup pitch quality and investor interactions.<hr />  - **Umbrella**: AI-driven project management tool improves team productivity.<hr />  - **Ascenda**: Innovative loyalty program leveraging NLP and ML.<hr />  - **Plot**: Streamlines media project management with AI integration.<hr />- Commitment to a research-focused operational model; facing challenges with rewarding outcomes.<hr />- Invitation for collaboration and shared learning; open to partnerships for experimentation and growth.<hr />- Update aims to inspire and motivate; forward-looking perspective maintained.

575.title: The Path To Growth at Dwarves
575.description: It's Han and Nikki from Team Dwarves. We're here with the fifth edition of our Dwarves Updates. October has been a wild ride for us as a company. Most of our effort was spent on rethinking growth paths for our engineers.
575.spr_content: - Team Dwarves introduces Growth Focus in October updates.<hr />- Addressing engineer growth: initial success leads to stagnation.<hr />- Code quality remains stagnant; faster execution doesn’t equal better outcome.<hr />- Common reaction: job change; cycle continues. <hr />- Company goal: long-term growth; new challenges promote development.<hr />- Career ladder importance revitalized; integrates with all engineering roles.<hr />  - Junior/mid engineers guided to senior level expectations.<hr />  - Senior engineers navigating paths to multiplier roles—mastery or management.<hr />- Encouragement of free-speaking and idea-sharing leads engineers towards consulting roles.<hr />- Consulting training underway; broadening perspectives—management, marketing, etc.<hr />- Team learning new technologies fosters collaboration; emphasis on tech trends.<hr />- Focus areas: blockchain, Metaverse, AI & ML; successful products launched.<hr />- Project screening criteria established; quality leads to stimulating growth.<hr />  - Emphasis on interesting problem solving, preferred tech stacks, teamwork, role development.<hr />- Shedding light on engineer input in project choices enhances engagement.<hr />- Ongoing initiatives aimed at workforce development; recognition of engineers as core asset.<hr />- Growth dedication links to engineer satisfaction and productivity; benefits clients and company.<hr />- Update concluded with positive wishes for the week ahead.

576.title: The stages of hiring at Dwarves
576.description: In today’s edition, job interviews need a makeover, the 4 stages of hiring at Dwarves, Dwarves apprenticeship 2022, other talking points
576.spr_content: - Dwarves ranks in top 100 of Financial Times' Asia-Pacific High-Growth Companies. Reminder of success amidst daily hustle. Gratitude to team, friends, and partners.<hr /><hr />- Job interviews need reform for a better candidate experience. Traditional processes often devalue candidates; interviews should empower them.<hr /><hr />- Interviews at Dwarves are collaborative, allowing candidates to assess fit rather than feeling they must " beg" for a job.<hr /><hr />- Hiring process consists of four stages, flexible based on candidate fit:<hr />  1. Tech capability as primary metric.<hr />  2. Avoiding overused interview questions that fail to reveal true candidates.<hr />  3. Involvement of fellow engineers for candidate assessment.<hr />  4. Encouraging candidate questions for mutual fit evaluation.<hr /><hr />- Dwarves Foundation Apprenticeship 2022 as key growth initiative: <hr />  - Goals to prevent burnout and career stagnation through professional development.<hr />  - First tech apprenticeship in Vietnam; aim for continued improvement.<hr />  - Program consists of real job experience, mentorship, and skill development.<hr /><hr />- Limited to 20 positions; applications open until April 25.<hr /><hr />- Dwarves Discord community grows, fostering tech discussions and knowledge sharing.<hr /><hr />- Announcements of Brainery platform for knowledge exchange and Engage & Earn program for contributor recognition.<hr /><hr />- Development of Dalat Chalet as a unique remote work hub, distinct from general urban IT centers.<hr /><hr />- Closing wishes for success, fulfillment, and supportive work environments.

577.title: The Stage of Growth at Dwarves
577.description: In this update, we are excited to share the real journey of growth and transformation that our team has embarked upon, as we continue to strive to become a more skilled and knowledgable software team.
577.spr_content: - Team update from Han & Nikki highlights growth and transformation.<hr />- Focus on techniques over trendy tools for sustainable skills.<hr />- Transitioning to full-stack engineering to meet industry demands.<hr />- Commitment to a 50% company - 50% community model.<hr />- Community engagement: <hr />  - 90 registrations in Golang course, 30 participants.<hr />  - 43 radio talks with global engineers.<hr />  - 10 tech events in partnership with Vietnamese communities.<hr />  - Learning site membership increased by 1.5x.<hr />- Enhanced team bonding through collaborative efforts despite remote work.<hr />- Utilization of Community Earn model and Discord channels to foster connection.<hr />- Partnership strategy prioritizes building trust and resources over traditional marketing.<hr />- Partners benefit from reliable introductions, expertise access, and collaborative resources.<hr />- Model tested since 2020, leading to project returns and network expansion.<hr />- Reflective opportunity to strengthen relationships with team, community, partners, and clients.<hr />- Anticipation for future growth and remarkable outcomes.

578.title: Project Compliance
578.description: This email is the third month we share about our journey to Software Craftsmanship.
