578.spr_content: - **Journey to Software Craftsmanship:** Monthly reflections from Team Dwarves, focused on project delivery compliance.<hr />- **Risk Minimization:** Prioritize eliminating risks in software development; impacts costs, timelines, team morale.<hr />- **Audit Overview:** Senior team audited projects in August to enhance resource usage and project success rates.<hr />- **Audit Focus Areas:**<hr />  - Eliminate unnecessary procedures.<hr />  - Identify defects and weaknesses early.<hr />  - Ensure team understands scope, objectives, and requirements.<hr />  - Maintain project progress without delaying clients.<hr />- **Technical Audit:** Assess architecture, database design, object design, and coding techniques systematically.<hr />- **Management Audit:** Evaluate engineers’ awareness of software and business context.<hr />- **Key Insights from Management Audit:**<hr />  - Importance of project value reminders to engineers; prevents slippage.<hr />  - Access to business intelligence enhances product ownership and motivation.<hr />  - Engineers bridging tech and business gaps; proactive in suggesting improvements and taking on responsibilities.<hr />- **Empowerment Culture:** Encourage engineers to see the broader context of their work; foster initiative beyond job titles.<hr />- **Ultimate Goal:** Build and ship software while enhancing engineers' understanding and contribution to the software development cycle.

579.title: Dwarves Ventures Fund 0
579.description: It all started when us, a couple of product people realized with our expertise in technology, our passion for outstanding software, we have the ability to uplift like-minded founders by helping them build and launch their startups. The idea became clearer when our network of makers, industry experts and investors broadened steadily.
579.spr_content: - Founders' realization: Expertise in technology + passion for software = ability to support startups.<hr />- Network growth: Connection with makers, experts, investors = validation for venture capital model.<hr />- Concept: Dwarves Ventures, a "by makers and for makers" VC.<hr />- 2020: Year of chaos, uncertainty, and adaptation for new venture; profitability was not immediate goal.<hr />- Focus on small wins and learning; valued unconventional, "founder-friendly" investment models.<hr />- Community engagement: Contributed to non-profit projects.<hr />- **Year Summary:**<hr />  - 9 team members; 2 trusted partners; 33 investment opportunities; 8 portfolio companies; 3 founder communities.<hr />- **Industry Focus:**<hr />  - Sectors: Healthtech, Foodtech, Proptech, Marketplace, B2C, B2B, D2C.<hr />- **Key Highlights:**<hr />  - **January:** Transition to remote-first team; commitment to startup partnership beyond financial investment.<hr />  - **February:** Covid-19 response with relief package for businesses, emphasizing operational support.<hr />  - **March:** Investment in healthtech startup Para; contributed to pandemic response.<hr />  - **May:** Added Airwatt for AI-driven energy solutions; reflective learning from challenges faced by PurchasingCare.<hr />  - **July:** Artzy joined portfolio, focusing on handcrafted eCommerce; steady growth throughout 2020.<hr />  - **August:** Launched Superbits, an indie software studio for tech enthusiasts.<hr />  - **September:** Partnered with Salt Cancer Initiative to support breast cancer patients.<hr />  - **October:** Welcomed Wego, targeting quality coffee market for youth.<hr />  - **November:** JoinPara thrived amid chaos, achieved partnerships and product launches.<hr />  - **December:** Implemented systems for improved collaboration and reporting with portfolio companies; reflective learning month.<hr />- Conclusion: Fund 0's journey was challenging yet rewarding, showcasing resilience and collective effort from founders, partners, and team. Dwarves Ventures is now established.

580.title: Dwarves Ventures Fund 1
580.description: In a span of over 2 years, we tested multiple models of investment with 8 portfolio companies.2021, we are finally confident and ready. Dwarves Ventures is officially on the map with our Fund 1.
580.spr_content: - **Foundation Period (2019-2021)**: Dwarves Ventures formed to empower makers and hustlers; feedback from investment mistakes informed new strategies.<hr />- **Investment Model**: Developed a refined, founder-focused investment structure, leading to confidence to launch Fund 1 in 2021.<hr />- **2021 Strategy**: Continue supporting founders in digital product growth while enhancing investment methods; focus on creating profitable businesses.<hr />- **Tech-Savvy Investors**: Emphasizing expertise as tech makers to add substantial value; primary investments in early-stage software/tech startups, open to blockchain.<hr />- **Transparent Support Model**: Offers investments up to $100k; hands-on assistance in product development, organizational growth, and gaining traction.<hr />- **Human-Centric Approach**: Streamlined process avoids bureaucratic hurdles; quick responses, fewer formalities, direct communication with founders.<hr />- **Continuous Applications**: Open to investment opportunities year-round until capacity is reached.<hr />- **Ecosystem Engagement**: Strong community connections with entrepreneurs, experts, and investors; expanding network to provide extensive support and resources.<hr />- **Collaborative Growth Focus**: Committed to working alongside founders towards profitable growth instead of merely providing funding.<hr />- **Call to Action**: Stay updated through newsletters; open to discussions with aligned partners and community members for potential collaboration.

581.title: Home
581.description: A collection of notes for everything we do and operate at Dwarves. This is where we keep our internal notes.
581.spr_content: - **Purpose**: Dwarves Memo promotes continuous learning and a 1% improvement habit.<hr />- **Target Audience**: Product craftsmen and engineers.<hr />- **Content Structure**: <hr />  - 💡 *OGIFs*: Curated list of recent OGIFs.<hr />  - ✨ *New Memos*: Displays the latest memos from the vault.<hr />  - 🧑‍💻 *Life at Dwarves*: Showcases team-related updates and open positions.<hr />  - 📝 *Changelog*: Records and highlights recent changes in the digest.<hr />  - 🤝 *Open Positions*: Lists available job openings for hiring initiatives.<hr />- **Engagement Options**:<hr />  - Join Discord for community networking.<hr />  - Contribute to development via GitHub.<hr />  - Explore career opportunities.<hr />  - Offer support through volunteering efforts.<hr />- **Technical Aspects**: Utilizes SQL-like queries to dynamically generate content for memos and updates based on specific tags and criteria.

582.title: Growth
582.description: At Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself
582.spr_content: - **Open Position**: Marketing role available at Dwarves, a tech-savvy company aimed at career development.<hr />- **Team Composition**: Dwarves consists of software engineers, designers, and innovation advocates from Saigon and Toronto.<hr />- **Core Purpose**: Empower innovations, co-create significant software solutions, and adapt to the tech-driven future.<hr />- **Key Activities**:<hr />  - R&D on new technologies with practical applications.<hr />  - Development of modern software solutions (web, app, SaaS, cloud).<hr />  - Investment and support for startup product launches.<hr />  - Assistance to tech communities via project support and event organization.<hr />- **Marketing Strategy**: Focus on inbound marketing to grow and engage the audience.<hr />- **Responsibilities**:<hr />  - Enhance company reputation and drive traffic.<hr />  - Expand audience base and set up marketing pipelines.<hr />  - Manage campaign lifecycles and reporting for management.<hr />- **Working Environment**: Flat structure, autonomy, and remote work options.<hr />- **Compensation**: Competitive salary, full pay during probation, education allowance, KPI rewards, stock options.<hr />- **Interview Process**:<hr />  1. Review applications and references.<hr />  2. Skills assessment (English, Writing, Logical Thinking).<hr />  3. Team interviews with Ops and relevant members.<hr />  4. Immediate offer for selected candidate.<hr />- **Application Instructions**: Email with position details, portfolio, and references to <team@d.foundation>.<hr />- **Resources**: Links to company homepage, consulting services, products, and community works available for exploration.<hr />- **Call to Action**: Encouragement to share opportunities or apply directly; willingness to consider talented individuals beyond listed positions.

583.title: Meet mentor Tuan Dao
583.description: Tuan Dao is a Senior Frontend/Blockchain engineer with 4+ years of experience known for his technical expertise in React. His mentoring approach focuses on creating a supportive environment where apprentices receive personalized guidance to develop their technical and professional skills.
583.spr_content: - Tuan Dao: Senior Frontend & Blockchain Engineer at Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- 4+ years of experience; 2+ years at Dwarves.<hr />- Expertise exceeds tenure; involved in diverse projects.<hr />- Principle: "Find joy in your profession."<hr />- Joy derived from ownership, learning, and reliable colleagues.<hr />- Confident in technical skills, particularly with React.<hr />- Role in Apprenticeship: Enhance apprentices' frontend skills.<hr />- Focus on adaptability and patience amidst evolving software requirements.<hr />- Employs 1:1 training inspired by his own mentor’s approach.<hr />- Aims to create a supportive mentoring environment for mentees.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation Apprenticeship 2022: <hr />  - 6-month paid work-study-training program.<hr />  - Designed for mid-level software engineers.<hr />  - Goal: Shape software skills and career path.

584.title: Apprenticeship batch of 2022
584.description: It's our second attempt rolling out this program. But the motivation stays the same: Accelerating someone's current software development skillset.
584.spr_content: - **Program Overview**: Focus on reinforcing the foundation for software engineers with 1+ years of experience. <hr />- **Target Audience**: Not for interns or veterans; aimed at accelerating skillsets.<hr />- **Core Components**: <hr />  - Software Development Practices<hr />  - Real-project Scenarios<hr />  - Engineering Work Ethics & Principles<hr />- **Selection Criteria**: <hr />  - Real-work experience<hr />  - Open-minded attitude<hr />  - Can-do mindset<hr />  - Learning spirit<hr />  - Proactivity<hr />  - English competency<hr />- **Applicant-to-Apprentice Ratio**: 1 out of 20 applicants selected after narrowing down from 140.<hr />- **Feedback Mechanism**: Continuous improvement through apprentices' feedback; highlights both positive aspects and constructive criticisms.<hr />- **Outcomes**:<hr />  - **Knowledge Upgrade**: Emphasis on modern best practices and foundational systemization.<hr />  - **Continuous Learning**: Encouraged self-directed learning and sharing within the team.<hr />  - **Career Path Development**: Apprentices gain clearer career trajectories; examples of role transitions (DS to Backend).<hr />  - **Engineering Principles**: Cultivation of responsibility and ownership in work.<hr />  - **Collaborative Methodology**: Preference for peer-to-peer learning over traditional mentoring.<hr />  - **Team Environment**: Strong support system across roles and seniorities.<hr />- **Future Directions**:<hr />  - Establishing a new Data Team to address high demand for skilled data professionals.<hr />  - Preparing for high-value data-centric projects and discussions.<hr />- **Next Steps**: Welcoming the 2022 cohort of apprentices, empowering them to tackle larger projects. <hr />- **Continuous Growth**: Acknowledgment of ongoing learning for both apprentices and organizers, with aim to enhance future iterations of the program.

585.title: Meet mentor Thanh Pham
585.description: Thanh Pham leads blockchain initiatives at Dwarves Foundation with a focus on building web3 products. His mentorship emphasizes the importance of logical thinking and long-term value creation in blockchain development.
585.spr_content: - Dwarves Team shifts focus to blockchain technology.<hr />- Offering study groups and blockchain projects for growth and opportunity.<hr />- Thanh is a vital team member, welcoming newcomers.<hr />- The path at Dwarves starts with a passion for developing web3/blockchain products.<hr />- Blockchain is a rising star in modern software encompassing cryptocurrency, NFTs, games, and trading platforms.<hr />- Dwarves blockchain projects cover diverse aspects of web3.<hr />- Knowledge of cross-chain and swapping techniques is essential.<hr />- Understanding product requirements is crucial for quality deliverables.<hr />- Blockchain knowledge is vital for engineers' career advancement.<hr />- Blockchain transcends mere application development; it enables decentralized applications and ecosystems.<hr />- Blockchain serves as a burgeoning software foundation, offering a new career path alongside traditional engineering roles.<hr />- Engineers should note the importance of long-term value and meticulousness in blockchain development.<hr />- Quick learning can lead to oversight of critical product attributes.<hr />- Accuracy and a logical mindset are necessary for successful blockchain product delivery.<hr />- Successful products solve user needs and align with business goals to drive revenue.<hr />- Mentorship involves guiding mentees to focus on details and understanding errors.<hr />- Cloning project source code can hinder deep learning and understanding.<hr />- The Dwarves Foundation Apprenticeship offers a 6-month, fully paid work-study program for mid-level software engineers.

586.title: Apprentice program
586.description: The Apprentice program is a six-month earn-and-learn training experience for aspiring software developers to gain professional skills working on real projects. Participants receive mentorship, develop technical and professional capabilities, and learn state-of-the-art engineering practices through hands-on work.
586.spr_content: - **Program Overview**: Six-month earn-and-learn apprenticeship for aspiring software developers.  <hr />- **Goal**: Master craftsmanship in quality software development through mentorship and real-world experience.  <hr />- **Target Audience**: Individuals seeking entry into tech, especially from non-traditional backgrounds.  <hr /><hr />- **Learning Framework**:  <hr />  - **Engineering Skills**:  <hr />    - Proficiency in multiple programming languages.  <hr />    - Use of advanced DevOps practices: CI/CD, containerization.  <hr />    - API development (REST/GraphQL).  <hr />    - Effective code reviews and pair programming.  <hr />    - Development environment setup and production monitoring.  <hr />  - **Design Principles**:  <hr />    - Design thinking, UX frameworks, and information architecture.  <hr />    - Application of visual and atomic design principles.  <hr />  - **Team Collaboration**:  <hr />    - Understanding team structures and communication dynamics.  <hr />    - Ethics in software engineering.  <hr />  - **Quality Metrics**:  <hr />    - Identifying well-crafted software characteristics and managing risks.  <hr />  - **Industry Trends**:  <hr />    - Insights into software evolution, agile methodologies, and tech innovations (e.g., AI/ML, blockchain).  <hr />  - **Career Development**:  <hr />    - Identifying personal strengths and career paths in tech.  <hr /><hr />- **Program Timeline**:  <hr />  - **Month 1**: Onboarding and foundational training; pair programming practice.  <hr />  - **Months 2-4**: Integration into product teams, mentoring sessions, and teamwork application.  <hr />  - **Final Month**: Group studies, technology evaluations, impactful projects, and program completion review.  <hr /><hr />- **Application Process**: Open to those aiming to excel in quality software shipping across diverse backgrounds. Apply via designated link.

587.title: Life at Dwarves
587.description: We build this company like we build a product. There are roadmaps for growth; there are phases; there are iterations. There might also be bugs, places where the company crashes because of bad organizational design, or cultural oversights.
587.spr_content: - Like-minded teammates pursuing ambitious tech goals.<hr />- Building a beloved workplace parallels product development.<hr />- Company roadmap includes growth phases, iterations, and addressing issues.<hr />- Advocate for changes focused on improving personnel.<hr />- **Education Allowance**: Annual budget for learning and development.<hr />- **Referral Bonus**: Incentive for recommending fitting team members.<hr />- **Work Gear Supplies**: Funding for work-related expenses.<hr />- **Travel Support**: Annual travel to Dwarves Hubs.<hr />- **Learning Sponsorship**: Monthly funds for knowledge inputs.<hr />- **Healthcare Package**: Comprehensive annual healthcare coverage.<hr />- Learning as the guiding principle; value placed on personal growth.<hr />- **Radio Talks**: Weekly knowledge-sharing sessions.<hr />- **Dwarves Memo**: Sharing practical case studies and insights.<hr />- **Lecturer Training**: University-led sessions for workstyle enhancement.<hr />- **Tech Events**: Monthly engagements with global tech talents.<hr />- **TIL Channels**: Daily sharing of tips and news.<hr />- Celebrating growth stories and achievements of team members.<hr />- Delivering challenging products using advanced technology and Agile methodology.<hr />- Development phases organized into sprints, V-model testing employed.<hr />- **Dwarves Playbook**: Guide including ethics, principles, and protocols.<hr />- Focus on effective product design, production practices, and business processes.<hr />- Commitment to community support through campaigns and sponsorships.<hr />- Engagement with communities like Golang Vietnam and WeBuild Community.<hr />- Partnership with initiatives like Techie Story and Startup.vn.

588.title: Culture Handbook
588.description: Keep learning and growing. We started this team out of software practice advancement.
588.spr_content: - **Continuous Growth**: Emphasize learning and adaptation; knowledge, like software, must evolve for future utility.  <hr />- **Purpose-driven**: Every action should reflect a clear purpose; prioritize value delivery over mere effort.  <hr />- **Effectiveness Over Productivity**: Focus on high-value tasks; avoid busyness; effectiveness fosters open time for innovation.  <hr />- **Simplicity is Key**: Use straightforward language and solutions; simplicity enhances understanding.  <hr />- **Extra Effort Matters**: Go beyond minimum requirements; small additional efforts lead to significant impacts.  <hr />- **Long-term Thinking**: Consider future consequences of current choices; all actions affect long-term outcomes.  <hr />- **Pay It Forward**: Foster collaborative culture; mentoring and sharing knowledge enhances collective progress.  <hr />- **Shared Goals**: Align team efforts towards common objectives to enhance synergy and execution.  <hr />- **Value Different Perspectives**: Embrace diversity in thought and experience; it enriches problem-solving approaches.  <hr />- **Collaborative Decision-Making**: Foster team input; support individual improvement while prioritizing collective benefits.  <hr />- **Software's Transformational Role**: Acknowledge software's ongoing world-changing influence; commit to future tech innovations like Web3 and AI.  <hr />- **Engineering Discipline**: Ensure structured collaboration; adherence to software engineering principles enhances software quality and long-term viability.

589.title: Join the Dwarves
589.description: This page welcomes you to join Dwarves Foundation, a team crafting innovative software with a focus on quality and community. Learn about open roles, perks, and how to apply to become part of our woodland crew.
589.spr_content: - Forge a band of skilled craftspeople to shape the future.<hr />- Craft software, design, and ideas with purpose and care.<hr />- Building the future is a collaborative process, akin to constructing a sturdy longhouse.<hr />- Join a team passionate about technology, quality, and kindness.<hr />- Open positions for engineers, designers, marketers, and learners.<hr />- Apprenticeship program available for individuals with at least one year of experience.<hr />- Focus on professional growth and well-being of team members.<hr />- Transparent compensation and trusted work environment; measure success by results.<hr />- Complete meaningful projects for notable clients like Setel, Momos, and Chotot.<hr />- Contribute to open-source projects and community initiatives.<hr />- Thrive in a supportive culture, with emphasis on personal and professional development.<hr />- Seek members who are fast-paced, love their craft, articulate in their skills, and promote team harmony.<hr />- Emphasis on continuous learning and facing challenges in a growth-oriented atmosphere.<hr />- Application process includes skills showcase, vision discussion, and mutual fit assessment.<hr />- Aim to craft enduring software with a collaborative crew.

590.title: The Manifesto
590.description: Quality exists in every piece of work. We thrive to deliver the best because we can.
590.spr_content: - Quality is intrinsic to all work; strive for excellence because capability exists.<hr />- Well-crafted software reflects expertise; pride comes from high-quality, defect-free products.<hr />- Quality is paramount; mismanagement leads to project failure. Crafting software necessitates time, effort, discipline, and systematic methods.<hr />- Attention to small details drives significant success; detail-oriented practices refine software and minimize bugs.<hr />- In uncertainty, choose simple solutions to address complexities; focus on practicality rather than intricacy.<hr />- Software evolves rapidly; ensure new technology offers tangible value over current solutions before adoption.<hr />- Solid foundations are crucial for good software; maintenance and extensions matter post-launch.<hr />- Engineering transforms the world; software development rests on discipline and maintainability.<hr />- Software is an artisan craft; engineers add irreplaceable value through effective solutions.<hr />- Diverse perspectives enhance innovation; prioritize the best ideas regardless of origin for continuous improvement.<hr />- Agile methodologies focus on better software development; we’ve established our version of the Agile Manifesto.<hr />- Minimize waste related to processes and features; eliminate non-value-adding elements to streamline operations.<hr />- Prioritize early and frequent delivery; prompt feedback fosters evolution and enhancement.<hr />- Embrace simplicity in complexity; prioritize human-readable code for reliability, understandability, and maintainability.<hr />- Effectiveness trumps mere productivity; prioritize meaningful work that drives value over busyness.<hr />- Adopt a fail-fast, learn-often mentality; continual evaluation and iteration foster organic innovation.<hr />- Continuous improvement is essential: story planning, sprint execution, daily standups, and retrospectives drive progress.<hr />- Lean thinking promotes people-first and value-oriented approaches while focusing on waste elimination.<hr />- Establish a delivery pipeline comprising continuous exploration, integration, and deployment for agile responsiveness.<hr />- Foster innovation by empowering creativity, validating ideas with customers, and pivoting decisively when needed.

591.title: Golang
591.description: As an engineer at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself
591.spr_content: - Opportunity for a Gopher position in Saigon with Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Team focus: developers and designers creating beloved products.<hr />- Company established in 2014, emphasizing craftsmanship in software development.<hr />- Current team: 40 members, average team size of 10, 5 years of market presence, influential in 3 Vietnamese Development Communities.<hr />  <hr />### Requirements<hr />- Must share company values ("DNA").<hr />- Proficient with Linux/Mac.<hr />- Knowledgeable in Agile and Scrum.<hr />- Experience with Golang and CI/CD processes using Docker.<hr />- Familiar with large scale web services.<hr />- Strong understanding of system performance and scalability.<hr />- Excellent communication and analytical skills; critical thinking for growth and stability.<hr />- Proficient in writing unit and integration tests.<hr />  <hr />### Job Responsibilities<hr />- Define engineering fundamentals.<hr />- Write maintainable code at scale.<hr />- Monitor and maintain systems for service reliability.<hr />- Collaborate with team on problem-solving discussions.<hr /><hr />### Benefits & Perks<hr />- Comprehensive healthcare including medical and life insurance.<hr />- Sustainable work pace: 40 hours/week.<hr />- No forced office presence; emphasis on quality work over hours.<hr />- Employee Stock Option Plan for significant contributors.<hr />- Flexible working hours with respect for team commitments.<hr />- Generous paid time off policy based on honor system.<hr /><hr />### Application Process<hr />- Apply via provided link or submit CV to designated email.<hr />- Include personal background, relevant work details, public profile links, project portfolio, and references.<hr />  <hr />### Additional Notes<hr />- Emphasis on skills over formal education.<hr />- Potential training opportunities available through an Apprenticeship Program.

592.title: Android
592.description: WE ARE LOOKING FOR AN ANDROID DEVELOPER TO JOIN OUR TEAM IN SAIGON. Join a team of developers and designers dedicated to creating products people love to use.
592.spr_content: - Seeking Android Developer in Saigon for innovative software firm Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Established in 2014, emphasizing craftsmanship and engineering culture.<hr />- Team: 40 members, collaborative environment with common deployment groups of 10.<hr />- Agile philosophy and Scrum framework experience desired.<hr />- Proficiency in Dart and Flutter is essential.<hr />- Passion and problem-solving capabilities required.<hr />- Communication and analytical skills necessary for system design evaluation.<hr />- Experience in unit testing important; Android development in Java/Kotlin advantageous.<hr />- Responsibilities: Engineering fundamentals definition, maintainable code design, feature collaboration, design/code reviews, front-end best practices communication.<hr />- Benefits: Comprehensive healthcare, sustainable work pace (40 hours/week), flexible hours, employee stock options, generous paid time off (honor system).<hr />- Application process: Short CV submission, details of relevant work experience, public profile links, project portfolio, references optional.<hr />- Education background not prioritized; skill demonstration key.<hr />- Apprenticeship program available for training potential candidates.

593.title: Full-Stack Engineer
593.description: We are looking for a Full-Stack Engineer who is passionate about building scalable, secure, and efficient web applications. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of both frontend and backend technologies, and the ability to work across the entire stack.
593.spr_content: - **Hiring Full-Stack Engineers**: Flexibility, remote work, meaningful solutions, talented team.<hr />- **Company Overview**: Dwarves, research-focused tech firm since 2015, profitable from day one, steady growth.<hr />- **Mission**: Build and ship top-tier software, operate tech teams, invest in ambitious talent.<hr />- **2021 Goals Achieved**: Seeking talented engineers for future projects.<hr />- **Life at Dwarves**: Collaborative culture, emphasis on engineering as a core value.<hr />- **Recent Products**: <hr />  - **Ascenda**: Rewards for financial services companies.<hr />  - **Fornax AI**: Startups’ communication platform for investors.<hr />  - **SP Group**: Utility distribution enterprise in Asia and Australia.<hr />- **Web 3.0 Advances**:<hr />  - **Attrace**: Crypto referral protocol.<hr />  - **Hedge Foundation**: Crypto account management dashboard.<hr />  - **Tokenomy**: Decentralized Community VC in Indonesia.<hr />- **Role Expectations**: Define engineering fundamentals, write maintainable code, engage in team discussions, maintain systems.<hr />- **Requirements**:<hr />  - OS: Linux/Mac<hr />  - Experience: 3+ years with Node.js, Firebase, CI/CD, shipping web apps.<hr />  - Skills: React, Vite, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, AI/LLM interest, system performance.<hr />  - Traits: Excellent communication, analytical skills, collaboration, critical thinking.<hr />- **Benefits**:<hr />  - Supportive team environment.<hr />  - Direct client interaction, freedom to impact projects.<hr />  - Work on meaningful projects, community engagement.<hr />- **Contact Information**: Apply via email for immediate response, talent welcomed beyond open roles.<hr />- **Join the Community**: Opportunity to engage with 300+ engineers and designers on Discord.

594.title: Intern
594.description: Working at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself
594.spr_content: - **Initiative**: Launched Summer Internship Program in 2018 for diverse candidates.<hr />- **Experience**: Focus on real-world projects; no mundane tasks.<hr />- **Objective**: Cultivate tech enthusiasts aligned with company culture and values.<hr />- **Mentorship**: Career roadmap shaped under team leader guidance.<hr />- **Skill Development**: Emphasis on craftsmanship in coding and skill enhancement.<hr />- **Compensation**: Monthly allowance of $300 for intern experience.<hr />- **Networking**: Opportunities for professional connections and competency growth.<hr /><hr />- **Foundation**: Dwarves Foundation, established in 2014, innovation service firm.<hr />- **Expertise**: Celebrates craftsmanship in software development.<hr />- **Statistics**: 5 years operational, 40 team members, 10 member average per project, 3 community influences.<hr /><hr />- **Program Structure**:<hr />  - Hands-on projects with experts; global customer engagement.<hr />  - Training in DevOps: Docker, CI/CD.<hr />  - Multi-language proficiency: Golang (backend), Agile/Scrum methodology.<hr />  - Version control mastery with GIT.<hr />  - iOS development using Swift; Android development using Kotlin.<hr />  - CLI proficiency encouraged, Vim or alternative editors.<hr /><hr />- **Mindset Cultivation**: Promote a "can-do-everything" approach; focus on problem-solving skills.<hr />  <hr />- **Application Process**: <hr />  - Apply in March or July via online application or email with a short CV.<hr />  - Open to all educational levels; potential is prioritized over formal qualifications.

595.title: iOS Developer
595.description: As an engineer at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself
595.spr_content: - Job Opportunity: iOS Developer in Saigon.<hr />- Company: Dwarves Foundation, founded 2014, innovation service firm.<hr />- Culture: Focus on craftsmanship, software development, engineering culture, smart team.<hr />- Team Size: 40 members, 10 per deployment, influences 3 Vietnam Development Communities.<hr />- Requirements: <hr />  - DNA alignment with company values.<hr />  - Proficient Linux/Mac user.<hr />  - Agile and Scrum familiarity.<hr />  - Strong Swift knowledge and framework understanding.<hr />  - Excellent communication, analytical skills, design proficiency.<hr />  - Critically assess system for growth/stability.<hr />  - Good unit testing experience, Objective-C knowledge is a plus.<hr />- Responsibilities:<hr />  - Establish engineering fundamentals.<hr />  - Write maintainable, scalable code.<hr />  - Collaborate with Backend Engineers on feature development.<hr />  - Engage in design/code reviews.<hr />  - Advocate for front-end best practices.<hr />- Benefits:<hr />  - Comprehensive healthcare.<hr />  - Sustainable 40-hour workweek; balance over hustle.<hr />  - No office traps; focus on quality work.<hr />  - Employee Stock Option Plan for significant contributors.<hr />  - Flexible working hours; respect for meetings.<hr />  - Generous Paid Time Off; honor system for absences.<hr />- Application Process:<hr />  - Apply online or email short CV to spawn@d.foundation.<hr />  - Subject: "iOS - Be an awesome dwarf."<hr />  - Include: Self-introduction, detailed position info, public profiles, portfolio, references.<hr />- Education: Formal qualifications secondary to capabilities.<hr />- Support: Apprenticeship Program available for potential candidates.

596.title: Frontend
596.description: As an engineer at Dwarves, you will be working closely with a team of talented, kind people and working directly with our clients. There is a lot of freedom to contribute to the quality of the project and improve, or prove yourself
596.spr_content: - Seeking Frontend Engineer in Saigon: innovative team, product craftsmanship. <hr />- Founded 2014: 5 years market presence, 40 members, 10 team size, influences 3 Vietnam Development Communities. <hr />- Candidate requirements: Linux/Mac user, coding passion, JavaScript proficiency, browser tech knowledge.<hr />- Essential skills: HTML/CSS for world-class UI, BEM/CSS modules understanding, JavaScript fluency. Frameworks: Angular/React/Vue familiarity expected.<hr />- Responsibilities: mobile-first responsive UI, collaborate with Backend Engineers, build efficient front-end systems, conduct code reviews, address performance issues, best practices communication.<hr />- Benefits: comprehensive healthcare, sustainable work pace (40 hours/week), no excessive office perks, employee stock options, flexible hours, paid time off (2 weeks + personal days + holidays).<hr />- Application process: CV submission, include personal/professional details, public profile links, project portfolio, references. <hr />- No emphasis on formal education; focus on practical skills and ability. <hr />- Apprenticeship program available for skill development.

597.title: Marketing assets
597.spr_content: - Organization: Dwarves Foundation Company Limited (Vietnam) and Dwarves, LLC (US).<hr />- Locations: <hr />  - Vietnam: 222 Vo Thi Sau, D3, Ho Chi Minh 700000.<hr />  - US: 131 Continental Drive, Suite B-2 Newark, Delaware 19713.<hr />- Contacts: <hr />  - Vietnam Phone: +84 28 2246 0246.<hr />  - US Phone: +1 (818) 408 6969.<hr />- Branding: See logo and icon at press kit link. <hr />- About information is available on the foundation's website.

598.title: How we hire
598.description: Hiring means we need help. We only hire people who tell us what to do, not the other way around. We always look for long-term teammates that why we want to ensure the new hire is a value fit and culture fit.
598.spr_content: - **Hiring Philosophy**: Aim for alignment with values and culture; prioritize long-term growth.<hr />- **Independent Thinkers**: Seek self-directed individuals who can drive their own work; not followers of orders.<hr />- **Core Qualities**: Independence, teamwork, problem-solving mindset, determination; essential for team functionality.<hr />- **Manager of One**: Self-sufficient workers who establish their own goals and execute them; reduce need for supervision.<hr />- **Identification of Candidates**: Look for self-sufficiency in past roles; evidence of initiative and entrepreneurial spirit.<hr />- **Purpose of Hiring**: Focus on creating rather than managing; build a robust, engaged team.<hr />  <hr />- **Hiring Process**: Multi-stage approach involving Dwarves team participation.<hr />  - **CV Screening**: Evaluate resumes and references for personality fit and background.<hr />  - **Pre-assessment**: Online test for logical thinking, English skills, and personality traits for fresher positions.<hr />  - **Assignment**: Practical skills assessment; discuss real challenges and approaches.<hr />  - **Interview**: Deep dive into candidate background; alignment of expectations.<hr />  - **Roadmap Design**: Discuss long-term vision and create a foundation for candidate experience.<hr /><hr />- **Alternative Entry Paths**:<hr />  - **Internship**: 3-month program for top university students; hands-on projects, no trivial tasks.<hr />  - **Apprenticeship**: 6-month paid program for underrepresented groups with non-traditional backgrounds; skill development focus.<hr /><hr />- **Referral Program**: Leverage Dwarves' network for quality hires; incentivize employee referrals.<hr />  - **Bonus Structure**: 2% of project service fee for successful referrals; fosters community engagement and growth.

599.title: How we work
599.description: We organize our work in 8-week cycles with a focus on autonomy and craftsmanship. This framework helps us deliver high-quality software while maintaining flexibility and work-life balance.
599.spr_content: - Team operates on agile principles; collaboration fosters shared understanding.<hr />- Emphasis on agile philosophy; adaptability to market changes prioritized over strict practices.<hr />- Scrum framework without rigid roles; autonomy and responsibility distributed among team members.<hr />- Temporary Scrum master role; team self-sufficiency developed over time.<hr />- Work organized in 8-week cycles, promoting urgency and defined project scopes.<hr />- Breaching projects into manageable tasks prevents scope creep; task bundling enhances clarity.<hr />- Fixed timeframes act as budget for pragmatic discussions; reducing scope prioritized over extended hours.<hr />- One-week cooldown periods between cycles for backlogs, bug fixes, and prioritization.<hr />- "Pencils down" policy at cycle ends; preparation for launches should begin by week 4.<hr />- Structured meetings: <hr />  - All-hands meetings for team reviews and prioritization.<hr />  - Functional team meetings on last Fridays of each month.<hr />  - Project-specific meetings include Sprint Planning and Retrospectives.<hr />- Communication streamlined through daily updates, weekly intentions, heartbeats, and kickoffs.<hr />- Everyone encouraged to pitch ideas for features or improvements; realistic expectations on influence.<hr />- Pitches evaluated by Han and An for upcoming cycles.<hr />- Open channels for raising concerns; direct conversations encouraged, interventions available as needed.<hr />- Check-in questions foster organic relationship building; no pressure for responses.<hr />- Self-management valued; "managers of one" expected at senior levels.<hr />- Remote-first work culture promotes work-life balance; flexibility to choose work environments.<hr />- Responsibility tied to trust in technical expertise delivery.<hr />- Careful onboarding to ensure understanding of project types and specific expectations.<hr />- Craftsmanship philosophy guides development; emphasizes responsibility, quality, and professionalism.

600.title: Security rules
600.description: Keeping laptops and phones secure is vitally important. We're a software company and many of us have access to secure systems (both our own and our customers). The following guidelines apply to how we physically secure our laptops and mobile devices that may contain customer or user data.
600.spr_content: - Importance of securing laptops and phones for data protection.<hr />- Guidelines for physical security of devices with customer/user data.<hr />- General security measures: Note serial numbers, strong passwords, use two-factor authentication.<hr />- Maintain up-to-date operating systems and applications. <hr />- Lock devices when unattended; avoid leaving them in unsecured areas.<hr />- Install tracking and remote data wipe tools like Prey.<hr />- Desktop security: <hr />  - Encrypt hard drives; set firmware (Mac) or BIOS (non-Mac) passwords.<hr />  - Disable automatic login; enable auto logout after inactivity.<hr />  - Require passwords after screensaver/sleep; use only company laptops or follow BYOD policy.<hr />  - Enable iCloud/Find My Mac.<hr />- Mobile device options: <hr />  - Avoid company accounts on personal devices or follow mobile security checklist.<hr />  - Disable fingerprint login or enable TouchID; create a strong passcode.<hr />  - Enable auto lock after 5 minutes.<hr />- Password management:<hr />  - Use unique passwords for each account.<hr />  - Utilize tools like pwgen or 1password for random password generation.<hr />  - Encrypt shared passwords with GnuPG.<hr />- Security reporting process: <hr />  - Report potential issues to security@d.foundation.<hr />  - Respond promptly, confirm receipt, and provide PGP key information.

601.title: What we stand for
601.description: How we empower innovation through software craftsmanship and build products that matter
601.spr_content: - Constant innovation drives startup formation; pursuit of vision impacts lives, economic growth.<hr />- Founders face challenges: business development, legalities, fundraising, team building, product development.<hr />- Quick iteration often leads to "breaking things"; necessity for speed in a competitive landscape.<hr />- Growth requires experienced teams; software expertise is crucial for robust systems and value delivery.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation emerged from service firm inadequacies; we reject "hit and run" approaches to craftsmanship.<hr />- Commitment to quality; importance of building products right for economic impact.<hr />- Since 2013, we've maintained high standards in software development, serving tech startups and entrepreneurs.<hr />- Partnership philosophy: collaborative creation of innovative products; value in long-term relationships.<hr />- Dwarves, rooted in Norse mythology, symbolize craftsmanship and expertise; technical knowledge over flashy displays.<hr />- Name reflects commitment to breakthroughs reshaping the world; emphasizes quality assessment pre-delivery.<hr />- Engineers' professional development centered on craftsmanship; teamwork essential for world-class product creation.<hr />- Innovation as a core value; collective effort essential for meaningful societal impact.<hr />- Unleashing potential requires imagination; Dwarves symbolize boundless possibilities transcending the physical realm.

602.title: Who does what
602.description: Figuring out who to ask about a specific issue or question shouldn't be a guessing game. This guide outlines our main areas of focus and who helps lead them.
602.spr_content: - **Question Resolution**: Identify relevant chairs or groups for inquiries. All members are approachable for guidance.<hr />- **Expectations**: Clear role definitions emphasize ownership and proactive attitude towards shared goals.<hr />- **Beyond Role**: Meeting expectations is the baseline; initiative and cross-role engagement are encouraged. Support for growth through expanded responsibilities is provided.<hr />- **Organizational Structure**: Focus on key delivery areas or "chairs" rather than rigid departments for adaptability and impact.<hr /><hr />- **Chairs**:<hr />  - **Partnership**: Relationship management with clients and partners. Key contacts: **Han**, **Minh**.<hr />  - **Delivery**: Product creation and technical solutions management. Key responsibilities:<hr />    - **Product Strategy & Design**: Direction and user experience design led by **Anna**.<hr />    - **Engineering**: Backend systems and applications managed by **Thanh P**.<hr />    - **Infrastructure**: System reliability and security overseen by **Quang**.<hr />    - **Quality Assurance**: Ensuring error-free delivery to users.<hr />  - **Learning**: Continuous skill growth and knowledge sharing headed by **Tom**.<hr />  - **Communication**: Internal and external narrative management, transparency in updates and public presence.<hr />  - **Engagement**: Enhancing workplace culture, team well-being, and career navigation. Key contact for workplace inquiries: **Huy N**.<hr /><hr />- **Executive Leadership**: <hr />  - **CEO**: **Han** drives the vision and strategic direction of Dwarves Foundation.

603.title: Making a career
603.description: Forget the typical tech industry churn. Here's how you can actually build a lasting career and master your craft at Dwarves Foundation.
603.spr_content: - Tech industry culture: Short employee tenure, seen as transient opportunities.<hr />- Dwarves: Aims for longer tenure (3 years average) to foster life-long career building.<hr />- Focus on mastery, not mandatory management roles for progression.<hr />- Six mastery levels in programming: Titles are consistent but criteria vary by department.<hr />- Important to recognize expertise at all levels; titles reflect demonstrated mastery at Dwarves.<hr />- Clear engineering ladder to mitigate feelings of stagnation and confusion regarding growth.<hr />- Transparency in career progression: Avoids ambiguity commonly found in flat structures.<hr />- Structured ladder components:<hr />  1. Engineering aspects:<hr />     - **Technical**: Craft proficiency, quality, best practices.<hr />     - **Execution**: Planning, problem-solving, ownership.<hr />     - **Influence**: Leadership, mentoring, knowledge sharing.<hr />     - **Collaboration**: Teamwork and communication effectiveness.<hr />  2. Career paths: <hr />     - **Individual Contributor (IC)**: Craft deepening and mentorship focus.<hr />     - **Manager Track**: Technical management, empowering teams.<hr />- Salary structure: Equal pay for equal roles, consistent promotions linked to level advancement.<hr />- Payroll strategy: Linked to revenue, targeting top market salaries (Vietnam).<hr />- Annual market data review with salary adjustments every March.<hr />- Structured performance reviews (July and January):<hr />  - Not punitive; aim for feedback, recognition of achievements, growth discussions.<hr />  - Process involves self-assessment, team lead review, and one-on-one discussion.<hr />- Feedback culture: Encouraged beyond formal reviews, fostering continuous growth.

604.title: FAQ
604.description: Common questions (and answers) about working with us
604.spr_content: - Dwarves Foundation offers a secure HR system for personal information updates via ops@d.foundation.<hr />- Equipment requests require filling out a form; maintenance issues should also be directed to ops@d.foundation.<hr />- Notify ops@d.foundation two weeks prior to relocation for updated shipping details.<hr />- Comprehensive benefits include health insurance and retirement plans; detailed inquiries to ops@d.foundation.<hr />- Business cards can be requested by emailing ops@d.foundation with required details.<hr />- Stay informed through important announcements, personal messages, and project-related communications on Basecamp.<hr />- Asynchronous communication is encouraged; urgency will be clearly indicated when necessary.<hr />- No formal dress code; business casual for meetings, comfort for daily work.<hr />- If missing a meeting, inform the organizer, update your calendar, and ask for notes.<hr />- Conflicts should be addressed directly; escalation to team leads as necessary.<hr />- Time-off requires a request via HR, with at least two weeks’ notice if planned.<hr />- Sick leave should be communicated promptly; no need to log unless exceeding three days.<hr />- Professional development supported through stipends, conference opportunities, and mentorship.<hr />- Company name challenging to pronounce; phonetic guidance available.<hr />- Dwarves Foundation values software craftsmanship, embodied in their mission to empower innovation.<hr />- Lacks a formal HR department; recruiting and training handled by the Ops team.<hr />- Flexible working hours recommended from 8 AM to 5 PM; quality over quantity is prioritized.<hr />- Employees can request proof of income letters through appropriate administrative channels.<hr />- Google Mail service utilized for team communications; virtual mailboxes for others.<hr />- Education allowance provides $300 annual stipend for personal and professional growth post six months of employment.<hr />- Bao Minh Insurance offers medical coverage with specific eligibility criteria; virtual cards for ease of use.<hr />- Payroll processed on the 1st or 15th based on joined date; Wise is the designated payment method.<hr />- Project bonuses based on client payments, distributed to project participants based on contribution.<hr />- Referral bonuses contingent on the referred individual completing probation and transitioning to billable status.

605.title: Dwarves as a community
605.description: How we blend software consulting with an open learning community where tech enthusiasts share knowledge, collaborate, and grow together.
605.spr_content: - Dwarves operates as an open company/community centered around software engineers, thinkers, and tech enthusiasts.<hr />- Focus on curiosity, collaboration, learning, and unconditional sharing in rapidly evolving technology.<hr />- Dwarves Network founded to foster a learning space while maintaining client satisfaction.<hr />- Community extends beyond company to include coders, students, and tech lovers.<hr />- Discord serves as the primary hub for work, discussions, and community events.<hr />- Monthly Community Calls replace traditional meetings, promoting open dialogue with contributors and members.<hr />- ICY, a blockchain token, incentivizes contributions from all participants, regardless of employment status.<hr />- Emphasis on an open learning network which integrates consulting with community knowledge sharing.<hr />- Fresh ideas emerge from engaging discussions; direction is essential to maintain focus.<hr />- Community care involves substantial resources; planning events and managing discussions is ongoing.<hr />- Trust built through transparency and a sharing culture; balance between client work and community growth is key.<hr />- ICY token system enhances participation and values quality contributions.<hr />- Culture rooted in openness, curiosity, and teamwork attracts like-minded individuals; onboarding new members is crucial.<hr />- Dwarves Network continues to evolve; key questions involve leveraging community for consulting benefits and measuring success.<hr />- Community channels include Memo for knowledge, Discord for discussions, GitHub for open-source, and the official website.

606.title: MMA
606.description: We measure what matters at Dwarves through MMA (Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy). This framework helps us evaluate growth while creating a culture where everyone can thrive and contribute meaningfully.
606.spr_content: - **MMA Concept**: Focus on Mastery, Meaning, Autonomy; measures what truly matters.<hr />- **Mastery**: Technical expertise, commitment to growth, pride in code quality, mentoring others.<hr />  - **Key Questions**: Are you a go-to for guidance? Do you seek improvement?<hr />- **Meaning**: Connection to larger goals, purpose in projects, community contribution.<hr />  - **Key Questions**: Does your work resonate beyond salary? Are you making a difference?<hr />- **Autonomy**: Initiative, independent problem-solving, time management, clear communication.<hr />  - **Key Questions**: Do you see and act on needs? Do you own your work?<hr />- **Practical Application of MMA**:<hr />  - Guides career development and personalized growth paths.<hr />  - Assesses performance: technical skills, alignment with purpose, self-direction.<hr />  - Recognizes excellence through roles (@labs, @sers, @chad); each role signifies growth and impact.<hr />- **Evaluation Process**: Balanced assessment.<hr />  - Operational effectiveness: 20%.<hr />  - Day-to-day performance: 30%.<hr />  - Leadership impact: 50%.<hr />- **Culture Building**: Encourages purpose, celebrates excellence, fosters innovation, focuses on meaningful impact.<hr />- **MMA Philosophy**: Measures quality growth, not just quantifiable metrics; nurtures an environment for thriving contributions.

607.title: 💎 Getting started
607.description: From day one to finding your purpose, your journey with Dwarves Foundation starts here.
607.spr_content: - Welcome to Dwarves Foundation; expect challenges and excitement.<hr />- Learn job roles; understand team structure via [who does what](who-does-what.md).<hr />- Clarity from orientation; reach out to your Ops buddy or manager for questions.<hr />- Remote work: privilege & responsibility; grasp [how we work](how-we-work.md).<hr />- Support from Dwarves buddy, Ops buddy, and manager available.<hr />- Typical adjustment period: two months to find rhythm.<hr />- Onboarding initiated in a Basecamp space named "Welcome, [your name]!" <hr />- Checklist includes submitting info, attending orientation, learning team roles, and setting up accounts.<hr />- Essential accounts: Discord, GitHub, Memo, Email, Basecamp, Fortress.<hr />- Probation goals: become job-ready and build team relationships.<hr />- Initial two weeks: smoother orientation; following weeks: demonstrate capabilities.<hr />- Bi-weekly review checks for progress assessment; opportunity for questions.<hr />- Understand and adapt to team culture: resource utilization, reading recommendations, and active participation in Campfire channel.<hr />- Respect comes from competence and self-management; substance over small talk.<hr />- Fortress system provides support through work buddies.<hr />- Post-probation: finding personal purpose aligned with team mission.<hr />- Dwarves focuses on innovation, exceptional software delivery, and co-creation of the future.<hr />- Fulfillment derived from personal purpose within collective mission.<hr />- Reflect on contributions to shared vision and intersection of talents with goals.<hr />- Goal: Transform job into a calling.<hr />- Next step: [You are Dwarves Foundation](dwarves-foundation-is-you.md).

608.title: Places to work
608.description: If you’re doing creative work, research suggests you’ll want to be surrounded by ambient noise. A café or co-working space is the perfect choice in this case. If you need to focus on a specific task, however, you’re going to want silence as [quiet spaces help us focus on straightforward tasks.
608.spr_content: - Ambient noise fosters creativity; ideal environments include cafes and co-working spaces. <hr />- Silence enhances focus for specific tasks; quiet spaces are crucial.<hr />- Tools: <hr />  - Coffitivity: simulates café noise.<hr />  - Noizio: customizable soundscapes.<hr />  - Rainy Mood: soothing rain sounds.<hr />- Color impacts productivity: <hr />  - Blue background boosts creativity.<hr />  - Red background aids detail-oriented tasks.<hr />- Large, open rooms with high ceilings stimulate creative thinking.<hr />- Home workspace tips: <hr />  - Create a dedicated workspace.<hr />  - Dress for productivity.<hr />  - Emulate a commute to signal work time.<hr />  - Establish set working hours.<hr />  - Schedule lunch breaks and respect days off.<hr />  - Stay hydrated for optimal performance.<hr />- Workspace resources: <hr />  - Places to Work <hr />  - Work From <hr />  - Coworker <hr />- Recommended cafes in Saigon for work: <hr />  - Camellia Tea & Coffee <hr />  - The Vintage Emporium <hr />  - Loft <hr />  - ID Cafe <hr />  - Kamakura <hr />  - C.On Cafe <hr />  - The Workshop <hr />  - The Morning Cafe <hr />  - Oromia Coffee <hr />  - L’Usine Le Loi

609.title: You are Dwarves Foundation
609.description: Every team member embodies our values and represents our brand in every interaction.
609.spr_content: - Dwarves Foundation is represented by every individual member; each interaction is a reflection of the organization.<hr />- Quang and Huy serve not just as individuals, but as the embodiment of Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Direct experiences with staff matter more than polished marketing messages.<hr />- Marketing requires collective responsibility from all members.<hr />- Communicate without corporate jargon; prioritize empathy over rigid policies.<hr />- Thoughtful writing is essential; consider the recipient's perspective.<hr />- Members are encouraged to contribute to the Dwarves Foundation blog, Memo.<hr />- Sharing personal insights enhances the foundation's collective narrative.<hr />- Word of mouth is a primary customer discovery method; community nurturing is crucial.<hr />- Every member's voice contributes to the community's growth and success.

610.title: Ventures arm
610.description: How we invest in and build the future through our ventures initiatives
610.spr_content: - Long-standing commitment to policies since inception; key for newcomers post-2018.<hr />- Venture investment model actively supports early-stage startups beyond core tech R&D and offshore services.<hr />- Dwarves Ventures team conducts careful evaluations for startup selections; not random.<hr />- Unique engagement involves acting as technical backbone; CTO roles and engineering teams provided.<hr />- Focus on helping startups in bootstrap phase to secure later funding rounds.<hr />- Emerging success rate indicates significant potential; opportunities for Dwarves to gain ownership stakes or discounted ESOP options.<hr />- Initiatives underway to create ecosystem for makers and developers; collaboration with developer and creator communities.<hr />- Superbits team developing market-targeted tools/products; commercialization in progress.<hr />- Contributions to products allow involvement in passion projects and ownership stakes.<hr />- Encouragement for personal side projects during investment time; potential for team funding and collaborative support.<hr />- Product ownership entails unique challenges; lack of predefined roadmaps and coaching.<hr />- Emphasis on self-management, problem-solving, and independent growth; substantial rewards possible.

611.title: 1-on-1 meetings
611.description: Strong relationships are core to our culture, and 1-on-1 meetings are how we build them. Managers meet with direct reports regularly (usually weekly) to connect. Here's how we do 1-on-1s and tips to make them count.
611.spr_content: - Relationships are foundational in Dwarves Foundation culture; 1-on-1 meetings foster them.<hr />- Each manager holds weekly 1-on-1s with direct reports; flexibility is key.<hr />- First 1-on-1 sets the stage for collaboration; alignment on expectations is crucial.<hr />- Utilize Lara Hogan's questions for initial discussion; clarify meeting purpose beyond project updates.<hr />- Prepare an agenda focused on the mentee; they steer the conversation.<hr />- Post-meeting, document notes and action items; review for accountability.<hr />- In-meeting focus: listen and understand; create a safe space for honest dialogue.<hr />- Transition from formal to conversational setting enhances outcomes.<hr />- Discussion topics include:<hr />  - Big picture awareness; insights into company direction and changes.<hr />  - Feedback for growth; performance evaluation and expectation clarity.<hr />  - Career aspirations; skill development and future role exploration.<hr />  - Personal connection; occasional non-work topics strengthen relationships.<hr />- Meeting logistics: Aim for weekly, 30-minute sessions; don't exceed two weeks between meetings.<hr />- Treat 1-on-1s as a priority; avoid cancellations to maintain relationship integrity.

612.title: Configure your company email
612.description: A step-by-step guide to setting up your @d.foundation email alias to send and receive mail directly within your personal Gmail account.
612.spr_content: - **Objective**: Send emails from a team alias using a personal Gmail account.<hr />- **Requirement**: Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) on Google account for security.<hr />- **Step 1**: Enable 2FA on personal Google account via [Google's 2FA setup page](https://www.google.com/landing/2step/).<hr />- **Step 2**: Create an app password for secure mail access:<hr />  - Navigate to Google Account's [App Passwords](https://security.google.com/settings/security/apppasswords).<hr />  - Select app as **Mail**, device as **Mac**.<hr />  - Generate a 16-character password, copy and save temporarily.<hr />- **Step 3**: Add company email to Gmail:<hr />  - Access Gmail settings -> **Accounts and Import**.<hr />  - Click **Add another email address** under "Send mail as".<hr />- **Step 4**: Enter sender details:<hr />  - Provide desired **Name** and full **Email address** (`your.name@d.foundation`).<hr />  - **Uncheck** "Treat as an alias".<hr />- **Step 5**: Configure SMTP server:<hr />  - Set **SMTP Server** to `smtp.gmail.com`, port to **587**, using full personal Gmail address and app password.<hr />  - Enable **Secured connection using TLS**.<hr />- **Step 6**: Confirm ownership:<hr />  - Check personal Gmail inbox for confirmation email, copy code, and verify in popup.<hr />- **Step 7**: Start sending from alias: Use "From" dropdown to select `@d.foundation` address when composing.<hr />- **Step 8 (Optional)**: Send from Mac Mail app:<hr />  - Adjust Mail app settings to add alias via **Account Information** and **Server Settings**.<hr />  - Select alias from "From" dropdown in new messages. <hr /><hr />- **Tip**: Configure reply settings in Gmail to respond from the same address or personal address.

613.title: Effective meetings
613.description: To make working together flexible and productive, we follow a few simple rules for meetings and group work. Here's how we keep meetings effective.
613.spr_content: - Promote flexibility and productivity in remote collaboration through structured meeting rules. <hr />- Use appropriate scheduling tools for organizational clarity.<hr />  - Schedule internal meetings on Basecamp and notify participants.<hr />  - For external meetings, schedule on Basecamp and send Google Calendar invite.<hr />- Start meetings on time to respect everyone's schedule. <hr />  - Leaders initiate promptly; attendees should join ready.<hr />- Maintain core meeting hours between 10 am and 4 pm; schedule meetings 24 hours in advance.<hr />  - For meetings outside core hours, schedule at least a week in advance.<hr />- Offer a video option for enhanced connection, especially with remote participants.<hr />  - Provide video links before meetings; remote attendees should join early.<hr />  - Ideal setups include quiet spaces and stable internet connections; phone-only participation should be limited by organizer's discretion.<hr />- Foster responsibility and collaboration during meetings.<hr />  - Encourage contributions from all team members; voice disagreements constructively.<hr />  - After decisions, everyone commits to the agreed plan without deviation. <hr />- Ensure essential meeting conditions for remote collaboration.<hr />  - Secure a reliable internet connection to minimize delays.<hr />  - Choose quiet spaces to facilitate focus and eliminate disturbances. <hr />- Prepare for successful meetings or pair programming sessions by meeting these essentials.

614.title: How to conduct a meeting
614.description: Meetings are important, but they need structure to be productive. This guide covers the essentials for running meetings smoothly, respecting everyone's time, and getting things done.
614.spr_content: - Meetings are essential for information sharing and issue resolution but can waste time if poorly managed. <hr />- Establish a clear process for productivity.<hr />  <hr />**Scheduling & Logistics**<hr />- Provide meeting notice at least one day in advance.<hr />- Create and share a video link (e.g., Google Meet).<hr />- Sync the meeting with the relevant Basecamp schedule.<hr />- Ensure all participants are informed.<hr /><hr />**Clear Agenda**<hr />- A specific, detailed agenda prevents aimless discussions.<hr />- The host must state discussion topics clearly.<hr />- Attendees should come prepared with insights on agenda items.<hr />- A clear agenda results in clear outcomes.<hr /><hr />**Participant Confirmation**<hr />- Confirm attendance (or absence) via the invite at least three hours prior.<hr />- Notify the organizer if unable to attend on the same day as the invite.<hr /><hr />**Meeting Notes (Minutes)**<hr />- Capture discussions and decisions for official record-keeping.<hr />- Notes should document: decisions made, required actions, owners, and deadlines.<hr />- Anyone can take notes, not just a designated secretary.<hr />  <hr />**Good Meeting Notes Include:**<hr />- Date, time, and location/video link<hr />- Meeting purpose<hr />- Attendee list (and absentees)<hr />- Agenda items discussed<hr />- Decisions reached<hr />- Action items with owners and due dates<hr />- Follow-up meeting details.

615.title: Reimbursement
615.description: Sometimes the situation calls for realtime payment. Team lunch, device purchase, house cleaning, monthly drinking water. Normally, we pay it forward and claim those expense later. The reimbursement will be included in your payroll of that month.
615.spr_content: - Realtime payments are necessary for specific situations.<hr />- Examples: team lunch, device purchases, house cleaning, monthly drinking water.<hr />- Standard practice: pay upfront, claim reimbursement later.<hr />- Reimbursements are processed through monthly payroll.<hr />- Follow this request format: Basecamp > Woodland > [Request](https://3.basecamp.com/4108948/buckets/9403032/todolists/1557155199).

616.title: Continuing education allowance
616.description: You will always grow by learning and playing with new and cool technologies. From books to conferences, you’ll get a yearly budget for your learning and development goals.
616.spr_content: - Continuous growth through learning and technology exploration.<hr />- Annual budget for professional and personal development.<hr />- $300 stipend for classes to enhance skills and enrich personal interests.<hr />- Flexibility in course selection, e.g., career-related or hobbies (photography, music).<hr />- Available to full-time Dwarfs after 6 months of employment.<hr />- Request format: Basecamp > Woodland > [Request](https://3.basecamp.com/4108948/buckets/9403032/todolists/1557155199).

617.title: Password Sharing
617.description: How to access to team's password folder
617.spr_content: - 1Password storage for D.F. team management.<hr />- Access through team account: share among relevant members only.<hr />- Contact line manager or Operations team for access.<hr />- Operations account: confidential credentials for Ops Team only.<hr />- Strictly internal sharing within Ops Team for sensitive data.<hr />- Continuous updates of secret key to prevent information leakage.<hr />- Latest secret key stored on Google Drive (link provided).<hr />- Master password available upon separate request.

618.title: Our purpose
618.description: We serve a single purpose, to empower innovations and co-create the next big things.
618.spr_content: - Empowerment of innovations; co-create significant advancements.<hr />- Purpose-driven journey; begins with recognizing humanity's evolution.<hr />- Four billion years of progress: single cells to homo sapiens, spanning ages.<hr />- Civilizational foundations on production and creation; honor ancestors through building.<hr />- Vision: build an organization that fosters the next wave of innovation.<hr />- Create an innovation engine; nurture ideas; develop meaningful technologies.<hr />- Commitment and hard work essential; challenging but worthwhile path.<hr />- Aim to bring prosperity; create meaningful livelihoods; enrich future of humanity.<hr />- Today's efforts shape tomorrow's landscape; every action contributes to human-oriented technology.<hr />- Decisions guided by innovation legacy; focusing on impactful projects and team.<hr />- Joining Dwarves Foundation means participating in innovation and meaningful change.

619.title: Benefits & perks
619.description: Since most Dwarves Foundation employees work in Saigon, this section is written with that as the default. Some benefits don't make sense in other countries. We will try our best to provide comparable benefits and perks as it makes sense, though...
619.spr_content: - Dwarves Foundation employee benefits tailored for Saigon context; other countries will receive comparable offerings.<hr />- **Team Growth:**<hr />  - Continuing Education Allowance: $300 annual stipend for personal/professional development after 6 months.<hr />  - Conference Support: 50% coverage for job-related conferences; 100% if a guest speaker. Approval required via Ops Team with supporting details.<hr />  - Work Supplies Expense: Reimbursement for work-related purchases; receipts necessary for claims.<hr />  - Project Commission: 5% commission on project revenues procured by employees; may involve multiple salespersons.<hr />  - Year-End Gift: Annual thank-you cash bonus or presents, includes keepsake with spending inspiration.<hr />  - Monday Radio Talk: Weekly team sessions for knowledge sharing; contributor bonuses without limit.<hr /><hr />- **Teammate Support:**<hr />  - Employee Liquidity Pool: 5% of company value for tenured employees in case of sale or IPO, vested over 5 years.<hr />  - Employee Stock Option Plan: Purchase company shares at predetermined price; case-by-case discussions.<hr />  - Employee Referral Bonus: Monetary reward for referring successful full-time candidates; bonus given only if still employed.<hr />  - Employee Profit-Sharing: 5-10% of annual profits shared with employees post two years; forfeited upon resignation.<hr />  - Paid Time Off: Two weeks vacation, personal days, and national holidays; honor system for tracking days.<hr />  - Short-term Disability: 30 days off at 75% pay for illness/injury; up to 6 months at 50% pay thereafter.<hr />  - Flight Tickets: 4 domestic flights yearly to Dwarves Hubs, max 2,000,000 VND each, encourages hub visitation.<hr />  - Annual Healthcare: 5,000,000 VND healthcare package annually for check-ups and screenings; discounts for additional checks.<hr />  - Parental Leave: Up to 6 months leave for primary caregivers, 5 days for fathers; 10 days for twins, all at 100% salary.

620.title: Moonlighting
620.description: We support your growth through side projects while ensuring they don't conflict with your work at Dwarves Foundation. This policy helps you balance outside work with your primary responsibilities.
620.spr_content: - **Moonlighting**: Engaging in external, paid work alongside primary employment at Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- **Balance**: Important to juggle outside work without compromising dedication or performance at Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- **Support**: Encouragement for personal pursuits aiding in growth and fulfillment.<hr /><hr />### Acceptable Activities<hr />1. **Occasional side gigs**: Help friends with projects, irrespective of payment.<hr />2. **Speaking engagements**: Acceptable, provided they require minimal time away from work.<hr />3. **Side businesses**: Permissible if commitment is limited, avoiding impact on job performance.<hr />4. **Advisory roles**: Allowed if they pose no conflicts and require limited time.<hr />5. **Volunteer work**: Occasional contributions acceptable; full-time commitments during work hours are not.<hr /><hr />### Problematic Activities<hr />1. **Employment in the same industry**: Full-time or part-time is not allowed.<hr />2. **Regular speaking tours**: Frequent absence disrupts team dynamics.<hr />3. **Consulting competitors**: Creates potential conflicts of interest.<hr />4. **Aggressive self-promotion**: Seeking outside work leads to conflicts of commitment.<hr />5. **Diverting work focus**: Time-consuming outside projects undermining primary responsibilities.<hr /><hr />### Considerations<hr />- Evaluate if outside work is competitive with Dwarves Foundation.<hr />- Assess time commitment and potential disruptions to team needs.<hr />- Avoid conflicts with Dwarves' mission or job role.<hr /><hr />- **Guidance available**: Reach out for clarity on situations or opportunities. Talk to Han or An before decisions.

621.title: How we spend money
621.description: We do the business to provide engineering capabilities to help customers on their business. A part of the benefits package is the Stock Option Plan, and the money is the sensitive topic in most companies, but we want you to understand so you could commit your best to make Dwarves Foundation a right place to work.
621.spr_content: - Business focus: providing engineering capabilities to enhance customer operations.<hr />- Benefits: includes Stock Option Plan, financial sensitivity acknowledged.<hr />- Goal: foster commitment to Dwarves Foundation as an ideal workplace.<hr />- Compensation structure:<hr />  - Base salary: agreed upon in employment contract.<hr />  - Revenue allocation:<hr />    - Sales Commission: 10% bonus for sales team contributions.<hr />    - Payroll Fund: 50% reserved for salaries and taxes for all employees (dev, design, ops, growth, management).<hr />    - Operational Expense: 30% for office, facilities, events, programs, hiring, training.<hr />    - Profit: estimated 20% pre-tax; 5% allocated for annual dividends.<hr />- Encourage understanding of financial structure to enhance workplace commitment.  <hr />- Further details available in the [Stock Option Plan](stock-option-plan.md).

622.title: 🧊 ICY Token
622.description: Discover how ICY, our community token, rewards contributions and builds engagement within the Dwarves ecosystem. Learn how you can earn, use, and benefit from this innovative web3 experiment.
622.spr_content: - ICY promotes a borderless software community using web3 technology.<hr />- Established in 2020, it fosters a culture valuing contributions from all members.<hr />- ICY serves as both a token and a stake in community growth.<hr />- Contribution leads to earning ICY, enhancing collective success.<hr />  <hr />**Mechanism of ICY:**<hr />- Recognizes and rewards community contributions.<hr />- Earn ICY through diverse activities; exchangeable for Dwarves stock.<hr />- Encourages ongoing collaboration and learning.<hr />  <hr />**Valuation of ICY tokens:**<hr />- Value linked to Bitcoin (BTC) reserves in treasury.<hr />- Influenced by BTC holdings, token circulation, market demand, liquidity.<hr />- Two liquidity pools: one for ICY, one for BTC, with monthly Bitcoin additions.<hr /><hr />**Earning ICY:**<hr />- **Easy contributions:** Share knowledge, discuss tech links, engage community, invite others.<hr />- **Medium-level contributions:** Deliver talks, create research topics, generate implementation examples.<hr />- **Advanced contributions:** Leadership roles, tool development, lead research initiatives.<hr />- Celebrates community milestones such as birthdays and key achievements.<hr /><hr />**R&D Opportunities:**<hr />- Sharing tech links, capturing fleeting ideas, writing notes, conducting in-depth research.<hr />- Participation in OGIF sessions for exploring new technologies.<hr /><hr />**Usage of ICY:**<hr />- Redeem ICY at icy.so for USDC, Bitcoin, or in upcoming ICY store.<hr />- Withdrawable to personal wallets.<hr /><hr />**Technical Framework:**<hr />- Operates on Base chain; contract accessible via basescan.<hr /><hr />**Future Developments:**<hr />- Upcoming features: salary advances, improved Discord integration, direct bank withdrawals, ICY staking, NFT integration.

623.title: Showcase
623.description: Our weekly internal demo event where teams share their latest projects and insights. Learn about our culture of sharing, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
623.spr_content: - Showcase every Friday on Discord; internal demos for sharing work.<hr />- Open to all teams: engineering, design, product, etc.<hr />- Celebrates craftsmanship, insights, and fosters learning.<hr />- Inclusion for non-development members; visibility on progress.<hr />  <hr />- Characteristics of a good demo:<hr />  - Short (5-10 minutes), engaging, easy to grasp.<hr />  - Describe the work: purpose, significance, beneficiaries.<hr />  - Show working example; practical demonstration over code walkthrough.<hr />  - Highlight improvements: before vs. after visuals.<hr />  - Outline next steps for future work.<hr /><hr />- Encourage sharing of bug fixes, performance enhancements, tooling, prototypes, and design mocks.<hr />- Showcase all stages of development without restriction.<hr />  <hr />- Ground rules for positivity:<hr />  - No shaming; supportive environment for learning.<hr />  - No PowerPoint; focus on demonstrations, not slideshows.<hr />  - No selling; intent is understanding progress, not making pitches.<hr />  - No blaming; emphasize learning and progress over fault-finding.<hr /><hr />- Participation encouraged; coordinate with teams for preparation.<hr />- Discuss demo topics early; schedule with manager for sharing.

624.title: Earning with sidegig
624.description: Bounties reward community members with $ICY for contributing work that helps developers expand their skills beyond their usual focus.
624.spr_content: - Dwarves Discord network: Connect with friends, alumni, developers.<hr />- Bounties: Tasks rewarding contributions with $ICY token.<hr />- Skill expansion: Tasks often outside primary expertise for learning opportunities.<hr />  <hr />- Participants: Open to any skilled developers.<hr />- Common skills: Writing, design, research, development, finance analysis.<hr /><hr />- Process overview:<hr />  1. Join Discord server; introduce in `😀・arrival`.<hr />  2. Check bounty board at <earn.d.foundation> for tasks.<hr />  3. Claim bounty via ticket in `🎫・support-ticket`.<hr />  4. Deliver work for approval; receive $ICY reward upon merge of Pull Request.<hr /><hr />- Monthly bounty pool: 1700 $ICY (~$2,500 USD, fluctuating value).<hr />- Rewards: Use $ICY for Dwarves swag or exchange for USDC.<hr />- Payouts: After Pull Request acceptance and merge into Dwarves GitHub.<hr />  <hr />- Objective: Foster a welcoming environment for contributor engagement.

625.title: Sharing knowledge
625.description: Sharing knowledge and skills is core to our culture. Learn why it's vital for growth, how it improves communication, and see guidelines for effective sharing.
